Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and location. Would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: tallgirl75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Milano after my Princess Cruise, April 15th. I had researched several options on Trip Advisor, and finally chose the Milano. I was not disappointed. The lobby is very nice and the customer service was great! I was in Room 303 - very basic - no view, but did have a large window. Very clean and a decent size, with round table and 2 chairs, Queen size bed, TV (only 5 channels but you're in San Juan!! What do you need to watch TV for??!!), air conditioned, elevators, hiar dryer in bathroom, full bath/shower, etc. I arrived 3 hours before check in, and asked for an early check in. The room I had booked was not available but they did give me an upgraded room which was ready. The location of this hotel is ideal - just walk out the door, take a right, then the first left, and you can walk down to the Carnival Port in 5 minutes or less. There is a wonderful Mexican Restaurant as well - out the front door, turn right and keep walking till you can't go any further due to police baracade. Turn right and you'll find El Parnaso. Great little Mexican Restuarant! Also, for a unique experience....out the front door of the hotel turn right and take first left. You'll come to a Jewelry wholesale store that sells all kinds of supplies for jewelry making - BUT they have an artist on staff so you can buy the supplies, and pay a small fee ($5) for her to make anything you want. I had 5 pairs of earrings made, that I had designed myself! The store is called Ovalop

Reviews.Title: “Old, but not bad!”
Reviews.Author: 143vrb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is right in the middle of the tourist area of Old San Juan and that is why we chose this hotel. The hotel is old, just like the city, but we had a good expereince there. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms are not fancy, but adequate for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: tinnie13
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is conveniently located in Old San Juan. You are within walking distance to everything in Old San Juan. It's comfortable and clean. The decor in our room was dated, so don't expect anything fancy. It just fits all the basic needs. We were happy with it and it was very convenient to have breakfast there in the morning. We stayed there one night before our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: val062
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was a little hesitant about staying here. What made me stay here is the price, it was a good price for a wonderful area (other hotels were the same or more and further away). I stayed for one night in beginning of April. Room: I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in to the room. There was a queen size bed (def. not European), closet, lots of space for clothes, a fridge and windows! although they were strangely placed at the top of the wall there were extra pillows. I could not have asked for anything better. Oh and the housekeeping left some chocolates for me!! The bed was comfortable, slept like a baby (not sure if its the bed or me exploring the city for 5 hours. There was no noise, as I had the back room, the only thing I would recommend is if you are staying during busy season get the furthest room from the "glass security door" as possible as it will make a banging noise every time someone comes and goes (I was right in front of it), but again not a big deal. TV had several channels which was nice, and I had to keep air conditioner on as it was a little too hot in the room (I was staying on 4th fl facing the back). Bathroom: Everything was there, Shower was good and there was another window as well. There was soap, shampoo, and hair drier. I was very happy with the room, the ONLY negative that somebody might find is the tv remote control did not have a back cover, so there was a tape there, but if you coming to explore Old San Juan and not watch TV you will not notice!! I decided to go wth breakfast ($5.30 was not included) on the roof. Although it was cheap the choices were as well. I usually book hotels w breakfast, so that I can eat twice a day: a filling breakfast and a late lunch/dinner. There was cereal, bread, pastries, fruits, and juices. Now I don't know if its a regular breakfast that hotel offers or if its because there were only 4 or five rooms occupied during that time. I would say walk a few blocks and grab yourself a seat at a cafe instead. Location: This is the only reason why I chose this hotel in the first place. Everything is around this place. There is CVS fifteen minutes from it, Payless on the next block (in case you make a hole in your shoe <from walking> ;) ), free trolley 2 minutes away, Coach store maybe 15 min, Cruise ship area 15 min. I basically walked around the area for several hours just exploring. How to get to hotel and from: I decided to skip the taxi and do it the old school by public transport. (no suitcase, just carry-on), if you walk closer to Cruise ship area there is a police station and the bus terminal, you grab bus 5 to isla verde (it will take about 40-45 min), there at the same stop wait for b40, or aeroporto(50) it would be 15 min and it takes you straight to the entrance of the airport. I would definitely stay here again!! The room was great, the staff was awesome and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Zorbina S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to a cruise. Since it wasn't a 'destination' hotel for us, all I wanted was a clean, comfortable place to spend the night without spending a lot of money. This worked out fine. Our room had small, high windows that I had to stand on tip-toe to see out of, and faced the rear. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Free wi-fi in the lobby area. The location is good - near lots of shops and restaurants. The air conditioner worked well, but was noisy as is to be expected for a room air conditioner. Since it was on continually, it served as "white noise", but if that kind of noise bothers you, you may need to look elsewhere (but all hotels in Old San Juan may have the same issue). There is a continental breakfast available ($5.25 per person) on the roof terrace. The food was mostly commercially packaged stuff - not that great, but the fresh tangerines were almost worth the price by themselves - the best I've ever eaten. If I stayed there again, though, I'd probably look for a local bakery for breakfast instead. Although the hotel is only a few blocks from the bay, our cruise ship was at the new pier which was farther away - it was about a $20 taxi ride plus tip. Fare from the airport to the hotel was $19, plus baggage fees and tip. Be aware that taxis in San Juan charge $1 per large suitcase and 50 cents per small bag in addition to the fare. We also stayed at the Plaza De Armas (Howard Johnson) on the way home - I'd say the two hotels were pretty comparable - I would stay in either one again for an overnight stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GHfromNorthernVA
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at the Hotel Milano. The location couldn't be better; right in the middle of Old San Juan and just a short walk to great bars and restaurants and major sites. The staff was very nice and very helpful with recommendations on places to see and places to eat. The accommodations are fine -- simple and clean, but not opulent. We rented two rooms for us and our teenage kids; rooms are a little on the small side but they were fine for two people. Hotel is reasonably priced and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jean Y
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to have your request accommodated if you book online. We stayed in a room without a window after specifically requesting a room on an upper floor--that has a window. We are not fussy but the room had a low ceiling with an on/off AC switch that blew cold air on our heads and without the AC there seemed to be little oxygen available. They told us when we checked in that there were no other rooms available and that if we booked online we got what we got. The desk clerks were extremely rude. BTW - there appeared to be other rooms but they didn't tell us about them. Because they would not guarantee that they would have a better room the second night, we moved to Hotel Plaza de Armas down the street which was much nicer, cheaper and friendly. To add to the insult, we had to pay for the second night at Hotel Milano anyway because we booked online. Be careful if you decide to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was like a coffin”
Reviews.Author: Will T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Milano for 1 night. Hiram at the front desk was less than helpful but that did not deter us from having a great time in old San Juan. We did get taxed when we couldnt find a parking spot. We called the hotel and spoke with Hiram. He told us to use the parking garage just south of hotel 2 blocks. We parked our car and when we checked out the next day and picked up our car the parking garage charged us 50 bucks for just an overnight stay! When we called the hotel Hiram said " Oh no thats so expensive to park there". So basically he could care less and likely doesnt have much customer service experience. The location was great but we stayed during the week and there was not much going on in town. Our room was tiny but we checked in put on our sneaker and walked around the town till around midnight. We were gone by 7 the following morning. There are so many cruise ships that frequent Old San Juan that the prices are the highest in all of Puerto Rico. We loved Fajardo, El Yunque, Guavate, and Guanica. Old San Juan is great if you havent seen it before and is nice at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location everything walking distance!”
Reviews.Author: Hellyeahtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Milano March 21, 2012 for one night. The room we paid for had no windows but you get what you pay for. The hotel's decor is old but it looks pretty! We went all over Old San Juan...Everything was a walking distance we went bar hopping walked back to our hotel with no problems! The staff is VERY helpful and friendly! Cons' BR was extremly small, my Boyfriend is a tough guy he needed more space! i give it a very good rating based on the price we paid at a great location, friendly service and ok room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: wingedvictory2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano for one night before our ship set sail. I was a bit worried about the place because of the some of the reviews here, but I needn't have worried. The lobby was large, elevator worked well, and the decor had an Asian flair. The room was spacious, the A/C was great to come home to, and the bathroom clean and tidy. The location of the hotel was excellent! We were in the heart of Old San Juan; many restaurants, shops, and the historical old walls and forts were all within easy walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful. They made sure we had what we needed and took great care of us. In the morning, we were treated to a filling breakfast on the roof terrace-beautiful views of the city! I would stay here again if I'm ever in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LWL
Reviews.Content: In mid-March, 2012, four of us (two couples in our 60s) stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Milano for a very reasonable price. We arrived early and found it easy to store our luggage until check-in time. The inexpensive continental breakfast on the top floor was nice, the coffee hot and staff friendly and helpful. The bakery items were of better quality than what is offered at the usual hotel continental. There is no coffee in the room, but you can go upstairs early (or send your husband!) to bring a cup of coffee, tea or hot chocolate back to your room. Lighting, outlets, temperature regulation, water pressure, hot water, and suitcase space were reasonable. Our room was quiet and furnishings were simple but spacious; security was not a question. Free wifi was best in the lobby downstairs, and average in its speed and stability in the room. We did not have a car, and Iâ€™d recommend waiting until you leave Old San Juan to rent one! This old city is very small (one mile by 2 miles), streets are narrow (think of Columbusâ€™ compatriots strutting down these streets in their conquistador outfits!), and the city proudly hosts all kinds of special events, so traffic is usually congested. The Hotel Milano is right in the middle of the old city, so you can easily walk to all points in a short time. Iâ€™d highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Just what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Ymichaels
Reviews.Content: We booked based on the reviews we read on TripAdvisor. We were taking a cruise out of an Juan. Perfect location in Old Town. So much to do & see all around the hotel. Lots of cafe's, restaurants & sites to see. Not a fancy place but clean rooms with super friendly staff all for a great price. Hotel Milano is on a pretty busy street but we did not hear much noise. So much night life & lots of touristy stuff too. $20 cab ride from the airport to the hotel, $20 cab ride from the hotel to port, plus $1 a bag.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bea P
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Had we not had to pay so far in advance, I would have left and gone to another hotel. We were not sure we could get a room somewhere else or if we could get our money back without a long wait and big hassle. The moldy smell hit me the minute I opened the door to the room. The carpet looked wet but I felt it and it was not. The airconditioner was horrible. I tried to turn it down and froze then turned it back up a little and it was hot and put out a lot of moisture into the air which was much unneeded. There were no windows in the room even though the pix on the internet showed 3 large windows. The "roof top restaurant with a panoramic view" was not a restaurant at all and there was no panoramic view. All we could see was old buildings and pigeons everywhere. We stayed there on March 3rd. It is now March 19th and I am still sick and on medication for the upper respiratory infection I got the first day at that horrible place. The elevator was a joke; there was no one to help take the luggage to the room; we were told to keep the glass doors on our floor shut and locked for safety purposes, yet everytime we shut them, a hotel person would open them and prop them open. It was easy access for anyone who wanted to break into our room. The TV was pathetic for the price we paid for that room, We found out the Sheraton just down the street charged a little less than the Milano and had beautiful rooms, cable TV, nice restaurant and a casino and a bellman to help with luggage. I could go on and on about how much I loathed the Milano but I think you have gotten the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: JPG_9
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel, which we enjoyed last year. We paid a year in advance, over $200 for a front queen, and had confirmation that we were reserved for room 408. Upon arrival there was an exchange in Spanish between the desk clerk and the owner, and we were given keys to room 308, obviously the room we had paid a year in advance for had been given to someone else. When we reached room 308 the air conditioning was not working. After several visits that evening to the front desk, we were told that there was nothing they could do and the only room available was a tiny, windowless room with a double bed. As my husband is 6ft 4 we had to make the choice between trying to sleep in the heat or sleeping with feet hanging out of the bed - the option we chose. In the morning, there was quite a struggle to get reimbursement for the room we had actually paid for a year ago and be charged for the inferior room we were alloted. This was not a good start to a special vacation which had been planned and paid for a year ago. We will not return to this hotel, even though we will visit San Juan again many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Restaurant/bar is closed except for a continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We were given a very small room compared to what we saw when we were leaving. The location is unbeatable, the staff was very courteous, thge air-conditioner works weel, but a lot of the online and print guides to Old San Juan rave about the great rooftop bar. It's been closed for quite sometime, except for a very simple (and cheap) continental breakfast , served by a very nice man who gave us a lot of tips about Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: cckingwood
Reviews.Content: As soon as you opened the door there was a damp smell....not a good sign for a tired traveler. The room was Nothing like the web site. I felt like I was in a prison cell. There were 3 small windows that were just below the ceiling to obviously let light into a dark and dingy room. The price was extremely high for the quality of room provided. The roof top restaurant, which is not active, overlooks old worn out buildings. Not overlooking the bay. The only good thing about this old tired out hotel is that the location is right in Old San Juan. But then again, there are some other great hotels that are deserving of the rate charged. Two of us left with terrible coughs that we had the entire cruise from just 1 night at the Milano. The building had water damage that they try to cover up by all kinds of deodorizing devices throughout but the damp smell is the tell all! Mold is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: stldebbie2008
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. Paid $200 night. The room was either FREEZING or warm as there was only one setting on the air conditioner. The air conditioner was leaking water due to condensation so it made the carpet damp. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: james k
Reviews.Content: Milano is a boutique hotel in the heart of Old San Juan. Walking distance to the Cruise ships and El Morro, the Spanish fort that guards the entrance to the harbour. The hotel and staff is small. They are efficient and helpful. There are not a lot of amenities, but they have a passable attempt at a continental breakfast on the top floor. It's NOT fancy and not up to the standards of a typical American chain. It's very old, but kept up nice. The rooms are small, but my bed was good and it was very clean. There are no bugs. The BEST THING is the LOCATION! It is literally in the heart of the historical district of San Juan. Many museums, the fort, plaza, ancient government buildings and an awesome waterfront with parks and fountains. Several of the best restaurants in San Juan are just a few blocks from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: mblbham
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here the night before our cruise left San Juan. We wanted to stay in Old San Juan and not pay a ton of money for a room. We had an interior room which wasn't huge (and obviously, no window), but it was quiet and (most importantly) clean. There was a continental breakfast in the morning which was okay, but not great, for $5 each. The breakfast was on the roof of the hotel however, and the atmosphere eating breakfast was great. We mostly paid for the location- we walked a block to a great restaurant for dinner and to both of the forts (although neither of us mind walking any sort of distance). In the morning we did some sightseeing after we checked out and were able to leave our bags there. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We did have to take a taxi to the ship in the morning however (I think it was a $20 ride). In the future, I would return to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano - Pleasant visit”
Reviews.Author: jppcrtt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Milano the night before our cruise and the night after. The staff is friendly and helpful. We met a lot of other cruisers at the hotel doing the same thing. The first night we had â€œStandardâ€� rooms and they were clean and neat but had no view at all. The windows were very small, about 1 foot square, and located high on the wall (about 7 feet up) only letting the sunlight in. The second night we had â€œSuperiorâ€� rooms (a bit more $$) and they had large opening windows overlooking Fortaleza St. As some reviewers have noted the rooms away from the front are quieter. We were there on a Friday and a Saturday night and Fortaleza St. gets active but we enjoyed the sounds of Old San Juan. We would choose the superior rooms again. In the morning you can go up to the roof and have a buffet breakfast ($10.00 pp) sitting either inside or outside. We chose to sit outside and it is extremely pleasant to start the morning this way. Old San Juan is a wonderful city that is pleasant to walk and Hotel Milano is a great spot to explore it from. Step out the front door and you can head up the hill toward el Morro or down the street toward the harbor. There are many shops and cafes to explore as you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annette A
Reviews.Content: Was so very lucky to have found this lovely, family owned hotel, in the heart of Old San Juan. Hotel Milano was a great find for us, affordable, clean, safe and within walking distance to all the sights and great places to eat. Our room was clean, cumfy and had all the amenties we needed, a/c, TV, telephone and full bath. Our budget was pretty small so our room was one without a view, but no worries, its actually just what we wanted, as we hadnt had much sleep prior to arrival. The top floor of hotel is a lovely terrace, with splendid breezes, and view of the harbor and town, where we ate our breakfast and sipped coffee. The owner and all the staff were more than kind and helpful in answering ALL our annoying questions with a smile. Their suggestion for dinner that night at Cafe Puerto Rico, was the best, as we enjoyed this lovely Cafe's authentic puerto rician food, and breezy outdoor dining. Look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: watergirl0153226
Reviews.Content: It is always nice to come a day early when going on a cruise and Hotel Milano is an excellent choice. It is located in the heart of Old San Juan, within walking distance of several restaurants and a block from the bus stop. We have stayed here a couple times and each time were pleased with the clean, quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Still remembering our trip in December”
Reviews.Author: Sillynanna
Reviews.Content: First I have to say that Juan and his staff have the patience of saints. I constantly emailed, called and bugged them for information, prices, and anything else that came to mind for over a year before our trip. Every single time they answered my emails with professionalism and friendliness. Gold stars for all of you! I know we drove them nuts with our in and out routine and always having to take care of our key. Like I said ....patience and professionalism. We had a great time. Our rooms were just the right size (Front Double, 409 and 406) with windows that opened to the street. We had no problem with noise even though we stayed on Friday and Saturday. Whenever we needed ideas of where to eat, sight-see, or just wanted to talk about San Juan in general, the staff gave us their undivided attention. Breakfast was wonderful and just enough. Even my husband had no complaints and he is a big eater. The only disappointment was that it was raining quite hard and we could not eat on the terrace. It was still beautiful and fun. We will return again the next time we are in San Juan, hopefully soon. Thanks to you all at the Milano for making our stay a great one! Rucinski/Marden-Anderson

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano - Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and very helpful. Rooms are big and clean. Excellent location if you want to visit Old San Juan. Neighborhood is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean place to stay in the center of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Rick049
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay at Hotel Milano. Since I was traveling solo, I opted to stay at a more economical place in the Old City. I was a bit concerned how good Hotel Milano would be, based on the mixed reviews it has received here. Let's just say it was as good as I hoped. The location can't be beat. It is right in the middle of the Old City, easy walking distance to all the sights and restaurants there. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The bed was incredibly comfortable; no problems getting a good night's sleep. Although breakfast isn't included in the price, it's very inexpensive and conveniently located on the roof top terrace, with a view of the Old City and the port. The bathroom was as good as could be expected -- no complaints there. Once I got the air conditioning going, the room was quite comfortable. And the entire hotel, including my room, was very clean and well taken care of. I deduct one star for the fact that despite asking for and being promised a room with a window, all I got was a room with two 1-foot by 1-foot slabs of glass high up on the wall. They really can't call those windows. Other than that, I was satisfied with this modest, economy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel with Quirks”
Reviews.Author: LMDominguez
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is in an excellent location on Calle Fortaleza in the heart of Old San Juan. It is a 4-story facility with adequately large, clean rooms, 15-inch vintage 1995 televisions with 9 or 10 channels and, in our case, a room with no windows - other than two-1 foot by 1 foot-slabs of glass 12 feet in the air. The air conditioning does not have a temperature control so it is either very hot or very cold in the room. The shower is peculiar and instructions on how to use it where not provided in our room. The staff is friendly, polite and helpful and will try to make your stay very satisfactory. They provide "continental" breakfast on the 5th floor restaurant of the hotel for $5.50 per guest. We found the breakfast to be lacking in food quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Lizbee13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano for 2 days before leaving for a cruise. The hotel is not the Ritz but is very clean and very convenient for Old San Juan. The staff is very pleasant and most helpful, which makes up for the loud air conditioner and lack of a window! Note, if you are staying here thinking you can walk to the cruise terminal, you probably can't - some of the cruises leave from the port across the bay so check before you book - $15 plus $1 for each bag to get from the hotel to the cruise port. Breakfast on the roof was nice and the waiter was extremely welcoming. Good restaurants very close to the hotel - as I said, not the Ritz but adequate. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: Randy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here before our cruise. Very clean rooms and the staff was most helpful. Rigth in the heart of the city close to everything. Would use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Old San Juan, reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ashes26_12
Reviews.Content: Convenient to free trolley and restaurants. Cost $174 including breakfast. Friendly, helpful staff. $5 breakfast more than adequate. Through the hotel, signed up for E and B tour of the El Junque rain forest and Luquillo Beach--lunch on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Best overnight stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Lovelake
Reviews.Content: Flying in the day before our cruise, we found Hotel Milano to be the perfect place to stay. Located in the heart of old city, you are within walking distance of everything but a beach. There are fabulous restaurants, shopping (Marshall's is close if you've forgotten anything), and historic sites. There is a lovely walkway around the harbor entrance, cobblestone street and did I mention restaurants? Hotel Milano staff is bilingual, friendly and very accommodating. The rooms are small and comfortable. Breakfast is available on the rooftop, inside or out. Book reservations early as they go quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Nancy J
Reviews.Content: We read the hotel reviews when we were trying to decide where to stay before our cruise in October 2011. We were very pleased with our overnight stay at Hotel Milano. The hotel is very clean, the staff is friendly, and it is located right in Old San Juan so it is easy to walk around to the historical forts and other local tourist sights. There are restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. We ate both breakfast and lunch at Cafe Manolin, a local diner with good food and friendly service. Be aware that if you have a front room in the hotel you will definitely hear the music and party sounds from the bars at night, so either bring earplugs or go join the party! If you are looking for a modern resort with lots of sparkling amenities, this is NOT the hotel for you. If you are looking for a quaint, well kept local hotel with helpful staff, this is a great place. Check-in and check-out was easy. If you are going on a cruise, they will hold your bags for you after you check out so that you can walk around before going to the ship, and they will call you a cab. They not only called our cab but went out and waited for it, helped load our bags, and made sure the cab driver knew which port we needed to go to. Price was reasonable too. We would definitely stay at Hotel Milano again.

Reviews.Title: “LocationLocationLocation”
Reviews.Author: Beverly C
Reviews.Content: High recommendation for small family-run hotel in Old San Juan. Comparatively inexpensive, walk to many restaurants, bars, shopping. VERY CLEAN. Staff is friendly - like everyone in the city - and very helpful. We will definitely stay there again. Be sure to visit bar on the corner and order pizza. Don't know from where they ordered it but really outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Touring Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTours
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, small hotel on Fortaleza St. in Old San Juan. Don't drive - use a cab. Clean, comfortable, pretty expensive for a double (but it was Christmas high season), no amenities (but you're in the middle of Old San Juan with plenty of restaurants and activities) and a very helpful staff. I'd return on another visit; it's so well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Django12
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Old San Juan with a friendly staff. Continental breakfast on the roof is a bargain at $5 and change.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a Motel 6 at four times the price.”
Reviews.Author: EP-Guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night before a cruise. Check in was ok but desk clerk not at all friendly, the bell man was. The room (at the front) was very simple without the charm you might expect being in Old San Juan. Having a front room meant you have a window, nice, but the noise from a nearby night club till the wee hours made for a restless night. Operating the air conditioner was a mystery, couldn't get it to operate at a reasonable temp. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crazydonak
Reviews.Content: We really like the location of this hotel because we spent two days walking the Old town of San Juan, it was very clean. It was a great place to stay for our cuirse. We only had to walk a few blocks from the pier. Also you can take the fairy to the other side to see the Bacardi Rum factory. Very cheep to ride the fairy 50 cents each way and only three dollars each way by cab. If you want to stay in old San Jaun this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights at the winter rate price”
Reviews.Author: HojasRojas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano is a great location for your first time to San Juan if you only have a few days and want to be in the heart of old San Juan. The rooms are decent and clean with A/C although there is a damp smell. The location is great and few doors down from the restaurant Marmalade (not to be missed). Some of the front desk staff are ok others are clueless so don't expect much advise or help with directions or things to do in old San Juan. The wifi works in the room. There is a $6 breakfast on the roof terrace (only open for breakfast) that we did not have so can not comment on the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Value go a long way”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireOldfart
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about some of the negative reviews of the Hotel Milano especially as we had paid for five nights in advance so read all the criticisms closely. Most of the negative comments seem to come from people about to start or having just ended a cruise. As people who enjoy large cruise liners are likely to have very small brains we did not worry to much and I am pleased to say we were very glad we picked this hotel. The room was fine (we had a front Queen bedroom), not huge but good enough, the shower was very powerful and hot, there was plenty of space to hang clothes. but the real plus for the Hotel Milano is it's position, right in the centre of the old city with all the restaurants, bars and sites within walking distance. The downside of this of course is that can be a little noisy with dustbin collections at 6am or the occasional police siren but with the windows closed and the air conditioning on this is not too bad and the price you pay for a city center location. We even managed to park our hire car right outside the door on the three nights we needed to although i think this was probably a little lucky but there are a couple of multistory car park near by. The only negatives were the breakfast is served on paper plates with plastic cups and cutlery and the internet connection seemed a bit flaky (but it worked if I reconnected but would not stay up for more than 20 minutes), it is however free â€“ Holiday Inn and other â€œQualityâ€� establishments please note. So if you want to stay in the centre of the city then this is a good value option.

Reviews.Title: “More Expectations”
Reviews.Author: LatinLoverEspana
Reviews.Content: My dad has stayed here numerous times in years past. He raved about Senor Juan, the owner and how friendly the staff was. My kids and I needed to break from tradition with my husband deployed to Afghanistan. We didn't get any warm, fuzzy feelings from the staff like we did with the other residents of San Juan (with the exception of the friendly man who hosted breakfast and spoke with us about Thanksgiving traditions in Puerto Rico). The worse was the staff member who has worked there about 1.5 years. He told me he'd give me a wake-up call and phone me a taxi for my 4:30 a.m. departure. I was told by the check-out attendant that the order never went in. Thank goodness the club next door was still pumping at 4 a.m. and I never slept a wink. I would have missed my flight. Hotel is nice on exterior but gutted out and no frills and no warmth on interior. I would have been okay paying $100 or less a night but not at over $160 a night that included a "service charge". Not worth it. Next time I'll rent a house and live like a local.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RumJourney
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Old San Juan Puerto Rico on Fonteza Street the Hotel Milano is tucked in the middle of a busy thorough fair surrounded by shops, restaurants, apartments and hotels. It is easy walking distance to the pier and many tourist destinations such as Casa Don Q, La Princessa, and Castillo San Cristobal. The interior of the hotel is a fusion of Asian and Puerto Rican style. It sounds strange but it works. I particularly enjoyed looking at all the photography of San Juan that hung all over the hotel. The staff was courteous and very helpful. The room was exactly as advertised and perfectly serviceable for a single nights stay before we departed on our ship. The five dollar breakfast buffet was traditional continental with some Puerto Rican pastries added to the mix. Sitting on the roof top sipping coffee was a wonderful way to start the day. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would recommend it for its friendly staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay”
Reviews.Author: Igor S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel before and after cruise. Clean, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful second stay!”
Reviews.Author: lexie54
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our wonderful second stay at Hotel Milano. This is an upscale and affordable,comfortable and charming hotel in the best area of old San Juan. The hotel is situated in one of old San Juan's landmark buildings. The staff is extremely courteous, professional, and efficient. Owner Pepin is always available and the go to person if you want advise on things to do and places to visit. He has given us wonderful recommendations! Our stay there was lovely again and our room was well maintained with everything we needed. The bed was extremely comfortable after a long day of sightseeing. We had a front room and were not bothered by all the noise some reviewers had previously written about. I am a light sleeper and would have woken up by the slightest noise. You couldn't ask for a more convenient central location if sightseeing in this lovely Spanish colonial part of San Juan is your passion. Will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowRobbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milano post cruise for the fifth or sixth time. Nothing has changed, it's still basic, clean, excellent staff, and great value for money in the old part of San Juan. This time we changed from a front queen room which can be a bit noisy at times to a rear queen room and heard absolutely nothing and had a great nights sleep. Will be returning again in April 2012 for a couple of nights pre-cruise. If you are staying at the Milano, try the small restaurant a couple of doors down. It was recommended to us by reception staff. It serves excellent pizza and other Italian dishes (as well as 2 beers for $5!!)

Reviews.Title: “Our 1 night at Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: cabo154943
Reviews.Content: We got our agent to book Hotel Milano for 1 night at $120 US before our 7 day Caribbean cruise. I picked this hotel because it appeared to be central and in prime location of old San Juan. We arrived at the Hotel Milano on November 4th at 11:00 p.m. Check-in was very slow because the computer was down. Our room #302 was very old and dark, carpeting needs to be replaced. The light beside the bed did not work (electrical wiring malfunction) even though I asked the clerk at the front desk to give me a light bulb so I can change it myself. It appeared that the hotel was short staff at this late hour. After I changed the light bulb, the light still did not work so we had to turn on the washroom light and pole lamp to see where we were going in the room.. It was a little difficult getting things out of our luggages in partial darkness. We requested a queen size bed but I think it is only a double bed so not much room for my husband and myself. We are not big people. I can't imagine 2 people sleeping in a double size bed unless you kiddy size. The air condition was very loud so it kept me awake most of the night. The shower curtain had mold and mildew when I showered in the morning, only upon stepping out of the tub I discovered the mold and mildew shower curtain. At least the water was hot. I guess housekeeping don't believe in cleaning with bleach or Ajax. I would not recommend this hotel as it is very old and if you need a good nights rest, this isn't the place. It may have been ok if we arrived during the day and did not have to turn on the lights. The front desk clerk does not know when the free trolley bus comes when I inquired, even though this trolley bus passes in front of their hotel. If I was working there, I would make it my job to know exactly what time this free trolley bus comes by and let customers know that you can catch it 3 blocks down the street on Calle Fortaleza. The clerk couldn't tell us if the bus came every 15 minutes, 1/2 an hour or on the hour. They just don't seem to care or have the knowledge about their surroundings. Anyways, the hotel was good in storing our luggages for a couple of hours after check-out. We didn't have to board our ship until 2:30 so the clerk was able to lock everything up for us. That service was excellent so we tipped the luggage handler. The other thing that was great about this hotel is that breakfast is up on the roof so you do get a good view of San Juan. You get a wide variety of toast, cereal, croissant, fresh fruits, juice, milk and coffee. The coffee was excellent. Other than that, this hotel requires renovations with king or queen size beds, new carpeting, fix all electrical wiring re lighting and invest in some cleaning agents for the shower curtains to get rid of mold and mildew. A couple from Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Mattha
Reviews.Content: This hotel won't work for everyone but it was perfect for us for a 1 night pre-cruise destination. The location is perfect as everything in OSJ is walkable. The service was good the location was perfect and yes there was street noise and music into the AM hours even on the top floor but I didn't lose sleep however my other half did. If you are looking for a clean hotel with an excellent location and value for a day or two in OSJ then the Milano will work. If you are looking for a fancy upscale hotel look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KalamamazooTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milano before a cruise in October 2011. Exellent location, staff was extrememly friendly and the hotel was within walking distance of the Carnival Victory. The room was very clean. We have booked reviews as a result of tripadvisor before. Once again, trip advisor came through.

Reviews.Title: “sleeping in a closet”
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the most wonderful hotel we have stayed at in a long, long time. Very clean, very comfortable very accommodating. The very air is full of the spirit of Old San Juan. The location allowed walking to every site we planned to visit, all of the forts, the square, and just walking for walking sake! The staff was knowledgeable and always willing to please! However, as clean as the rooms were, they were the size of a walk-in closet! Would I be willing to stay there again? You betcha!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: 007_Traveler_925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there and at 3:00AM the toilet from the the upstairs bathroom started to leak (or poor) into our bathroom. When I called the front desk the guy on duty said there was no one else there and he would let the daytime guy know. That morning, I had to walk down to the main desk, as to no one came to our room, and let them know our bathroom was flooded. They never sent any maids up there to clean up the mess. And I had to ask for a discount and a free continential breakfast for my husband and I. The breakfast was $5.35 and not worth it. I suggest going to a nearby restaurant because they only searve cereal, sweet rolls, some fruit, coffee and juice...You can get a better deal in the city. Later that day the heavy leak (or waterfall) came back in our bathroom. I definately expected more from this hotel. Also, the TV's are very old and have a greenish tint. This hotel is in a great location, but there are other better hotels out there that offer more (A couple we met stayed at Hotel El Convento and loved it). Next time we are staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Davie L
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is a pearl in old San Juan. The Hotel is nothing fancy but down to earth, small but clean and comfy. It was the service of the hotel staff that impressed me most. Every one of them was helpful and enthusiastic. The rooftop terrace of the hotel is a perfect location for a breakfast to start the morning and the continental buffet breakfast was awesome and Also the hotel is conveniently located in the heart of old San Juan close to shops, restaurants and nightlife and within walking distance to the cruise terminal. I strongly recommend this hotel to those budget-minded travellers who are based their trip to Puerto Rico on Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: rick390
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Milano based on its location and I was not disappointed. It is on a charming cobblestone street in Old Town San Juan. Quaint restaurants and bars abound. We stayed on a Saturday night and the area was hopping with young people and heavy vehicle traffic. Even with all this activity our room situated away from the street was quiet. I would definitely stay here again to further explore the Old Town vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Edward M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on hotel.com so we could explore Old San Juan after our cruise. I realize that October is the slow season but that should be no reason to short change your guests. We paid for a queen size bed and got that but there were no wash cloths in the bathroom, while waiting for my wife to change I decided to turn on the TV to see if I could catch the latest football scores and see what else might be worth watching while I waited. To my surprise there wher only 4 channels that came on. About 6 channels flashed the program that was on for about 5 seconds and then gave a message about the channel bieng "Protected - PG". This includes the Discovery channel which I find hard to believe would be "Protected". I called the front desk and the clerk told me that the cable had been turned off! I suspect they were probably stealing it from the cable company and got caught. Well we then went out for a while and got something to eat. When we came back I had noticed a sign that announced that the roof top resteraunt serves breakfast from 7:00 am to 10:00 am. When I asked the clerk about that - you guessed it! He informed me that the resteraunt would not be open because it was the slow season and they had only 3 rooms occupied. Duh! I hope next week you don't have any rooms occupied! Then you can go home and learn how to run a hotel. Don't be fooled by the pictures by the way. The room we stayed in was dark, musty and smelled and looked old. Nothing like the pictures! I can't say what the resteraunt looked like since it was not open. The picture of the front door does not show the true character of this hotel either. The streets are dirty and have almost a urine like smell. There are much nicer hotels here for about the same price. The only thing I can say about the hotel that is positive is that it is in Old San Juan and there are resteraunts in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best altenative for Internal Tourism”
Reviews.Author: Veronica S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to San Juan (we're from Mayaguez) on a regular basis to do business and had never stayed or heard of the Milano, until a friend recommended it. It is right in the old city, next to the best restaurants and we had a chance enjoy a little "romantic time" away from the kids. It is clean and quaint, has an amazing terrace on the roof, the staff was friendly and helpful, and it is smack in the middle of ALL THE ACTION. We definitely recommend this place as the best alternative for Internal Tourism and other.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice hotel, but Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sumsuuum
Reviews.Content: Before booking a hotel in Old San Juan, I did a lot of research. We were leaving San Juan on a cruise on Sunday and needed a cheap place to stay Saturday night. Many people gave great reviews of this hotel. The only reason I am giving it 3 stars is because of the location, otherwise it would only be 2 stars. I knew while booking it, it wasn't going to be the best hotel...but the price and the fact that it was within walking distance caught my husband and I's eye. It wasn't the worst hotel I have stayed in, but pretty bad. The rooms were not nice at all and our room had windows on the top of the room, so I had to stand on a chair to even get a look out of our window! But, it was an okay stay for ONLY one night. The location was great, in the middle of Old San Juan. We could walk everywhere from this location. There were also many restaurants around this hotel. And it was great because we walked to the cruise port with all of our luggage very easily! Many people say it is impossible, but we had 2 rolling suitcases and it saved us money on another taxi ride (since that is all we did in all the other cruiseports)! We walked to the cruise port on Saturday to find the easiest way to get down there with our suitcases and worked out just fine. If I were vacationing in Old San Juan (which I don't think I ever would, wasn't the biggest fan!), I would definitely not stay here. I would pay a little extra money to stay at the Sheraton, or somewhere in Condado on the beach. But, for a place to stay a night before and/or after the cruise, it is okay if you are a little more easy-going.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Eric C
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel Milano, we were welcomed nicely by the front desk, all the staff were very helpful, the room was very clean, especially the bed was very comfortable. We had a very nice time in San Juan in the Hotel Milano, I'm looking forward to returning to San Juan and if i do come back i will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room - friendly people”
Reviews.Author: ckierstead
Reviews.Content: We were the only guests in the hotel. It was definitely low season. We had a great time wandering around the old city. Nice restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “stay away....i'm serious”
Reviews.Author: foxeym
Reviews.Content: based on trip advisor reviews, i booked two nights at the hotel milano. the first room did not have a window.....very much like a cell. i stood in one spot, unable to move because of the heat (AC barely functioned), the staleness, the general feeling of "get me out of this room asap". they showed us a second room....the only improvement was the window. the young man at the desk was rude to the point of referring to my husband as a gringo to his boss on the phone....and not in an affectionate way. i don't care what the other reviewers say....there is no reason to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: tugdoug
Reviews.Content: This place is more like what you'd expext at a road side motel. The first room they put us in smelled of heavy mold, so we asked to move to another room. no problem but we had to pay for an upgrade. The A/C didn't work very well and the carpet was dirty but we were to tired to move again. I also had fire safety concerns, there is only one stair from the top dowm and it is open to each floor. that means if any floor has a fire then ever floor and the stairs above that would likely be smoke filled. That aragment wouldnt fly in the USA. of the four staf members we dealt with only one was pleasent to deal with the rest seemed like we were a bother.

Reviews.Title: “You cant beat the location”
Reviews.Author: rebekah_Carter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is situated in an ideal spot for tourists wanting to explore Old San Juan. It is really right in the middle of all the action. Otherwise it is an average hotel. Staff wasn't particularly friendly, rooms were just OK. But I would stay there again just for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but unattractive room”
Reviews.Author: StuartFromKirkham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for staying in and exploring the old town of San Juan without a car. We stayed for two nights before a cruise and were allocated a room on the side of the hotel. I was dismayed when I opened the door to the room - the immediate impression was of a prison cell. No view - just 4 very small windows near the ceiling to let light in - photo attached. However, the hotel and room was clean and quiet and staff friendly. Breakfast was an additional cost and was very basic. Would I stay here again? Possibly - but I would be more careful on the room being booked.

Reviews.Title: “Just barely ok.”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixPhoenician
Reviews.Content: Read quite a few reviews before booking for one night before our cruise. I would agree with most of the reviews. Rooms were very musty smelling, the other people we traveled with were not happy with the rooms. A/C units very loud and leaked condensation everywhere. Hotel location is excellent if you don't mind a little noise, a few loud clubs a few doors down. Hotel is very helpful about storing luggage.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: berly58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Milano with a cruise between and it was WONDERFUL! The staff was great, the rooms very clean, location perfect, and atmosphere fantastic! It isn't your "high $" type of hotel - clean, comfortable, & CHARMING!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Scenium3
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel, so do not expect five star amenities or rooms, but what the Hotel Milano does offer is great value for the price. Nothing in old San Juan is a long or difficult walk, so location is not a big issue when finding a hotel. The one drawback with this location is in getting there from the airport. The main streets east and west in Old San Juan are one way, and many north south streets were blocked by police to all but local traffic. It took us longer to make the loop through the old city to get to our hotel than the trip from the airport to the edge of the old city. Unless you have a lot of heavy luggage bags, I would recommend having your taxi driver drop you at the Plaza Colon. From there it is a short walk of less than 2 blocks straight down Fortaleza. The room was clean with basic furnishings. Do not expect luxury and you won't be disappointed. The bed was comfortable, the tv and air conditioning worked fine. We requested a room at the front of the building and were happy to have the extra natural light as well as a view of the street. (noise was not a problem). The staff at the front desk as well as the breakfast room were pleasant, accommodating and eager to offer advice. Upon leaving San Juan, the staff secured and watched our luggage after check out so we could take advantage of our last few hours without having to cart our bags around town with us. The continental buffet style breakfast was basic fair, but the roof top seating was a major bonus. Coffee and the view are complimentary, so even if you decide to skip breakfast, or eat elsewhere, do check out this lovely retreat. Overall, we had a pleasant stay, and would recommend the Hotel Milano to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a nice price.”
Reviews.Author: JJDJ73
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11am and could check in immediately. The rooms look a bit old but were very clean and had all we needed. The hotel is right in the middle of Old Town. Several good restaurants are within 2 blocks. All the sights can be reached within 15 minutes walk. Since we were only going to spend 2 nights in San Juan, we asked reccomondations on tours and restaurants and were helped excellent. They called the tour company for us and arranged for us to be picked up. In summary: excellent location and service. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: smilie604
Reviews.Content: Have to say that after reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor and being ranked #7 this gave me more than enough reasons to stay here. The owner / staff was super considerate and friendly. Our flight arrived early and so we arrived at the hotel approximately 10am. Smooth and stressfree checkin. The Owner offered to lock up our luggage while we were waiting for our room. When we were leaving the owner tried to get us a cab by the phone although being unsucessful he personally went outside to talk to the cabbie driving by. Much appreciated the extra step they took.

Reviews.Title: “I was most pleased with the room, its location and the friendliness of staff.”
Reviews.Author: dompedro02
Reviews.Content: The owner, Juan de San Emeterio, is very accessible and wants to do all he can to make one's stay a pleasant and memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base for Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: justabubba
Reviews.Content: Hotel provided home base for family of four for our visit to Old San Juan. Hotel was quiet, clean and close to everything we wanted. Staff was helpful. Parking is difficult, but public parking deck around the corner is inexpensive. We paid extra for a room on the street with more light and were glad.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware/Beware”
Reviews.Author: jsctraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Milano, in large part, on the recommendations of other TripAdvisor reviewers. I'm really not a picky person, so I gave more weight to the positive comments posted here--in other words, I thought that some of the reviews might have been a little harsh. I also wanted to stay in Old San Juan and was looking for good value. My family and I stayed at the Hotel Milano for a total of 7 room nights: we had a number of rooms booked at the front and back end of our cruise vacation, so I saw more than one room and solicited feedback from all of my relatives before composing this review. Location: The hotel is located in the heart of Old San Juan within walking distance of all of Old San Juan's attractions and restaurants. The location couldn't have been better for seeing the sights. On the other hand, the location can also be a negative factor. As others have noted (and my family and I experienced), the street on which the hotel is located is noisy, especially if you have a front room. The management realizes this and thus charges less for the front rooms. If you can put up with noise into the wee hours (especially on weekends), a front room will be fine for you. If not, book a back room which, we discovered, is less noisy. The Hotel: The common areas of the hotel are nicely decorated, up to date, and clean. The rooms need attention. Each of the rooms I was in could have used new carpet (read my other reviews and you'll see that worn carpet is a pet peeve of mine). The air conditioning units worked well, but often make the rooms smell musty. I really couldn't have stayed there more than two nights because of the smell. I thought it was just my room, but at least one other I spent time in had the same problem. Upon check-in, we weren't told that the unit could be controlled by a remote, if desired. Another guest (not related to my party) approached the front desk and complained about the temperature of the air conditioning unit in his room and was given a remote to fix the issue. The rooms could have been cleaner. I found small pieces of trash on our floor (just under the bed skirt) that didn't belong to my family. In general, I always felt the rooms were just barely clean and needed to be renovated/updated. Breakfast: Breakfast was fine. The gentleman who was the host was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The price was reasonable for a continental breakfast buffet ($5.35, I believe), and the setting was fantastic: we had breakfast on the roof terrace. Note: there aren't many places to get a reasonable breakfast in Old San Juan. Service: Check-in was not a problem. We got the rate promised, received information about the area, and information about the hotel. E-mail communication prior to arrival was always prompt and helpful. On the day of check-out, my family and I hung around the hotel's lobby before going to our cruise ship's port. The person at the desk welcomed this and even helped "store" our luggage (chained it together in the lobby). Other guests did the same. Apparently the hotel provides this service a lot. The only time we received poor service is when we needed a taxi. The young man staffing the front desk was involved in a lengthy personal phone conversation for at least 15 minutes. My father and I stood at the desk patiently waiting for him to finish so we could ask him to call a taxi, but he never made eye contact with us--again: we were standing right in front of him. Realizing that we weren't going to be served on our schedule, but rather his (and not knowing when), I walked to the taxi stand about a block away and secured a taxi. I'd recommend this method to anyone staying at the Hotel Milano. Parking: There is inexpensive parking in garages nearby. The management left a letter in each room encouraging guests to post comments about the hotel on this website and also displayed the hotel's 2010 TripAdvisor rating (a 4) in a frame in the elevator. A rating of four is a stretch. To be frank, I had a difficult time deciding between 2 and 3 for this review. The owner of the hotel needs to renovate the guest rooms if he/she wants to get better reviews on this site. With some attention, this could be a fantastic little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Once Again”
Reviews.Author: LadyKathleen
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back for more at Hotel Milano! We've stayed there every time we come back to Old San Juan. Why? The amazing service from Juan, the owner and his superb staff. The hotel is clean and simple and the location in Old San Juan is great. But it's the people that that keep us coming back most of all They are helpful, kind and fun. We could spend hours, and HAVE, talking with Juan, who's life and stories never fail to fascinate. We highly recommend when you stay there that you find the time to get to know the staff and have them share their insights on the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Place in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Bobo185
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Milano in Old San Juan upon arriving in Puerto Rico. The cab ride cost about $20 plus $1 per bag. It was about a 25-30minute ride but the going is very slow in Old San Juan. The roads are very narrow and when you get to the hotel, all the cars behind you will have to wait while you unload. Check in was very easy and there is an elevator to get your luggage to your floor. They have information about tours and activities and everyone we talked to was friendly and spoke good English. Our room on the third floor facing the street. The room was clean has a large closet, small refrigerator / minibar, TV, dresser, small table and a small table with two chairs. The air-conditioning worked well and the windows opened onto the street if you want air. The street noise was not bad in our room and we slept well each night. There was no safe in the room but they did offer one behind the front desk. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but does serve a continental breakfast for $5 on the roof. There really is not much there and I would suggest strolling down the street to one of the bakeries or small restaurants for breakfast. Old San Juan has many places to eat and should be able to find something to suit your tastes. We just walked around until something caught our eye. There are many street vendors at the close by waterfront and we ate some of our meals there. You can also buy crafts and look at the cruise ships. They often have bands and entertainment in the evening. This is a very short walk from the hotel. The hotel is central to all the sights in Old San Juan. The area is very scenic and there is a lot to see and do. We took the San Juan City Audio tourâ€¦which is a self guided tour with headsets. They give you information about all the major sights in the city and we went to all of them and my pedometer said we walked 8 Â½ miles. The city is hilly but there are many interesting sights to see. There are plenty of taxis if you need a break from walking. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a couple of nights to see Old San Juan, especially before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place !”
Reviews.Author: jaoria
Reviews.Content: Service at the Hotel Milano is excellent! We very much enjoyed our stay. It is at a great location in the heart of Old San Juan. Good quality service, the rooms are very clean and well kept! We are world travelers while this time our visit was short of only one week. Hotel Milano offered everyting an experienced traveler reqieres and expects ie; clean, comfortable and friendly ready to assist staff. My wife and I highly recomend Hotel Milano.

Reviews.Title: “Was greatly disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie914
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to like the Hotel Milano in Old San Juan and were prepared to do so, but were greatly disappointed. We stayed there for 3 nights following a cruise. Though it is listed as a "superior room", it left a lot to be desired. (The location was excellent, however, and there are a number of really good restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner within a block, so that helped us feel a bit more comfortable with our choice.) Anyway, because it's the rainy season and humidity was high, the 4' wide room air conditioner was working hard and dripping condensation on the carpet at quite a good rate. We had to place towels under it the entire 3 nights of our visit to soak up some of the moisture. I'm pretty sure there was a lot of mold and mildew developing right next to where we slept. It was starting to smell. I definitely wouldn't recommend it for anyone with allergies. Also there was a smoke alarm (which probably also incorporated a sprinkler) in the bathroom which developed a significant leak for about a day and a half before it was repaired. (The people at the desk didn't believe us when we told them the smoke alarm was dripping (so bizarre!), so they took way too much time to check it out. I had to take a photo and show them.) The bathroom is quite tiny, and the smoke alarm is right in the middle, so you had to sit on the toilet with a towel on your lap to keep from getting wet. The wetness made the tile floor really slippery, so we had to put a pile of towels on the floor to avoid falls. The bathtub didn't have a mat inside it, so taking a shower was quite a dangerous activity as well. The bathroom is quite awkward with no place to hang used towels and only inches for bathroom counterspace. There is a hairdryer on the wall which was adequate. The small refrigerator was located in the closet which reduced the space for hanging clothing. The ice machine was one floor down, but the ice did not come in cubes, it came in sheets about the size of a magazine. They looked like big ice waffles! The ice sheets had to be broken apart by banging them on the sink in order to use the ice in any beverages. The continental breakfast on the top floor was very sparse and unappetizing looking, and cost over $5 per person besides, so we ended up at a wonderful breakfast place just up the block (Cafe Mallorca). We would NOT recommend the Milano's continental breakfast at all! It looked very pretty, but the food did not. The lobby is quite small (though charming), so if one is expecting to hang out there following a cruise, there will be no place to sit and chill until you can check in at 3 p.m. (We found a nice Mexican restaurant nearby and nursed our cervezas until check-in time.) The desk staff was very willing to store our luggage in an office, however, until we could check in. We received polite assistance taking our bags to the room. We didn't see any indication of the excellent service, warmth and friendliness that people were so complimentary about on this website. Room decor and furniture was strictly from the early 1970s. Carpet not so clean, and mold was likely an issue. Room was small and had two double beds. Beds were comfortable enough, but the room was quite cramped with the three of us (my elderly mom, my husband and myself) and our four suitcases and two carry-ons. We were expecting "quaint", given the age and size of the hotel, and we knew it wouldn't be up to modern hotel standards, but we weren't expecting this. Any recommendation we might make for the Hotel Milano was STRICTLY for the location, which was superior for a visit to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one or two nights”
Reviews.Author: cdeame
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night pre-cruise. On the plus side - the location is great, right in the middle of Old San Juan. Room was large and clean. Negatives - Air Conditioner was VERY noisy, and only had one setting - it was either ON or OFF, and dripped condensation right next to my bed. We had a double room at the front of the hotel, on a Saturday night, and it was very noisy from the bar/restaurant below on the street. (However, the noise from the AC pretty much drowned out the street noise). I would only recommend it for a one or two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KWB354
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Milano for a night before our cruise. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel. It's in a great location in the heart of Old San Juan, very easy access to pretty much anyplace you'd want to go. The rooms are good quality hotel rooms - nothing spectacular, but clean, well maintained and pleasant. When we're visiting a new city we're not hanging out in our hotel room, just looking for a comfortable, clean, well-run place to sleep. Hotel Milano delivered

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Grate Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rabob184
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Milano for 4 days before leaving on a cruise. This was the first time we had stayed in Puerto Rico and we could not have made a better decison in selecting a hotel. It is located in the heart of Old San Juan. San Juan Bay, shopping and all the famous sites are within walking distance. We are in our late 60's but found walking around OSJ to be easy inspite of the street slopes. The Milano is located just around the corner from Fefo's PR sandwich shop, best mofongo in town, also near to Racies, try the mega pork chop and Barrichina's, birthplace of the Pina Colada. The hotel staff were totaaly helpful and made our departure to the cruise ship a breeze. Will stay there again without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, i wouldn't have any problem staying again.”
Reviews.Author: remun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Milano in San Juan the night before getting on a cruise ship. It is a very nice place to stay, the hotel is a little old, but it has such a great staff, that makes up for any short comings. The location is great, within walking distance of the forts, and the cruise ship terminal. There are resturants, and shopping all around the hotel, with in easy walking distance. The breakfast on the roof of the building is really a great way to start your day. I will stay again the next time I am in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “My feelings about Hotel Milano are mixed.”
Reviews.Author: stockjock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Milano on May 7, 2011 for 3 nights prior to a Royal Caribbean cruise. As a side note for the cruisers, some have mentioned that the hotel is walking distance from the cruise ship pier. But my cruise left from the Pan American Pier which is about a $20 cab ride away. My experience with the Hotel Milano started off very nicely. I engaged in e-mail correspondence with the owner, Mr. Juan San Emeterio. He was kind enough to offer us complementary continental breakfast each morning, which we enjoyed (more on that later). I asked him which room he'd want to stay in and he assigned me to room 408 on the top floor, which is a front room. Communication was very good and Mr. San Emeterio was very kind and accomodating. When we arrived in San Juan, we were told that our room was no longer available and that we were assigned a room on a floor one floor lower. Now that might not sound like a big deal to you, but it was to me. The Hotel Milano's views aren't great but the best by far are on the top floor. Also, the owner had personally assigned me to the room and it was prepaid, so why was I being moved? I politely requested either the promised room or at least a room on the top floor, but the desk clerk said that was "impossible" and told me the story about some man who wanted to be near other family members. I said that was fine, but I was assigned to the prepaid room and he was not. Also, I had just flown 3,300 miles and hadn't visited San Juan in 8 years. Finally, after searching through his computer for over 20 minutes and saying "impossible" about 20 times, he found a way to put us in the room next door, which was room 407. The room itself was not fancy, but was extremely clean. The furniture was spartan but was in better condition than I had expected. I was afraid that I would be kept awake by street noise, but that was not the case and my visit included a weekend stay. We had a fairly substantial problem with the air conditioner. While it worked, it didn't work very well at all. Certainly the room was cooler than it was outside of the building, but not nearly as cool as it could have been. This adversely impacted my sleep quality, which would have otherwise been just fine. Also, the plumbing was somehow crossed where the cold water was hot and the hot water was cold, but we worked around this without too much difficulty. As mentioned, the owner was kind enough to provide continental breakfast in the rooftop restaurant and it was very good, as continental breakfasts go. Even if you have to spend the $5 per person or so, it's a decent value. The variety of food included nice Puerto Rican coffees, pasteries, white or wheat toast, orange juice, pineapple juice, steamed and regular milk, an assortment of cereals, fresh fruit, crackers, yogurt, cheese etc. I didn't catch the name of the fellow who runs the restaurant, but he was an extremely nice and helpful gentleman. Be sure to tip him if you receive good service. The view from the rooftop restaurant is decent and it's a nice place to start your day. However, when I first visited the restaurant, the sign on the front door read closed and I almost left but decided to open the door anyway to find that it was actually open. So even though the sign says closed, it might not be. I also found one of the front desk clerks to have a very snotty attitude. We were a bit late checking out and he wasn't very nice about it. I also needed to print up documentation and boarding passes for my cruise but couldn't access the Wi-Fi. I though he could have been much more helpful and instead he seemed either amused by my problems or else not to care a bit. A couple of other gentlemen ended up helping me. I have mixed feelings about the Hotel Milano. The location is terrific and right in the middle of everything. I'm confident that there is no better location if you want to walk the streets of Old San Juan. While the rooms are older and basic, they are very clean. The owner seems like a nice man and I feel a bit guilty giving his hotel a so-so rating because he was so accomodating. However, the value is average, the rooms are somewhat dated, the air conditioner didn't work properly, my confirmed room was given away and I had to stand around for over 20 minutes getting situated, the plumbing was funky and one clerk had a bad attitude, in my view. So overall, I think that a 3 star rating is fair. I do recommend the Hotel Milano, but you should book it understanding what it is that you are booking. My message to the staff at the Milano is that it's a nice hotel in many ways, but there is room for improvement in the areas that I have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: jjcoello
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and didn't have one good nights sleep. The matress was quite old and lumpy. On the other hand the hotel was in a great location. It seemed very safe and there are restaurants everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “keep looking or lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: winter_escape_NY
Reviews.Content: Pre cruise stay here March 31st, 2 nights. I have only stayed in San Juan twice and both times I was not impressed. Old San Juan is a beautiful place to visit but if I cruise from here again I will try staying at one of the resorts in the Condado area. This hotel has a fantastic location for Old San Juan nightlife. That is it. The hotel is in bad need of updating. Picture a 1950s motel off from any US interstate and you get the idea. The restaurant is closed, the rooftop bar is closed, and the room rate was very high. I am very surprised at the ratings on trip advisor as this is the first time I feel I would disagree with the consensus. My wife had stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan and it was far better for similar $$. If you are used to the newer accommodations of the Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Marriott Fairfield/Courtyard, that are so common for business travel in the northeastern US you will be very disappointed. It was clean and convenient

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and awesome location in Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Nole711
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super cute-like a boutique. The owner, Juan, made us feel very welcome. The room was clean and the location was perfect. I couldn't have asked for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean room”
Reviews.Author: BrownSkid
Reviews.Content: The reason we picked this hotel is because of location, we wanted to be in the heart of Old San Juan. Easy to get around with plenty to do. The staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Even looked after our luggage before check-in which gave us opportunity to be out during the day without lugging it around. A nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for seeing old san juan”
Reviews.Author: stroza
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. It was perfect for what we wanted. We knew we wouldn't have time to see all of san juan and decided to just stay in OSJ. If this is your plan too, this would be the perfect hotel for you. Centrally located right in the center of town walking distance to anything in OSJ. My wife and I must have walked 5 miles in one day. totally doable but the hills in OSJ are a killer!!! LOL Would I want to stay here a week? No, but for 1 or 2 nights it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeanfanatic
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to be to walk the Old San Juan district. It is close to everything that you could possibly want and the staff are all wonderful. We arrived late and needed something to eat. Edwin directed us to a neighborhood restaurant near the hotel that was just what we needed. We liked it so much that we ate there a second time during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in downtown Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Alexandru81
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice. We were worried initially that it may be too loud. We got a room in the back and those 2 nights we spent at Hotel Milano we got the best sleep in our Puerto Rico journey.
