It's centrally located and you can walk around the entire Old San Juan from there. There are also lots of good restaurants, bars, and music places around it (somehow though all that noise doesn't make it to the hotel). The owner is around and he'll say hi and chat with you if he's got the time. Very friendly person. After meeting the owner I finally understood all the positive thinking and relaxing messages around the hotel. Breakfast on the roof top is OK. Nothing spectacular. If you're used to heavy American breakfasts probably you should go somewhere else. All the staff is friendly and will try to help you. When we were there the person at check-in helped us book a tour to El Yunque with a local company (perfect tour with Manuel as the driver). The rooms are small and nothing fancy, but clean and OK if you're planning to spend a lot of time in the rooms. Whenever we'll make it back to San Juan, we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dillard88
Reviews.Content: We chose Milano to overnight before flying to Tortola and didn't want to leave. The hotel was the perfect location for OSJ. We walked to the fort twice and around the city. Everyone from the maid to the front desk was very friendly. My room was small, but I knew that when I booked because I was on a budget. I was very happy to spend money with these people. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for shopping and restaurants. Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: BVIDreamin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to our cruise. Check in was easy; they held our bags for us until official check-in time and held our bags for us after check-out the next day since our cruise ship wasn't leaving until 10:00 p.m. The staff was extremely courteous, helfpul, and friendly. We paid just over $200/night with taxes and fees. Our room was on the 4th floor in the front. It was very clean and comfortable. We had no problems with the elevators or air conditioning. Breakfast was inexpensive and the coffee was out of this world. The view from the top floor is not quite what we expected, but the atmosphere was charming. Just a warning - if you stay on a Friday or Saturday night, expect a lot of street noise from the corner bar...it did wake us up a few times into 5:00 A.M.! That was the only down point. The staff told us the rest of the week is very quiet, it is only a weekend thing! We would stay here again without hesitation! It is in walking distance to the Barrachino - dinner and flamenco dancers. This was worth the money and was a wonderful experience. They are also hosting the King Tut exhibit right now in downtown OSJ - definitely worth a visit if you haven't had the chance to see it. If you have several hours, we highly recommend visiting El Yunque Rain Forest - its amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: MichiganChocoholic
Reviews.Content: Our friends and us stayed here the night before our cruise. This is a perfect spot to see Old San Juan. Everything is within walking distance. The staff was extremely helpful. We were able to leave our luggage secured at the hotel while we toured the city. When we arrived back they called a cab for us and helped us with our luggage. The rooms are small, we had double bed rooms in the back. It was quiet and clean and the breakfast on the roof was a great spot in the morning. $5.00 each for breakfast. I wouldn't want to stay here for a week, but great for overnight before or after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sacha2121
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly and responsive. We had a double room at the front, which was quiet in spite of the central location due to double glassing. The location is perfect for those wanting to walk the old town with its interesting and long history; eat at the restaurants along Forteleza Street; and visit the bars at night.

Reviews.Title: “you cannot go wrong with staying here. Location, rooms, and staff.”
Reviews.Author: racheldd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after a January cruise. We reserved a front room which was large and lovely. We had breakfast on the terrace upstairs (inexpensive) and later strolled old San Juan. You can walk to many sights from the hotel or take a free bus. Loads of restaurants and shopping on the street. The staff is so incredible. They helped us so much. I wish we could have taken Hiram and Jose home with us. Loved everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for staying in Old Town San Juan”
Reviews.Author: sharpekos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an original building in Old Town San Juan which means the rooms are small and "dated". The bathroom was clean and had everything we needed, but it wasn't like a modern-day Hyatt. The same with the bedroom. I loved the breakfast restaurant on the top floor...on the roof! The staff was excellent, giving us excellent recommendations for local restaurants to use. Very GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: 7WooHoos
Reviews.Content: If you'd like to get into the heart of Old Town, this is the perfect place. It's near restaurants, shops, and all the sights. We had a queen room in the back and it was perfect....clean, quiet, large enough and comfortable. It's definitely not the Embassy Suites......or any other American style chain, so if you need all of that, you may be unhappy....and you'll be miles away from Old Town. If you're looking to experience the historic part of San Juan for a few days, Hotel Milano is a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place”
Reviews.Author: kc_Greenville
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, great location, large room. had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Rosey223
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Old San Juan. Helpful front desk. Modest, clean accomodations. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, but.....”
Reviews.Author: jamamac
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in terrific location with exceptional service, but on day of departure at 7am I went to lobby, empty of people, and asked desk clerk to order taxi for me for 7:30am for transport to airport. At 7:30 when I arrived in lobby the clerk had not ordered the taxi and 3 large groups of people were also waiting and no cabs in sight.. He informed me that he would order the taxi and we would be 4th in line. Did not seem to understand the protocol involved. Delayed about 15 minutes, made the flight on time, but left a bad impression on me. Otherwise thought the hotel was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: cjoyn
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel thru tripadvisor and it lived up to the reviews. Walking distance to alot of sites, free trolley nearby, clean hotel and helpful staff. One caution is ask for room in the back. We had front facing rooms which were very noisy throughout the night. But since we were only there 1 night before a cruise, it was fine. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “The best location + cozy bedding + clean room + friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bucketlisttravellers
Reviews.Content: Loved the location - absolutely in the heart of Old San Juan, steps from great shops and restaurants. But that also means it was noisy - at least for those of us with "front" rooms (which cost more). I don't recommend the "front rooms". The view is narrow - even though you're on the street, you have to lean out to look either direction very far, and then the range isn't that great. It's just pedestrians and shops and restaurants - nothing noteworthy or scenic. So save your money and ask for a "back" room for more quiet. I loved the bedding - there's a real comforter on the bed, which makes it very appealing and cozy. The room was very clean. The tv was odd - it was a computer screen, so pretty small...and strangely, the A/C only had one setting - "on" - there was no way to adjust it to a particular temperature. So, it's not luxury. But if you like to support local, smaller businesses, and you don't need brand new, sterile perfection, you'll like this place a lot. The staff is generally great, with some of the front desk folks friendlier than others. All spoke English, and all were helpful when it came to locating good restaurants, etc. One young guy, though, had some of his facts wrong - he even claimed that a poinsetta plant in the lobby was not a poinsetta - that it was some other rare & endemic PR plant.... There is an Internet computer in the lobby for guests, which was fabulous. The breakfast option on the roof was not that great, nor was the coffee, so we ate elsewhere. I got a 10% discount by paying in full ahead of time, which was a great deal since we were there 3 nights...

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise stay-great choice”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDeb
Reviews.Content: We booked one night pre cruise and were extremely pleased. The hotel is in a great location, the staff goes above and beyond to make it a great stay. Rooms are basic but clean and quiet. Will be back for our next cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: sakura111
Reviews.Content: Very simple place, but filled with beautiful small quotes, which made the stay even more peaceful and special. The staffs were very helpful and knowledgeable about the city. Especially Ed helped us a lot even after we left the hotel. Although the room we got had only small windows, I got good sleep and we could fully enjoy Old San Juan from early morning to evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - some glitches with rate but honoured agreement”
Reviews.Author: LBTraveller50
Reviews.Content: Our family booked two rooms for one night prior to a cruise vacation. The location was excellent - close to food, shops, historic sites and the feel of Old San Juan. I had brought my email which confirmed one rate and when we arrived - they had charged a different rate. Once I showed them a copy of my email - it was clear they would honour that rate - although the person on the desk had to defer the decision to someone working the next morning - again - I trusted and they did make it right. We looked at the breakfast options - great location - not great selection and decided to go around the corner to Bonbonera - GREAT CHOICE! Overall a good stay - would absolutely stay again - it isn't new - but our rooms were clean, we felt safe and were in the hub of San Juan - just what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Good pre cruise hotel; great location; average room”
Reviews.Author: newmy
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for us before our cruise. Rooms were small, but adequate. This a 3 star hotel, not 5. Ideal place to tour around Old San Juan before your cruise. A modest, cold, breakfast is included. They will store your bags for you until you move to the cruise ship. Wi-fi wasn't working, was not a bid surprise to the staff. There is an internet available across the street. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: grosensh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano is a wonderful place to stay. It is not luxurious. It is simple. But everything works well. It has a good shower, instant how water, and good air-conditioning. The location is superb. It is close to everything -- by foot. It has a roof top restaurant where you can have breakfast for $5.35. Or one or two minutes away there are several other inexpensive breakfast options. The best thing is the staff. I've been all over the world but the staff here is by far the friendliest and most helpful I've ever encountered. If you interested in people as much as places, this is the place to be. People have commented on the noise on weekends, or at least on Friday and Saturday nights. It wasn't that bad, but if you need perfect quiet you can request a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, welcoming feel at home place”
Reviews.Author: cachilinguin
Reviews.Content: Privileged location, close to very good restaurants and bars. Very nice and helpful staff, comfy clean rooms and beautiful view from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a Heart”
Reviews.Author: abadgirl
Reviews.Content: Milano was a very simple Hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Nothing fancy. But the location is amazing. You can walk to almost anything. We had a Queen room in the back and when we first walked in I thought maybe I had made a mistake booking this room. But I was wrong, The room was everything we needed. The bed was comfortable and it was quite. And most of all the employees were so kind. They held our luggage the next day so we could explore Old San Juan before our cruise. We went sight seeing that day and my husband twisted his ankle on the street. We made it back to the Hotel and they were so kind. The employees help get wraps for my husbands foot and one of the guys even waited around after his shift to make sure we could make it to our cruise ship. Very impress with the kind hearted employees. Will we be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: islandexplorer
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay within walking distance of all the attractions in Old San Juan, then I would highly recommend to look into Hotel Milano. Edwin (front desk) was top notch with his suggestions and dining options. We had a room in the middle of the hallway, but our A/C broke the first night, so we moved to a room in the front. We had no problem with any street noise and enjoyed the looking out the large window. Our first room had glass blocks. Since we stayed for four nights, having the front room was a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “shows it's age”
Reviews.Author: chooms
Reviews.Content: probably the best location in Old San Juan, which is it's best attribute. The staff were outstanding and very helpful. The rooms were not the greatest, showed their age. A good comparison is 1950's Motel 6. We had a 4th floor front queen with a view of some rooftops. A bit noisy in the middle of the nite. The breakfast (not included), was barely a continental and not worth the $ 5.35. I guess the location drove the rate, because the rooms didn't. Barely a 3 star, if that...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in an older hotel needing an uplift”
Reviews.Author: SkylerBenjamin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to everything. The front desk staff are amazing and will help you in any way they can. There are many places to eat right outside the hotel. In the evenings the front doors are locked but someone is right there to let you in. I felt safe staying here and had no security issues. We stayed in a back room which was quiet in regards to outdoor noise but the walls in the bathroom are super thin and hearing someone next door cough and spit up ETC. was gross. The continental breakfast was ok but the coffee is super strong, no other meals are available at any other times. Our room was quite small, but efficient and clean. Wi-fi did not work in our room so we had to go to the lobby to use it. Like others have said, the rooms really need to be updated. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful staff would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sueq48
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan two nights and had a front queen double. The room was clean but not luxurious. We found the staff at the front desk very helpful and loved walking out our door to find wonderful restaurants and a nice walk of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/Friendly Staff/Average room”
Reviews.Author: crasmelin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over the Thanksgiving break, first time in PR. Location in old city is very convenient, hotel is safe, and staff are friendly. Our room was OK, but a bit worn - don't expect luxury or modern furnishings. Room had windows facing the street; when left open the street noise is too loud for a light sleeper - closed windows block most noise, but then you'll likely need the oldish/loudish AC unit. At $135/night not exactly a steal, but less expensive some of other more upscale options in the old city. Skip the $5 continental breakfast and grab something better at one of the numerous places down the street. Our room had windows facing the street,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tonylofaso
Reviews.Content: Room was right on main street. On a Saturday night it was sometimes noisy. Otherwise the room was pleasant and very clean

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scubyfrog
Reviews.Content: If you want up to date,state of the art cookie cutter accomodations,book something else. The rooms are not large nor the most modern,but the location is close to perfect and the people as friendly as one could desire. It has charm and atmosphere,not central air and a complete set of free toiletries for every guest. I would highly recommend it to all but the most snobby of travelers-those who want the Plaza at Econolodge rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: cruisenut60
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travelocity and got a good rate. We were pleasantly surprised at how clean the hotel was including our room. Had read reviews saying it was noisy at night but we did not have that problem. I did ask for a room in the back off the street maybe that helped. The service as great they answered our guestions and gave suggestions where to eat. It is in the heart of old San Juan and close to everything. We walked all afternoon and had a great time. The only negetive and this is not the hotels fault but be ware of the taxi drivers. We had a 6am flight out and the hotel called for our cab. Hotel stated that the price to airport was $19 plus $1 a bag. When we got in the cab we confirmed the price and the driver gives us no no it is $25 total due to the hour of the day. Needless to say the extra charge became his tip!! But the hotle was Great and we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ktlane36
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Milano with my mother and brother on a family trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed at Hotel Milano for 2 nights and had a great experience. The staff was amazing. We felt instantly at home and welcomed. The accommodations were basic but very nice and clean. The location is absolutely amazing. It is located right on Calle Fortaleza a main street in Old San Juan. I would definitely stay here again next time I come to Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan's BEST DEAL!”
Reviews.Author: Lehti
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. EXCELLENT location. I will definitely do this deal again at just a little over $100 per night. This hotel is located in between 2 gift shops and another one is across the street. The place across the street also has a cute cafe (the hotel has a rooftop cafe but it was closed when we got there). AWESOME LOCATION- high end restaurants and bars just steps away from Hotel Milano. The hotel is very European/Spain (of course b/c it is Old san juan). Positive- we checked right in, no wait. Lobby is beautiful,antique feel very clean. Not many negatives but if I could think of just one, the AC is on the 1st floor and not turned on in the other floors. So when you head to your room, it is muggy. This was not a big deal BUT some other places as you're checking in they make sure to turn the air on....well when we walked into our room, it was HOT. Not a biggie. Got in for the night at 1 AM- again, muggy once you get off the elevator, but a nice security feature was the doors to get to the rooms section on each floor are locked. We had to use a key to get into where the rooms were on the floor. What a great added safety feature. They have small safe's downstairs were my friend kept his passport n wallet. Deposit of 10bucks that u get back. Breakfast in the morning is on the roofdeck. It is very pretty..they had an outdoor seating area......around half a dozen people eating. Noise level from our room- quiet during the day, we got in at 1AM and I could hear some bar music. Once we turned on the AC I heard nothing and fell right asleep. Raices restaurant is 2 blocks away (really authentic pr cuiisne). Aquaviva restaurant is a high end (amazing food. All dishes are 30dollars. Average 90 per person) Calle de la Tanca has a cafe also btw forteleza n street. Cafe Majorica is across from the hotel- sits 10 people and has 5 small tables. Again, the location of this hotel is amazing- there is a free ferry/tram (that is always packed but eventually u can get one to do a loop tour). We did 2 different ferry/tram rides....the "city hall" and "el morro". BUT we never got off the tram, we used it for sightseeing. It was ALWAYS packed so if u r in a rush, this is not for you. Restaurants: over a dozen within walking distance. All just minutes away. The cruise dock is minutes away walking. Prices at the shops are very affordable. Wear sneakers, streets are narrow in Old San Juan and alot of cobbelstone. If you know a little spanish and want to grab the bus out of the terminal....the beach is just minutes away on the bus. The Bus station is located at the trolley stop 2. It is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The bus is the: M3 (bus all the way to the right when u enter bus terminal). I heard the M1 also goes. It only costs 50cents. NOBODY knows English in the terminal it is a "locals" bus terminal. Once on the bus...it is a 5 minute ride. When the bus makes a right turn away from the water onto a one way street,u will see the beach enterance, he stops at the next corner. So u walk 2 minutes to get to the beach. The beach is called: Escambron beach (5 min bus ride from terminal) it took longer to walk to the bus and wait for the bus than it took for the bus to get us to the beach (probably 2 miles from hotel). Cab is about 15 bucks but worth it if u don't speak spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Cruise Hotel has Old-World Charm”
Reviews.Author: michmomro
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Milano for a one-night stay before our Carnival cruise. We loved the location, nestled on a narrow cobblestone street in the middle of Old San Juan. This is a simple, unassuming hotel, so if you're used to the big chain hotels, you might be disappointed. However, it is nicer than a Motel 6. Our room was basic but comfortable. We had a rear room, so instead of a window there were glass blocks near the ceiling. This wasn't a big deal for one night, but if we were there for an extended stay, we would request a front room. There are many restaurants and bars nearby, and you can walk to the fort. The hotel is also within walking distance of Carnival's pier, but keep in mind you will be walking down narrow sidewalks and across cobblestones. However, for two healthy adults with 4 bags on wheels, it was not a big deal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A simple breakfast is available for around $5. There is a PC with printer and internet access in the lobby for guest use. They will store your bags after you check out, so you can explore the city before your flight or cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Carnival Cruise Line's best kept secret!!!”
Reviews.Author: richierich007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there the night before taking a Carnival cruise out of Puerto Rico. We were pleasantly suprised at the hotel's charm, closeness to bars, restraunts shopping and cuuise lines. Very friendly and helpful staff. and adequate accomodations. Friends travelling with us stayed at a major chain hotel and were dissapointed that they did not stay with us. We will return with the "Milano" as our destination.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location charming atmosphere, hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: RKaren
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveiling alone I found this hotel excellent and I felt very safe while staying there, It was charming and did not have any of the cold, indifferent, blandness that most of the chain hotels have. I felt like I was important to the staff. I stayed a full week and loved it. The whole Old San Juan area was an extremely safe area. I had absolutely no worries when I went out at night to walk to the clubs and restaurants which were numerous and all within a 2-3 block radius of the hotel. The staff was excellent. The evening Concierge, Edwin, was extremely helpful and friendly and knew exactly the right spots to recommend for dinner or for good Salsa Music and was quick to respond to any requests for assistance. He is definitely a hotel asset. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the a/c worked very well. Downside was i only got TNT and the Weather channel on the TV- they need to expand that a little. Yes most of the time you are out enjoying the wonders of Old San Juan but would like to have seen a little news occasionally while changing for dinner. They have a continental breakfast setup on the top floor of the hotel with an excellent view of the harbor. The cost was $5.35, a good price. I only ate there once since I prefer protein at breakfast. If they added scrambled eggs and bacon I would have been there every morning even if they had raised the price some to make up for the cost. I talked to other guests and they all agreed with that assessment as well. Mainland Americans like their eggs and bacon in the morning. That is why the 4 stars for service. I had a rear room and yes it was warm when I walked in (as a previous review mentioned) but if they are such delicate creatures that they can't stand the 5 minutes it took to cool the room then they needed to go to the Sheraton where they would have paid 2-3 timesas much so they could be cool those few minutes and would have missed out on the atmosphere and charm that I found here. I understand energy conservation. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to everything in Old San Juan. Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmelo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Milano. The staff was very friendly and very accomodating. I loved the location as well, many great restaurants at walking distance. I was very happy with the cleanliness of the hotel. Every time we were out, our room was cleaned. Highly recommend this to anyone staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Karla45
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Cute as can be and a fantastic location. We were close to amazing restaurants and everything you could possibly want to do in Old San Juan was within walking distance. I fell in love with the "Paseo de la Princesa." Beautiful! I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the middle of everything and wants to be in a hotel where customer service is key. Our room was beautiful, lots of light and really COLD AC.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: stopoverqueen
Reviews.Content: As others have already stated, this hotel is central, clean, and offers a quality basic room. it is not a luxurious experience by any means but it provides what one needs for a safe and comfortable stay. You can't beat being able to walk out and have dinner in great restaurants. What makes this worth a return visit should we go there again is the helpful and friendly staff. The front desk is staffed by people who care to make your stay a happy one. Great place if you are going on a cruise as it's only a $15 ride to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms, great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bumbi17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night, we were waiting for our cruise. The hotel is very basic, but the location was very good (close to every attraction and the port). The staff was very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, affordable, but spartan and a little grimy”
Reviews.Author: fredct42
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano's biggest pluses are it's wonderful location - walkable to all the sights and restaurants of Old San Juan - and it's relatively affordability for a hotel in that location San Juan. When you first walk in you are greeted by a beautifully, shiny, new lobby. Unfortunately, at this price point, the rest of the hotel does not live up to the same standard. The rooms and hallways are spartan and pretty bare, and the condition of the rooms makes you wish they shampoo'ed the carpets a little more often. It might have just been our room, but it's was the kind of place that makes you a little paranoid about keeping shoes or flip-flops on while you walk around. As bad as that might sound, it was a perfectly decent location for a short stay - such as our one night before our cruise. You can see the sights, enjoy the town, and for a short stay it makes for a perfectly acceptable place to get some rest. I *would* recommend it to others in a similar situation. The fact that it has an elevator is also a big plus relative to other places nearby. We had a city view room on the 4th floor, and I didn't really hear any street noise, although my wife did and she said it made it hard for her to get to sleep. I guess it depends how sensitive you are. If only Hotel Milano could invest the upkeep in their rooms & other levels that they do in their lobby, it could be a fabulous place, instead of one that's just good for a couple nights or for travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marianellanella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Milano Hotel, and it was great! The location its fenomenal, within walking distance you could see Old San Juan or take tre troley; for my husband and I cleanliness of the room its a very important issue, and this people really do a great job on it and the staff are extremely courteous.Very good deal for a nice vacation or business! Marianella

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: indymama2010
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to stay for one night before the cruise. Hotel Milano was a wonderful choice! We arrived in the evening from the airport. The staff welcomed us and put us right at ease. He suggested a wonderful restaurant walking distance from the hotel. Great Puerto Ricaan food - Raices!! Breakfast in the morning on the terrace was beautiful! We could see all the sights we hoped to walk to that day on our self guided tour. We even got a glimpse of our cruise ship. The staff was quite happy to keep watch over all of our bags, so we could see Old San Juan. When we needed to head to the ship, since it was only a couple blocks, we walked to the port from the hotel, bags and all!

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Imamtgirl
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night prior to our cruise. We has stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan on a previous trip and it was great but didn't want to spend that much money again for such a short time. The Milano was great, kind of an old world cultural experience. Its clean, the front desk is beautiful and the rooms are fine. If you are looking for 5 star luxury, its not for you but the customer service was excellent and the location could not be better! You can walk to everything and the party on the street is incredible! We ate at Tantra (right down the street) expensive, but it had the best food and Martinis ever! I would stay here again hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms Straight Out Of 1990s Miami”
Reviews.Author: mhollifield
Reviews.Content: We arrived after our first day in Ocean Park. Location - PERFECT. Right on the SoFo dining drag, cute alleyway bars around the corner (well it was actually a street but had an alley feel). Again, PERFECT location! Staff - nice, perfectly fine, did their job as expected. Held our bags for us for a few hours before check in, no problem. Could direct me to the closest ATM, etc. Room - Fourth Floor on the street, Room 408. It was clean and all, but the decor was pure Miami 1990s - pink and greens, beige carpet, whole nine. The bathroom toilet paper holder was porcelain with flowers. Tacky, but like campy funny tacky. Embrace it! Again, I'm in a hotel to sleep not live it up. And for sleeping, it was perfect. Could nap just fine, A/C was perfect and then up and on the way. Hotel Decor - Tons of inspirational quotes everywhere. Random. Like at crazy church lady's house. Again- have fun with it, go with the joke! Rooftop Breakfast - Cool view. Selection and spread - meh. No real feelings about it, much like the decor haha. Not to mention I thought it was free for some reason, but I mean $6 is nothing for some coffee and cereal etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well located for Old San Juan sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: SandiDothan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two other couples checked in for two nights prior to a cruise. The hotel was reasonably priced and working with them prior to the trip was easy. They responded to emails quickly, and when we wanted to make a change in our reservation about a month before our trip, they worked with us. The location makes walking around Old San Juan convenient. We were close to shops, restaurants, clubs, and historic sites. The rooms were clean but very modest. The bed was comfortable, and our room had a the usual hotel room items (e.g., tv, clock radio, phone, and dresser) along with a small table, two chairs, and a mini-fridge. Our room was on the front of the hotel, but even though we were there on Friday and Saturday night, we didn't hear the noise from the nearby clubs that some other reviewers have mentioned even though we were there on Memorial Day weekend. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop breakfast was pleasant with the usual cereals, breads, fruit, coffee, juice, and pastries. The view of the city was a nice way to begin the day. Unfortunately, the rooftop bar that shared the space with the breakfast area was closed during our visit. The only real down side to the room was the use of raspberry solid air freshner. I simply closed it, put it in the closet, and closed the door.

Reviews.Title: “It is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nzube
Reviews.Content: I was here for one week and it was wonderful. The people staff are very nice people and can help you with anything. The owner is one of the most wonderful guys i have met. Hotel milano is place to stay. I will definitely come back here when i visit Pueto Rico again. I live in Houston and enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: laura_and_andrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night. The thumping bass from a nearby night club continued until around 5 am the next morning. Even with earplugs the bass could still be heard. I do not know if the nightclub operates all week but on that night it was pretty much unbearable. On a positive note, the hotel location is terrific - right in Old San Juan and close to sights and restaurants. Very friendly check-in staff, and guests can use the computer and printer in the lobby to print airline boarding passes - a nice touch. The room was characterless and spartan with the only window being a narrow strip of glass across the top of the wall. Furnishings reminded me of any lower-cost chain hotel/motel in the mainland US. For dinner, we had a good meal at Riaces, a few minutes walk from Hotel Milano. However, queues are long so go early or late or expect to queue for at least 30-45minutes. I suspect that hotels a few minutes from the centre might offer more character and less noise. I would be reluctant to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCruisers2010
Reviews.Content: For those looking for an extra day in beautiful Old San Juan prior to or after cruising, this is an exellent choice. We have used this hotel twice in the last year (both times after completing a seven day Carnival cruise). The hotel is within walking distance of the port (thus no taxi needed) and accommodates requests to drop luggage off prior to check in time. The hotel is nestled in the historic streets of Old San Juan and is within walking distance to everything (the Fort, the night clubs, a multitude of restaurants, etc). Don't forget to take advantage of the beautiful restaurant on the top floor. I believe it is only open for breakfast at the moment. Relax and enjoy a cup of coffee or breakfast upon the roof top terrace. The desk staff are wonderful - very friendly and accommodating. In addition, the hotel provides free internet service for those needing to confirm flights. The taxi fee from the hotel to the airport is $19 plus $1 per piece of luggage (rates as of May 2010).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bahamadonna
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides great value for money. While it wasn't the most luxurious of hotels around - the rooms were just basic at best - the service was friendly, the room was cleanly and the location was EXCELLENT!!! It's in the middle of a strip of activity - clubs, bars and restaurants. If you are looking for a little R&R, i wouldn't necessarily recommend this hotel, but if you are looking to explore the city, have fun and have a reasonably priced hotel that is clean within walking distance of activity, THIS IS YOUR PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: 2OkieCruisers
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for just one night before leaving on a cruise, so we didn't want to spend alot, but didn't want to stay in a dump either. Hotel Milano proved to be a good choice! Not overly priced, but still a nice, clean, conveniently located placed to stay. Only complaint would be the noise level on a Saturday night.... because the Hotel is right in the middle of all the nightlife in San Juan, the partying goes on til 3 or 4am, and since we had a front facing room, we could hear it all! But overally, we were very happy with our experience. Friendly clerks, and the breakfast on the rooftop was convenient with very interesting views.

Reviews.Title: “lifetime Experience”
Reviews.Author: Falcon7387
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano, is a great hotel to stay in while in San Juan. The hotel is very clean (smells good also). The staff is very friendly and helpful when asked about restaurants, tourist attractions etc. The hotel is right in the middle of old San Juan, so all of the shops, stores restaurants are within walking distance. The restaurant on top of the hotel, gives you a bird's eye view of the city. I was very pleased with my stay at the Milano. Next time I come to San Juan, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and service”
Reviews.Author: dfayad20
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great location and good service, we highly recommend it if you go on a business trip or family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: twgloege
Reviews.Content: Spent one night prir to and two nights post cruise. Can't beat the location for exploring Old San Juan. The price is right, the people are friendly and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: toy_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a great location, wonderful staff !!! VERY HELPFUL. We stayed in a front room 408 , on a weekend and didn't have any trouble with the noise from the clubs.Had a good nights sleep. We stayed here before a cruise and we would stay here again for sure.Now it's not a 5 star hotel, but a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy on weekend nights”
Reviews.Author: dalesterSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is in the heart of Old San Juan, which is good in that it's convenient to popular tourist and entertainment sites. But at least on the Friday night that we stayed there, the very loud music from the nightclubs throbbed well into the night, making sleep difficult.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: JulesOhio
Reviews.Content: Great experience............this is a no frills hotel but it is very clean and there is a refrigerator in the room. The staff is probably the most considerate of any hotel staff you could imagine. I don't think anyone even expects tips. The owner is a wonderful, kind person. He took us out to lunch and insisted on paying! He upgraded our room with no charge! The rooms are sparse but the price is right. The main reason we stayed there is because I really wanted to be in Old San Juan where the action is and where we could walk around without having to take cabs everywhere. You don't need a car there. We were taking a cruise and the ship was four blocks from the hotel. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl074
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Milano, for one night after a cruise. Several hotels had been recommended by friends/travel agents etc, but all were fully booked or had a 2-night minimum stay. We stayed at the Hotel Milano based on previous Trip Advisor reviews, and I was not disappointed. The hotel is located in a perfect location, right in the middle of the action of Old San Juan. We spent the entire day just walking around, exploring the area. Within walking distance are numerous restaurants, bars, shops and countless beautiful historic buildings. We didn't explore the forts, but could have walked to them. I booked a double/double room at the front of the hotel, and that is exactly what we got. The room was quite large, and had a bar fridge and a small kitchen table with 2 chairs. We didn't use the table, but definitely used the fridge (there are grocery stores/Walgreens etc within walking distance, which was perfect for picking up fresh fruit, other snacks and bottled water). The furniture in the room was basic and dated, but I found it to be very clean. There was an air freshener in the room which was quite strong, so we just closed the lid on it. The windows were very large, and all opened, which made the room very bright, and provided some fresh air (the hotel does have rooms with no windows). The previous review mentioned problems with moisture from the air conditioner - our room didn't have any moisture problems. The air condiitoner was a bit louder than most, but was nice to have in the room. Like the rest of the room, the bathroom was also large in size, but quite basic. It did have a full tub, instead of just a shower. A lot of the other reviews have mentioned the bar noise at night. If you are a very light sleeper, or want a more resort-type stay, then Hotel Milano is not for you. As I mentioned earlier, it is located in the middle of the action and the music from the bars played most of the night. When I got up at 5am, the music had stopped, but there were still people partying in the street. When I left the hotel at 5:45am, they had gone. The noise on the street didn't bother me (I actually wished I was out there joining them!), and the air conditioner provided a nice white noise to muffle the music. If you don't want the noise, but do want to stay in the area, then maybe a room at the back of the building might be quieter? The best attribute of Hotel Milano is definitely the staff and the service they provide. We arrived at the hotel about 11am - way before the check-in time. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready. We dealt with the front desk several times, and every person we dealt with was friendly and helpful. We were given street maps, restaurant suggestions (and even a menu to look at), and plastic cutlery to eat our snacks on the plane, among other things. In the hotel lobby, there is a computer and printer, which is available for all guests to use - and free. I was able to print our boarding passes the night before, and which saved some time at the airport. When our cab arrived early the next morning, the man working at the front desk even helped to take our suitcases to the street. When I stay in hotels, I mostly look for cleanliness and location - I'm not looking for the flash. Hotel MIlano is not a 5-star hotel, but then you're also not paying 5-star prices. If you're looking for good value, a great location and amazing staff, then consider staying here. If I find myself back in San Juan, I will not hesitate to stay at Hotel Milano again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Clean Hotel Just a Few Minutes Walk From Old San Juan's Best Sites and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Winfield4211
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the Ritz, don't stay here. If on the other hand you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel just a few minutes walk from Old San Juans's best sites and restaurants then this is the place for you. The staff was friendly, and helpful! Bene Noto: Cruise passengers.... Lighten up your luggage by leaving the bulky bottles of sunscreen, shampoo, conditioner, etc. home. Bottomline, there is a brand new CVS just a few minutes walk from the Hotel which has prices comparable to what you would find in the states. Much cheaper to buy it here than have a bag over weight at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “The most convenient Hotel with 5 star staff”
Reviews.Author: NewTraveler87
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano has one of the best locations in Old San Juan, but even better than the location was the staff. We had planned a tour that the company cancelled two days before it was supposed to occur and with one phone call, the concierge was able to book the same tour at a better rate two days in advance!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in seeing Old San Juan as it was truly a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location......”
Reviews.Author: Spriglet
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano certainly has all of that in Old San Juan. There does appear to be a shortage of hotels which I presume is why they can charge so much for rooms that are not instantly appealing. We paid $175 per night for a queen bed room at the front, with windows. The room has a fridge but not many other amenities, shower only, no tub. The bed was comfortable and the room was quite large. It was extremely noisy both when the bars let out and also in the morning when traffic started and horns were blowing. We didn't really mind the noise. We did like being right in the heart of Old San Juan. Some people on our cruise got a room at The Sheraton in Old San Juan on Priceline for $100 and with the ameneties offered there we initially felt a little "ripped off". However the Sheraton is right by the Pier and so away from the buzz of old San Juan. After two nights at The Milano, we both agreed that if we returned to Old San Juan that is where we would stay. The restaurant/bar is closed except for the continental breakfast which was very basic and for which there is a charge of $5.35. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We really liked it even though it does seem a little expensive for what they provided. The hotel seems very busy so I guess they can charge as much as they like if people keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a lot”
Reviews.Author: hrcalso
Reviews.Content: It cost $18 for transport from the airport. Then you pay for each piece of luggage $1. I found the surrounding area to very rich in history. I paid less for a no view room. For me it was enough room. It was very clean. The breakfast was ok, if you dont have time. I like walking around the area and found a lot of old history buildings. Within 5 min there were plenty of restaurants(local andMC d's,piazza hut etc). I was told of a excellent place to go for breakfast by a square. I went to Sophias for pizza(very good). It close to the tour ships(not sure which one). I used B&R tours(not sure of the intials) for san juan. The only good part was the local dinner wagon she took us to. Got a very good pork meal.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced - keep looking”
Reviews.Author: swimstc
Reviews.Content: I would not consider myself a high maintenance traveler. I frequently stay at hostels and am very happy. However, if I pay a lot of money, I expect something nice. Hotel Milano was not cheap, and was not nice. I'd compare it to a mediocre Motel 6 that was last remodeled sometime in the 80s. What was most frustrating was that once we saw the room, we told them that we were not happy and we were going to leave, and he informed us that since we had booked online we could not get a refund, so we were forced to stay. There are plenty of other places in San Juan that are cheaper and nicer - like hotel Casa blanca down the block - I would keep looking

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Rawrachel
Reviews.Content: We weren't spoilt for choice for the two days we wanted to stay in old San Juan. There seems to be a shortage of hotels... although Casablanca looked quite nice opposite Milano. Everywhere was full because of cruise ships or the nearby golf. Milano is fine - not worth the $200 (inc tax) for the double double front room that was a bit dingy, smelly and very noisy...we were given that or a back room with no window (!)... but it was convenient to the front and the back of old san juan. The room wasn't very airy and overall the hotel felt dated - the rooftop restaurant is closed apart from a plastic breakfast offering (paid extra). Personally if you prefer to be away from the cruise ship hordes and the 'fusion' restaurants i'd head to the top of old san juan and the bars/restaurants around San Sebastian. All in all a good place to explore for a couple of days - and the cafe round the corner is great - cafe tito or feto or something.

Reviews.Title: “hotel milano is a very good value.”
Reviews.Author: sireno
Reviews.Content: i recently traveled to san juan from st.thomas with a very tightly scheduled two day stay. hotel milano provided me with exactly what i needed, a place to refresh myself and access appointments at various locations and times in the old city. the location was perfect fro my needs. the staff was friendly as usual and provided guidance as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Hotel Milano in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MinouVermont
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano for a short visit to Old San Juan before taking off for a week-long stay in western PR (Porta del Sol). The hotel is a comfortable, friendly place to stay in this most beautiful part of the city. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was simple but pleasant. Despite the hotel's location in a busy part of the neighborhood, it was quiet. Old San Juan is quite small, so anywhere you stay will be convenient to everywhere else. Hotel Milano is very near a number of good restaurants and easy walking distance to museums, shops, plazas and all the beautiful and interesting places to visit in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “The friendly staff and location made up for anything the hotel lacked.”
Reviews.Author: AnnieOMiami
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The location was perfect as it was within walking distance of everything in Old San Juan. The hotel was a bit more on the rustic side and not luxurious, but it had a comfortable feel to it. Our room, with twin queen-sized beds, was perhaps not as large as found in more modern hotels, but it was adequate for our four night stay. It was clean with fresh towels provided every day. The bathroom had all the basics with hot, hot water in the tub/shower. Finding a small refrigerator in a closet was a nice surprise. The continental breakfast with view from the rooftop had a nice variety and was reasonably priced, as was the hotel in general. Without a doubt, we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortble, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCarleton
Reviews.Content: Located in heart of Old San Juan, this hotel offers ready access to the the numerous nearby restaurants, shops, and historical sights. Staff are extremely accommodating and friendly. Jose and Laura, in particular , provided helpful guidance. Would be happy to make a return visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: Beatriz121
Reviews.Content: Called Hotel Milano "home" for 5 nights. Couldn't have asked for a better location. It's right in the heart of all the action of Old San Juan. It's not the Ritz Carlton but it's also not Ritz Carlton prices and certainly offers a more authentic cultural experience than staying in the hotels in Condado. Within a 2 block radius there are tons of restaurants, souvenir shops, plazas, the ferry line, El Morro, San Cristobal, cruise ships, and the Sheraton with its casino. You get the picture. The tapones (traffic jams) can be an unbelievable 2 - 3 blocks long because of the narrow streets so being able to walk to destinations becomes a real bonus. The music from neighboring bars until 5 a.m. on the weekend was a distraction for us...until we realized that if we simply closed the windows and turned on the air conditioner, it drowned out the music. Must see sites - the forts, El Yunque, the churches, the Princesa walk, and the Bacardi Rum plant by way of the CataÃ±o ferry. We had tickets to Ricardo Arjona's concert at the coliseum and found that the Hato Rey ferry took us to within 1/2 block from the coliseum for $.50. Couldn't beat that price! Our experience was very positive. Everyone was very friendly and helpful including the police officers who went back into the coliseum to call a taxi for us. That was real customer service!

Reviews.Title: “The real old san juan”
Reviews.Author: rickbylsma
Reviews.Content: For 3 years my wife and I have used the Milano as a base to explore P.R. by car. It's right in the heart of the bars, shops, historic sites, ships coming in. We walk everywhere. This is an authentic hotel, not a cruse ship on land. It's small, clean, safe, and the desk people are knowlegable and very helpful. By the way, the rooftop bar is only open for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: CruiserJoe
Reviews.Content: This small quaint hotel in the heart of Old San Juan is perfect for pre/post criuse stays. Depending on which pier your ship leaves from, you could actually walk to the terminal. Lots and lots of restaurants and shops to keep you busy. If you are looking for a hotel that gives you VALUE for your money then stay here, if you are looking for a pool, fitness center and other amenities then do not stay here. Staff was friendly and courteous. Would stay again. Joe and Laura from Whitby, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: MissouriKaren
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a day before our cruise and one day after our cruise. I would never stay there again. While we were checking in, two other customers asked for their money back because they were not going to stay in those conditions. The room was very small and dirty. Both nights we had to ask for wash cloths. I had a bug crawling up my arm. The windows are about 1 foot from the ceiling with cheap curtains that let all the light in. The hotel must get a kick back from the taxi drivers, because when we asked for a taxi and they called one for us. We asked how we would know which one was our taxi and he said it would stop. Well one did stop, we started getting in and the hotel worker ran out and told us that wasn't our taxi. We got in anyway and got an earlier flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Old Europe Charm”
Reviews.Author: Penndot
Reviews.Content: My wife and four couple stayed here for one night as a lay over before heading to other parts of Puerto Rico. This was perfectly set in Old San Juan close to all the activety. Great reception on arrival. Clean room with all the shower ammenities. This place has a continental breakfast for $5. which is on the roof that gives a nice scenic view of the city

Reviews.Title: “Good deal close to the action in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: annielou82
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to save money without sacrificing accessibility to the tourist attractions of Old San Juan, this is the hotel for you. While the rooms are very basic, they are clean and comfortable, and with so many things within walking distance, how much time are you really going to spending in your room anyway? I can't say enough about the great location of this hotel - steps from a host of great restaurants and shops, located at the foot of San Cristobal fort, and an easy walk from basically anything you would want to see in SJ. The staff was very accommodating, helping us out with directions to a parking garage when half the streets were blocked off for a festival, letting us use their office computer to print boarding passes, and taking care of our suitcases when we arrived slightly before check-in time. While there were little things that grated on me slightly - the aforementioned off-site parking garage, i.e. no parking at the hotel; our room not being available until about 2 hours after check-in time, a slightly overpowerful air conditioning meaning our room switched between cold and stuffy - they were minor compared to the overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but wouldn't stay for more than one night.”
Reviews.Author: smoosh468
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Milano on New Year's Day, the night before leaving for a cruise. The hotel was decent enough for one night. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and pleasant, however the rooms were small and not the cleanest I've ever seen. The bathroom was old and dingy, and the shower was smaller than the showers you get on a cruise ship. If you've never been on a cruise, the showers are tiny. We thought the location was great when reading reviews prior to booking. We wanted a hotel close enough to the cruise pier that we could walk if we wanted to. Well, the hotel was close to the pier, however the pier is quite large and our ship was on the other side. We ended up paying more money to take a cab from the hotel to the pier than from the airport to the hotel. Overall, the experience was just o.k., but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: kellywl
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been any more pleased. The staff went out of their way at every turn to provide assistance. From telling us the best way to visit the Bacardi distillery (saved us $96) to where we could find real Puerto Rican food, Jimmy, Jose and the others provided the best personal service we've found at any hotel. Located in the heart of Old San Juan offers easy walking to the most fabulous sight seeing. The continental breakfast was just what was described except the coffe was a rich local blend that offered its warm invitation from the the entrance all the way to the pot. The rooftop breakfast area provided a front row seat to the early morning music that is the local inhabitants beginning their work day. The building is older as it is in an historic district. It is part of the fabric that creates a beautiful quilt of cultural immersion. If you want nothing more than the average, touristy, corporate hotel environment with "I'm only here for the pay" staff, go on into San Juan. But if you want to truly feel the warmth and hospitality of this amazing city and absolutely drown in the rich heritage of it's people and past, then the Hotel Milano is a perfect opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect,but highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: sandlawyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after a cruise. People could not have been nicer or much more helpful to us. Room was large and comfortable.Location was nearly perfect for sightseeing in old city. If you want to stay at modern,up to date hotel with every modern convenience,this is not for you. If you want a hotel with charm,atmosphere, personal attention and great location,this is great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A one night stand - nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Two_whiskers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after long-haul flight arriving at 10pm. We wanted to explore Old San Juan before taking off the next evening. Hotel itself was quite tired; room old but clean and comfortable, dreaded window-mount loud AC was there as well. Very small windows on top of the walls â€“ bunker feeling. But all we wanted was to have a hot shower and go to sleep. We asked for a quiet room when making reservation and that was delivered. The front desk personnel were very friendly. In the morning we wanted to have breakfast on their rooftop, but they serve only continental and since we were starving after airline food, we chose to look for something else. The staff directed us to a breakfast joint few blocks down and we had quite good eggs there. The location is unbeatable. We walked for few hours exploring the area and forts while our luggage was being safely held by the front desk staff, they also arranged their van to take us to the airport. I would probably stop over there again, but only if I needed to be in the old part of town, itâ€™s too dated otherwise. I think this hotel is successful on TA because it doesnâ€™t promise bells and whistles. Itâ€™s a decent place to sleep for a relatively small price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people--horrible noise!”
Reviews.Author: vrb
Reviews.Content: We are here for one night, waiting for a cruise. The noise from the drunken club next door is deafening! The walls in our miniscule but clean room were SHAKING from 12 until 3:30 am. The disco owner who bought the building next door plays music at ONE VOLUME: LOUD!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: loralyelee
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 4 nights before going on our cruise. I picked it based on other reviews and the price. Great price. From the second we pulled up in our taxi we felt like princesses! The staff was unbelievably warming and personable. Every morning when we came down from our room the hotel manager would say, "Good morning ladies! What do you want to do today? What can I set up for you?!" One morning we wanted to rent some bicycles and he got right on the phone calling up everyone he knew trying to get us the best deal. It really says and means a whole lot when he took so much interest on our happiness and you could easily see that he wanted us to have a fabulous time in Old San Juan. He even mapped out areas that we should stay away from due to safety. What a great guy! Be aware, as some others have said, that this location is right in the heart of resturants and nightlife. We are young, so it did not bother us one bit, but I know that if I was older or had children the music may have been too loud. We fell asleep just fine with the windows open. Our view was amazing. We will be staying here again. Can't wait to go back :D

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in PR thanks to hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: lreluzco
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in San Juan. The hotel staff was VERY helpful and attentive. My son left something behind that could have easily been thrown away. When we discovered he had forgotten something, I called the hotel and they had in fact saved it. It was sent to me right away! We really appreciates this!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in middle of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: rrw11
Reviews.Content: Service at this hotel was great. We were able to check in early and staff were friendly throughout stay. Room was dated but very clean. Room was at front with windows opening onto street. View of the port with cruise ships. Negative was aircon was a bit noisy for me to sleep at night without earplugs. Location is on Fortaleza in Old San Juan - central to everything. Easy walking distance to Fort and free trolley car stops that will take you anywhere in the city if you are feeling lazy. On our last day we had the hotel breakfast and considered it better value than many other breakfasts in the local vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PERSONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jaoria
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location! Rooms are very comfortable and clean. All employees very friendly always trying to make you feel at home!! The breakfast offered is excellent and very resonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: mass1234
Reviews.Content: The desk staff is amazingly helpful. They really made the place special. I didn't catch the name of the 40s-ish man who is there in the evenings, but he is really a great guy. Just hint that you are interested in going out and he will call around to get reservations at whatever restaurant you want. The rooms are nice and clean and nothing to complain or write home about. The continental breakfast is probably worth the $5, but I would recommend going around the corner to La Mallorca instead for a fresh cooked omelet or fried eggs. This hotel doesn't have a lot of frills, but if you want a good clean place to stay in the heart of Old San Juan, it definitely fits the bill. The location is SUPERB for walking to various Old SJ sites. Also it's really close to all the restaurants--it shares a block with at least 6. We sampled some of them (not nearly enough) and loved the ones we went to.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of SOFO”
Reviews.Author: BookishBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in the heart of Old San Juan, this hotel is it. The best dining in Puerto Rico is just steps from your hotel. We went out shopping and were able to stop off at the hotel and drop off bags in between, it was that convenient. You are just a few short steps away from San Cristobol fort. THis hotel is not fancy. However it is clean and the staff are friendly. The price is right. My only suggestion would be for the hotel to invest in some better pillows. No amount of fluffing could make mine comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for cruise piers and one night stays”
Reviews.Author: natster1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we went on a cruise. We booked this hotel and got a very cheap rate through expedia. The hotel was comfortable enough for one night but i would not like to stay there for longer. The hotel is charming but is quite dated. The tv only had 2 channels that we were able to watch. The beds were comfy enough and the rooms were clean. There is good aircon in the rooms but they are very noisy. The location is great for those going on a cruise as it is only four blocks away and very easy to walk to. Breakfast was not included in our room rate but is sevred for a fee on the top floor where you can choose to sit inside or outside. Following breakfast i did suffer from upset tummy syndrome so if we did stay here again i wouldnt go back for breakfast!! The staff are very helpful at this hotel, could not have done more for us and were happy to keep hold of the luggage until we were allowed to go the cruise ship. If i were to go back to san juan i would stay here again if it were only overnight. We stayed at el convento on returning from the cruise and this hotel was far superior to milano so would always try and stay there first.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location - Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MorroRock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights post cruise. We arrived mid-morning so we were not able to check into our room; however, the staff took our luggage for safe-keeping. Upon returning later that afternoon, our bags had already been delivered to our room. We had a queen front on the 4th floor. The room was clean and well kept. The AC was either off or on but did not present a problem as it cooled the room effeciently. The hotel is centrally located so the entire town and all the sites can be explored on foot. When we needed a respite, we simply headed back to the hotel. Staff was friendly and accomodating. There was a free computer with internett access and printer in the lobby so we were able to print pre-flight boarding passes. They arranged for a taxi to the airport when we requested. After seeing some of the other hotels in Old San Juan, I would definitely choose Hotel Milano - great location, great value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano is a quaint hotel centrally located in Old San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: dwjer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights prior to going to St. Kitts. It met our needs for a good priced local hotel. Upon entering the hotel we were greeted by a very staff member at the front desk. The reception area is very quaint and user friendly. The guests are able to use the internet in the lobby free of charge. That was an added feature. We found all of the staff to be very knowledgeable about the area and willing to answer questions and offer suggestions for activities and restaurants. Our room was on the 4th floor with two windows. It was clean and comfortable. The location was excellent for walking to restaurants and shopping in Old San Juan. The reception desk was staffed 24 hours a day. We would definately stay at Hotel Milano again. It had the feel of a small Europeon hotel. They did serve a continental breakfast for $5 each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quaint, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ldecker123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and after a cruise out of San Juan. It is very centrally located near the ship docks and in the heart of Old San Juan. This is a small hotel with charm and very helpful staff. The rooftop cafe (open only for breakfast) is convenient and reasonably priced at $5.35 PP for a continental breakfast. Our room was small, but clean. The only complaints we had was that the room AC has no control (on and off only), making it impossible to set to a comfortable temperature; and the hotel is adjacent to a disco that is very active and loud on Friday and Saturday nights until the early hours of the morning. The noise drifted to the hotel, preventing little sleep until the AM hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaLouie
Reviews.Content: I left my expensive electric toothbrush, and they were nice enough to mail it to me in Minnesota. Also, while at the Milano Hotel, when we felt that the room A/C was too noisey, they upgraded us to another room at no extra charge. The breakfast was quick and reasonably priced at $5.25 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to spend a night before leaving for a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2Tris
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night before leaving Old San Juan for a Carribean Cruise. The hotel is close enough to walk to the cruise ship - if you don't have tons of luggage. We went out for a mediocre dinner (can't recall the name) and then browsed some of the shops and checked out some of the local nightlife. The room was clean and comfortable, although maybe a little outdated. The staff was pleasant & helpful and we were happy with our one night there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character and soul. Not a cookie cutter experince. Read on...”
Reviews.Author: TexanFolk
Reviews.Content: My three day experience at the Milno Hotel was the best hotel experience of my life. This is not a big casino type hotel, not at all - this place has character and soul. From its Elegant entry to its roof top restaurant (Panorama), the whole place is inspirational. I mean there are actually framed inspirational quotes hanging on the walls. I had the fortune opportunity to meet the hotel owner who continues to run his hotel "hands-on.â€� He has written several inspirational books himself and those are available in the clean rooms. I received top notch service from the bilingual staff, the clerks were very knowledgeable on all activities related to Old San Juan and went out of their way to make sure I was happy. The physical location is centrally located so perfectly that I did not use my rental car once while staying there because everything is within walking distance. Walking allows you to get a real feel for Old San Juan with its cobble streets and gorgeous architecture; however, if you don't want to walk -there is a free, yes free (no charge) air-conditioned shuttle that stops about a half block from the hotel that will take you all around Old San Juan. The Hotel Milano is an excellent place to hang your hat, it's truly a great value. I'm looking forward to my next visit to San Juan, and I'll certainly stay there again! Craig N. Republic of Texas

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caseant01
Reviews.Content: While the price is a little more expensive than you would expect for a Caribbean destination, the hotel was centrally located and the staff was very helpful. The roof deck was closed when we were there but we enjoyed many of the restaurants around the area. The air conditioning worked great and was necessary because it was over 100 degrees while we were there. Ice machine on the 3rd floor proved very useful. Overall, happy with the location and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sunjoysg
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has very good service and extremely friendly. Makes it very homey, and heartwarming. This is my second time in Puerto Rico, this is my second time staying in this hotel. I can't imagine staying anywhere else. The location is very very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Anchaweigh
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at Hotel Milano one night before our cruise on the Adventure of the Seas. We met Juan when we checked in late at night, and he was the first of the helpful staff we encountered. Carlos was at the desk the next morning, and Jose was so pleasant about securing our luggage while we explored Old San Juan the next morning. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is more than adequate, very clean, and everything works well, including the A/C. The location is ideal for doing a walking tour, and it is not far from any of the cruise ship piers. It is on a busy street which is quite active on the weekends, but we had a room in the back, and the noise was not an issue for us at all. We didn't have the continental breakfast, as we were still zonked from the long flight, so cannot comment on that. But overall, the hotel is very nice, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre- Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arhl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Milano for 1 night prior to our Carnival Cruise. After reading all of the positive reviews, we decided this was the place for us. Although a basic hotel, it was clean, nice and in a great location. When we arrived on the island we took a cab to the hotel which cost $20. As we walked through the front door of the hotel, Carlos greeted us by name. Kudos to Carlos. Carlos is very professional and offers superb advice on dining and local attractions. We toured one of the forts in Old San Juan, pay $3 for the National Park Service tour, it is interesting and well worth it. Hotel Milano is within walking distance of several great restaurants and shops. Shopping includes Burberry, Coach and Polo to name a few. We had lunch at Aguaviva - very nice. I had the tuna wrap with plantains and my husband has the fish tacos. For dinner we went to a mexican themed restaurant (La Madre's - maybe) where we had a tamarindo margarita. YUM!!! Make sure you have breakfast at La Bombonera. It has been in business for over 100 years and is one or Rachel Ray's top picks. If you are staying in Old San Juan prior to a cruise, you will be approximately 2 blocks from the ship terminal. We took a taxi because we had 3 suitcases plus carryons. However, the 2 block taxi ride was $20!!! So, if you don't care to walk - save yourself $20. Also, if you are joining a cruise and you purchase liquor on an island - BEWARE you CANNOT take the liquor in your carry-on when you are ready to fly home. Make sure you either ship it, put it safely in your checked bag OR buy it at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but avoid the front rooms..”
Reviews.Author: carly03049
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic, clean, great staff, nice bath rooms, secure, but its location right in Old San Juan for a good price recommends it. Our first couple of nights before a cruise were great starting with a good breakfast on the hotel's roof top and a good nightâ€™s sleep. We had three rooms total. Our one night after our cruise was the worst of my life and I travel 65 nights a year for business. We got a room over the street and the night club next door was unbelievably loud until 4AM. I do not mean annoying or kind of loud for 2 or 3 or 4AM; I mean every drum beat LOUD. We considered leaving and sleeping in the airport for our 9AM flight. After the experience it will be a long time before we make a 4th trip to San Juan, it just crushed our desire to go there. We had friends in two other rooms towards the rear and they did not hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money.”
Reviews.Author: PuuJaa
Reviews.Content: Very nice, save and clean hotel. Jimmy and Carlos were very helpful. Highly recommented. Good for stay a night or two before or after cruise vacation. Lots of good restaurants and shops near by. Breakfast is much better if you would walk around the corner. Only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. You got very good breakfast for a cheaper price than the hotel breakfast. Taxi that took us to the cruise line is $20.00 which was a little bit much for 4 blocks but hey ! you are on vacation. What can you do ? Will stay again if in Old San Juan area for the next cruise vacation. Stay in the back room. It's much quiter.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmfreelifestyle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is in a great location for all shopping, clubs, and many great restaurants. It is very close to the beaches - just a short ride by car or taxi. It is in walking distance to many local tourists sites and historical landmarks. The hotel is very clean, quite and the beds are comfortable - I actually slept through the night on my first night, which is something I never do. The staff is incredible, very friendly and helpful. I must say the rooftop restaurant has the best price in town for a continental breakfast. The staff there is very friendly and always full of conversation if you enjoy chatting. The owner is also a very compassionate and kind man that has written two very interesting books available to read in each room - I bought both to have for myself. Anyone who chooses to stay here will feel like they have found a home away from home. I will definitely return! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Cheers to Milano Staff”
Reviews.Author: MayBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff (with the exception of one person). All the staff members were extremely nice, helpful and funny. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance from fun restaurants and bars. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Fokje
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days. Clean, friendly hotel that will bend over backwards to make your stay as good as possible. We'll defenitely come back if we ever go to San Juan again! It's located smack in the middle of the most important street in Old San Juan so everything is within walking distance. Grrrrreat!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, rooms clean and comfortable, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Acrux
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights prior to a cruise. The hotel is very well kept, and run by effecient and helpful staff. Situated in old San Juan two blocks from the pier. Most activities well within walking distance and the Japanese restuarant in the area highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Micheline and Rayenne from Holland”
Reviews.Author: michelineAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and I have no regrets AT ALL. Hotel Milano has great staff, PERFECT LOCATION, close to absolutely all tourist shopping, restaurants, bars, clubs, and cafes. though we got the advice to hire a car, we decide not to.
