Their is no need for a car in this area. The hotel is clean, rooms are comfortable and very clean, AC is nice and cool. Simple breakfast is offer on the rooftop, good to start the day. :-) JosÃ© was nice, very friendly and helpfull. Front Desk Staff especially Carlos, guy from NY and Laura very friendly. Bus station walking distance. You can go everywere for only 75 cents, also to Plaza Las Americas (worth a visit if you love shopping). Taxi's are close and hotel Milano gets good service. Mojito Restaurant and Genesis afortable and GOOD food. We had a great time and will definitely recommend this hotel to friends already. Big Thanks Juan Emeterio we had a great service from before our trip until the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: oldpartner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed just one night on our way back from Vieques. We had a red-eye flight out the next morning, so we just wanted something affordable and clean. Hotel Milano definitely was that. The front desk staff was very helpful making sure our room was to our liking and helped with transportation to the airport. Probably the best thing about this hotel is its location. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! It is right in the middle of shops, restuarants, bars, and nightclubs. We wish we had stayed another couple of nights. Old San Juan is beautiful and worth a visit. Hotel Milano will be on our short list of hotels if we return.

Reviews.Title: “This is the spot”
Reviews.Author: kaylen1205
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week and I have no regrets. I actually stayed 2 nights at Casablanca and then opted to leave. Hotel Milano has great staff, PERFECT LOCATION, close to absolutely all tourist shopping, restaurants, bars, clubs, and cafes GALORE!!! NO NO NO need for a car in this area, if you get one you'll regret it. The hotel is clean, offers a breakfast on the rooftop for a small fee, AC nice and cool, and rooms comfortable. Carlos , Jose, Jimmy all cool. You can walk to El Morro, catch a ferry to Bacardi for tour and free drinks, walk to Casa Don Q for free drinks, walk to the Casino, catch the bus for 75 cents each way to many beaches.just ask. Cabs are close and present all day and all night. There's somewhere to hang out every night of the week if you stay in the area only. If not, you can bus it or cab it to other surrounding areas. You can even take the bus (75 cents) to get to the nicest shopping mall..Plaza Las Americas where you'll find all your designer stops, GORGEOUS. I'll definitely be back and have recommended this hotel to friends already. Thanks Milano Staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate if you can't stay at Hotel El Convento”
Reviews.Author: pjay46
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate hotel for the price. The lobby is small but nicely appointed, the staff personable, the rooms spacious enough and quite clean, and the rooftop terrace a nice place for breakfast (it's not open for dinner or lunch as of this writing). You can't go wrong staying here if you're on a budget and want to be in the heart of things in Old San Juan. But there's the catch. The Hotel is on the busiest party street in town, Calle Fortaleza, so if you stay there and book a room in the front be sure to bring ear plugs because people cruise with their radios blaring and party hard until 3 a.m. (at least on the Saturday night my wife and I were there). I'd advise staying in one of the rooms in the rear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: nlb777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Milano one day before our Royal Caribbean cruise. Although it says the rooms aren't available until 4pm, we were able to check in and go to our room at 1 pm on Saturday when we arrived. We stayed until 11am the following Sunday. Other than sleeping and showering, we probably spent 45 minutes total in our room. We had room 408 which is in the front and a little larger than the ones in the back with windows that face the street. I know that people complain abut the front rooms being noisy, but we were not bothered by it (although we did come back to our room sometime after 2am after having several drinks). We slept very well. The room itself was nice and clean. One thing that bothered us is that there is no safe in the room and a sign on the door that says something like "we are not responsible for valuables left in the room" but they did have safes in the lobby you can use. We did not use the lobby safe and hid any valuables in our room - there were no issues regardless. The staff was very friendly and gave us some good choices of restaurants for dinner. We woke up too late to try the breakfast on the terrace - I think it closes at 10? The location of this hotel is amazing! It is centrally located to all the great spots in Old San Juan. We were able to walk around the whole area knowing we were not too far from the hotel if we needed a break. I know there are several nicer hotels in the same area, but we wanted to spend less than $150 for the night, and Hotel Milano did not disappoint. Next time we visit, we will probably stay somewhere nicer, but nearby (if we're not on a tight budget). We would like a hotel with a pool and a restaurant/bar in the hotel. Here's a brief review of what we did (if you're interested): We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel for $19 +$1 per bag. We then walked to El Jibarito restaurant for lunch and it was awesome (mofongo is delicious!) - I highly recommend going there. We then walked to the pier area and visited the visitors center to get a map and a free rum punch. We walked along the waterfront and Paseo de la Princesa to El Morro Fortress. El Morro is absolutely beautiful and picturesque - I highly recommend going here. We spent about 2 hours walking around the fort itself and on the beautiful lawn. Afterwards we got a couple mojitos and good tapas at a restaurant right near the hotel (it is next to Dragonfly), went back to shower, then went to dinner at Cafe Puerto Rico (it was down the street from the hotel, the food was good). Afterwards we went to a Dragonfly to have a drink, and then (around 11) we walked around trying to find the "nightlife" but it wasn't too happening nearby. We walked to the pier area again, and this is where it was happening. We walked around the Paseo de la Princesa again, went to a couple bars, and eventually went back to our hotel and passed out. ****DO NOT WEAR HIGH HEEL SHOES IF YOU PLAN ON DRINKING*** The cobblestone streets get very difficult to walk on as the night goes on, and I fell on our way back to the hotel and I fractured a bone in my foot and messed up a tendon there - I was on crutches the entire cruise. Other than that, we had a great time in Old San Juan with a hotel that is located in the hear of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano -- great base for visiting Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MartaFitz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is an affordable, comfortable hotel located in the center of Old San Juan. Its staff (especially Jimmy) is very friendly and helpful -- and totally bilingual. While the rooms were a bit small and ours did not have a real window, they are clean and comfortable. We asked for a room in the back and found it surprisingly quiet, given that the hotel is located on Calle Forteleza, one of the main commercial blocks. And in Old San Juan there is ALWAYS traffic. We found that the halls were a little hot and stuffy, but in our room the a/c worked fine and kept us cool over a hot humid weekend. The hotel does not have a business center per se, but an unexpected surprise was a lobby computer with internet service available for free to guests -- complete with printer for getting boarding passes, etc. Unfortunately, the "penthouse" restaurant is no longer open, but breakfast is available at modest cost on the rooftop. All in all, if you are looking for a mid-range hotel without luxurious amenities but with friendly staff, enough comfort to provide a good night's sleep, and close proximity to everything in Old San Juan -- try the Hotel Milano.

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: IndyDogz
Reviews.Content: The hotel Milano is a good value in old San Juan. It's on Fortalenza, one of the most popular streets. Very convenient to walking around the old city and plenty of very good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for an Old San Juan stay”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaLinda
Reviews.Content: Loved the charm of the hotel. We had two hotel rooms and they were nicely appointed. Not luxurious, but suited our needs for the short time we were in the rooms. They were very clean. We were not in street side rooms and had no problem with noise. We were there during the weekend they had closed the street off for some type of fiesta. Even with the music playing all up and down t he street we did not have a problem with noise. Did not try the continental breakfast ($5 charge) but did use the free wi-fi service. They even had a computer and printer that you could use. That came in really handy when I had to check-in for my flight and print boarding passes. The staff there were so very helpful, from the minute we walked in until we left. They allow you to drop off your luggage if you arrive before check-in or leave it after check-out and they secure it with a chain. I can't say enough about their service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sephora86
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at Hotel Milano. The location is perfect because there are a lot of good restaurants and different activities. The shopping is also nice because there is a lot of choice. Carlos helped us very well and was very kind to us. We had room 310 and for us it was okay. We stayed 3 nights and we didn't spend a lot of time in the room but it had everything we needed. If you do not have a lot of money to spend but you really want to stay in the centre of Old San Juan, Hotel Milano is the best place to stay. Old San Juan is the most beautiful part of San Juan. Another good thing was that the Internet was free to us. Lot of love from Holland!! xx Sephora and Marieke (students)

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere and Service”
Reviews.Author: johnnymd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano was the perfect choice for a stay in Old San Juan. The location is ideal for exploring the old city in safety and comfort. Surrounded by outstanding restaurants, the hotel possesses charm and a most amiable atmosphere. The staff were all outstandingly helpful and attentive, makning sure that we were having a great time in this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: AnaMartel
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. You really feel like you are in Old San Juan. The staff was wonderfully attentive to us. We absolutely love this hotel and if you stay anywhere else in Old San Juan you are missing my point. This hotel worth the money. You will have an outstanding and unique experience. IF YOU GO TO OLD SAN JUAN......STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: LilburnTravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Milano the night before our cruise departed from San Juan. I had found the Milano on this web site and read many of the reviews before deciding to book the room. I must admit I was a bit concerned about the potential noise problems listed by some, but that turned out to not be the case. Even though our room was on the front of the hotel, and there were plenty of late night partiers in the street, the noise did not keep us up, or even awaken us during the night. As a matter of fact, I slept great. I do want to point out how helpful Carlos was at the desk upon our arrival on Saturday afternoon. He was very helpful getting us checked in and making dinner recommendations. I had previously heard of a place just a block down from the Milano and asked him about it. He said it was okay, but if we wanted the best that San Juan had to offer in terms of local cuisine, then La Raices was the place to go. And he was right. It was fantastic. (I plan to enter a review for it as well.) He offered some additional advice for lunch the next day while we waited for the ship to sail. Overall, Carlos certainly helped to make our stay very pleasant. He was by far the friendliest person I have ever encountered at the desk of a hotel and I have traveled to every inhabited continent. So there is no problem with the hotel staff not wanting to be of assistance. Our ship did not depart until late in the day so we checked our luggage at the hotel and went for lunch. When we got back the Milano staff called a taxi for us, waited outside for it to arrive so that we did not have to since it was quite hot, loaded all of our luggage into the taxi (and there was quite a bit, we always overpack for cruises) and come in a got us when all was ready to go. I did not get the name of the gentleman who was handling luggage that day, but if a copy of this makes it to the Milano, it was on the afternoon of May 10. This gentleman was also working in the small roof-top restaurant when we had breakfast. Speaking of the breakfast, it was good, even if it was essentially a continental breakfast. Everything was fresh, and the place was clean. What else can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at Hotel Milano, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: mimaAngie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Milano, right in the centre of Old San Juan. The location is great but the best thing for us was how friendly and helpful the staff were to us. We took advantage of the stay 4 nights, get 1 night free deal. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel free of charge for 2 nights when we went to the island of Vieques and it was very safe. The staff could not do enough to help us during our stay. Free internet access was also a bonus. I would definitely return to this hotel again, it is so central to walk everywhere around the old town. It was a pleasant change to have such friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: vetten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday evening. Carlos was very friendly and helpful upon our 5 PM arrival. I did not ask for a rear room and did not get one. Honestly, though I don't see how the noise could have been much better in one of those rooms. We were hardly in the room at all as we immediately took to the streets to see OSJ which is very cool by the way and get something to eat. We came back around 10 PM and was able to go to sleep and slept pretty well until about 2AM. Yes - there is booming music, loud partying, and traffic noise from horns honking, et. until -I timed it- around 4:30 in the morning. Then it's dead quiet and unless you HAVE to rise early you can get another 3 hours or so of sleep. It was an experience! But the location could not have been better and I would most likely do it again - for one night only though.

Reviews.Title: “Location vrs. Sleep Deprivation”
Reviews.Author: sagacioustraveler
Reviews.Content: We knew the benefits and potential noise problems with the Hotel Milano from other T.A. reviews. At the time I booked and paid for a room (5 months prior to cruise date) I specifically asked for a rear room and was "guaranteed" we would be in room 403 which was quiet room. The Saturday night we arrived, I was told we were "upgraded" to a larger room #407- you guessed it - a front room. All was quiet until 10:30pm when the vibration of the bass and music from the club next door literally shook the windows and floor until 4:30am. No joke. This was on top of blaring car radios, screaming revelers, and other street noise. Ear plugs were useless. The night clerk was unable to move us to a quieter room because the hotel was completely booked. In the morning, I asked why were were given an unwanted "upgrade" to a noisy room, ignoring my "guaranteed" rear room. I told them that had I known they would not have honored this guarantee I would have booked a different hotel. I was not given an answer as to why the room was switched but they offered to give us a slight discount for the inconvenience. Here are Pros and Cons of Hotel Milano. It's a very affordable Hotel and a decent room for the price. It's a great location in Old San Juan and is literally walking distance to the Carnival Cruise Terminal. (An easy, downhill 10 minute walk with wheeled luggage.) The many other T.A. reports of the excessive noise are no exaggeration. If you plan on partying all night or can sleep through anything, then this is probably a good choice if you want to be in OSJ, I would, however, beware of their guarantees of a quiet, rear room due to my experience with this bait and switch. I was told by the front desk that the rear rooms are, in fact, quieter however this may only be relative since the hotel is next door to a club. If you want a restful night prior to your cruise, I would not suggest Hotel Milano. I would recommend a hotel in the Candado district instead.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian45
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing special! If you want to sleep at night, don't stay here. The street noise went on until 3:00 a.m., honking, yelling, non stop party right in the street. When I complained to the desk in the morning, they said yes the noise is a problem. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “not all that exciting”
Reviews.Author: kermit99
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are - blah. The rooftop restaurant is lovely, but it's only open for a few hours in the morning. Beware of street noise, at least on the weekends. The front clerk could not be bothered to help us get another blanket for our room (the air conditioner was freezing) - he was the only staff there and therefore completely unable to leave the desk. Whatever. Don't pay for the continental breakfast. Go to a local cafe and you'll get better food and service for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Staff was incredibly helpful.”
Reviews.Author: aquamoon8
Reviews.Content: Most importantly, the customer service my boyfriend and I received was exceptional. One morning, we showed up too late for breakfast, but they let us have whatever we wanted -- at no charge! Everytime we asked the front desk questions or advice, they were always very eager to help and offered us great advice. The rooms are very basic, nothing fancy, but we didn't come to the Milano expecting the Hilton, so we were very satisfied. As for cleanliness, I thought the rooms very perfectly fine and never had a problem with the carpets. Location was amazing, right in the heart of Old San Juan and everything is accessible on foot, so no transportation is required. One thing I do need to add is that if you are going to stay at the Milano during the weekend and you are a light sleeper, you should probably ask for a room at the back of the hotel. The front rooms do tend to get noisy, but I have no problems sleeping so it never bothered me. I actually enjoyed hearing the sounds of the city at night. We would definitely stay here again, it's perfect for people who don't expect a five star hotel but still enjoy the basic amenities of a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: kek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Milano for one night before leaving on a cruise. Great location close to El Morro, El Convento and great restaurants especially Marmelade, Blend and Parrot Club within walking distance. Service was great, rooms were spotless although a bit dated in decor. The rooftop restaurant was nice, with pretty views of the harbor and city. Breakfast was ok, with great coffee and was included. Great value for the price! Only negative was the noise from the street, which is not the fault of the hotel but the nightlife in the area which I thoroughly enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevenLiverpoolU_K_
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after cruising in the Caribbean. A centrally located hotel. We took advice of other reviewers and asked for a rear room. A good choice bcause the front rooms could have been noisy, especially at night. The staff were extremely pleasant and couldn't have been more helpful. The hotel was clean and pleasant. The room was plain but quite spacious. Good air conditioning and everything that you need in a room. The breakfast isn't complimentary, as suggested, but well worth the few dollars that we spent. Not a huge choice, but enough to feel satisfied. Can eat out on the roof terrace if desired. The Milano is right in the centre of San Juan and therfore in an excellent location for shops, restaurants and attractions. It is near the cruise piers but many of the cruise vessels leave from the Pan American pier which is further away and a taxi journey away. We would recommend this hotel to others. A good price for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Pseattle
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Clean rooms, etc. The A/C fan stays on so the noise bothers my husband, but not me. The people were very helpful and professional. The continental breakfast is not included and costs $5-6. It includes OJ, pineapple juice, coffee, milk, cold cereal, fresh fruit, toast, muffins and pastries. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, rooms are fine, but forget the breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: FramBrett
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location in Old San Juan - right on Calle de Fortaleza, in "SoFo", the neighborhood's dining and nightclub hub. Lots of great restaurants within a block or two. Room was fine. We didn't mind the rear of the building location with small, high windows much as we were there on the weekend and it was away from the street noise. Staff was pleasant and helpful. There's an Internet connected PC in the lobby for guests to use - very helpful. Our biggest complaint, and it's a minor one, was the so-called buffet breakfast. It used to be complimentary (you could see this info blacked on on the hotel literature) but now they charge about $5 a person. The food selection was poor - some pastries and cereal but little in the way of protein except for some individually wrapped slices of processed cheese. Coffee was good though. Come on folks. I'd rather pay more for a better selection, or better yet, or for about the same price, go to one of the nearby cafes where the locals eat, like Cafe Mallorca or La Bombonera. We did that the next day and loved it. All in all, if you skip the breakfast, I think you'll be satisfied with Hotel Milano. The other selling point was they have a rooftop restaurant where breakfast is served al fresco, but it's screened in with mesh netting so the views are really interrupted. My guess is it was less a safety factor than to keep napkins and paper plates and such from blowing off the roof, because San Juan is fairly windy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Fortaleza_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Milano for one night (Friday!) just prior to our cruise. The location is unbeteable, in the heart of Old San Juan. The place is clean and the staff friendly. The rate though, too high for what it offers. Our room was facing the back of the building, so noise was not an issue. Lots of places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: vegetarianmom
Reviews.Content: Staff is professional & friendly - but a couple times when I asked for info (for example, the Children's museum) I was greeted with a shrug and a head shake. I started to wonder if they understood English. The gentleman that runs the breakfast buffet was wonderful and sitting outside was fun - but the food did leave something to be desired. All the food was basically beige colored carb food. The bananas were gone the second day - as a matter of fact, they were pretty well gone the first day - It is very nice that they lock up your bags for you after you check out - that was a major convenience and they were great about it - About the cleanliness of the rooms; I would sum it up by saying that someone is trying very hard to clean these rooms but that person is not a professional. I had read the reviews about the dirty carpets and I was prepared with extra socks and I did indeed use them. Two other negatives - Thursday night we slept fine but Friday night - OMG! The noise was REALLY loud from the nightclubs. My three year old went right to sleep but my husband and I tossed and turned for hours. If you are someone who worries about a fire breaking out - or if you are at all claustrophobic - make sure you are getting a room with windows that open that you could get out of if you needed to. The smoke alarm looked 20 years old and if you don't have a good window to get out of - there's only one way out of the bldg. Take a look at some of the pictures of the rooms and I think you will see what I mean. This may not be an issue for you - but it's a "thing" for me. Would I recommend this place - yes, I suppose, for a night or two - especially during the week. Bring extra socks. It seems expensive but it's in line with other San Juan hotels. We absolutely LOVED Old San Juan and we would love to go back some day - I think of it as a Caribbean version of New Orleans - the food alone made it worth it. Location is wonderful - especially for restaurants. We are vegetarians and we were just amazed at the incredible food that was available - all within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoFriendly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise for us. It is very clean and comfortable. It is in a great location for walking around Old San Juan. A variety of restaurants are within walking distance. The staff was very helpful to us and we felt safe the whole time there. I would highly recommend it to others, and will use it again if I get back to Old San Juan, Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff...will stay again”
Reviews.Author: beatlebark
Reviews.Content: Location was ideal. Many local businesses and restaurants with in walking distance. Staff was very helpful. Rooftop restaurant was great, just too bad it is not open in the evening. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, musty room”
Reviews.Author: Zeolite8
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel in Old San Juan and the staff was welcoming and helpful. The room was average in size and content, the windows were very small and didn't open, and the carpet seemed a little too old to comfortably walk on with bare feet. Most notably, the room was very musty. There was an air freshener in the room obviously attempting to mask the order, perhaps it was only a temporary problem but it was annoying none-the-less. The breakfast balcony location is nice, but the buffet food left much to be desired - think cornflakes and bananas.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Darshan1
Reviews.Content: This hotel struck us as a little pricey for what received, but perhaps we made a mistake by booking directly. However, it is ideal for people leaving on cruises out of San Juan, and it seemed like the vast majority of people staying there did just that. The cruise ship port is very nearby, and the hotel has a fairly organized system of watching over the luggage of checked-out guests waiting until they could board their ships. They lock your suitcases with a chain and give you a claim ticket, so you can go shop, eat, or see sights in Old San Juan. The lobby is a little small for hoards of suitcases, and everyone tries to check out at once, so do give yourself an extra 10 minutes if you need to catch a flight. The rooms are basic. We stayed in 309 one night and 409 on our return. 409 was nicer and less noisy, although we were in 309 on a Saturday night. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Nothing special, but perfectly fine. They have a continental breakfast on the fifth floor (not included, but only about $5.50 per person - ask for a bottle of water on your way out (free) so you don't have to buy one while touring Old Town). Also, they have a computer in the lobby which you can use for free to check e-mail or print out a boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Are they kidding!!!”
Reviews.Author: imleavinnow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Milano for one night prior to boarding a cruise ship the following day. We couldn't believe the chaos when we arrived there, people were crowding the very small reception area and the man behind the reception area, who quite clearly was not a people person and couldn't cope with more than two people at a time, was rude to guests who were waiting to be booked in, he shouted at one man to close the door. We were given a key to our room and were horrified when we entered to find no window except two small square frosted glass tiles at the top of the wall, it was like a prison cell, the room was dated and had a stale odour. We went for breakfast on the "terrace" which was horrible, they were offering coffee in plastic cups and pastries on plastic plates ....the price was outrageous and we found a darling restaurant round the corner for half the price. This place is a rip off and for all those people who think it is a "jewel" in the heart of old San Juan all I can say is you are not well travelled and your crown is very tarnished indeed...... not recommended to anyone who likes clean, good service and a room with a view....the rate for all of this.....outrageous....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: atlantaresident
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous. On the same block as six or seven highly recommended restaurants. The breakfast upstairs should be skipped, especially since two great breakfast opportunities are literally around the corner - La Bombonera and La Mallorca. The Christmas decorations were still up in Plaza Colon which was at the end of the street and groups were singing. The room was clean, the decoration tending toward shabby chic. The front desk was helpful. We thought it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Tripgal09
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is the perfect place to experience the magic of Old San Juan. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful; they suggested excellent restaurants and entertainment venues that made our stay very enjoyable. The room was very comfortable and the cleaning staff was very efficient. The hotel has a great location, right in the heart of Old San Juan, within walking distance to a number of restaurants and cocktail lounges and historical sites like â€œEl Morro,â€� which is absolutely amazing. I have already recommended this hotel to three of my friends, who were planning a trip down there, and I recommend it to anyone who is interested in going to Puerto Rico and having an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: jennyjayfl88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Milano for 1 night after our Southern Caribbean cruise. The hotel is located right in the heart of Old San Juan, so you can save your money and walk to the many nearby shops, restaurants, and attractions. They have a nice rooftop restaurant that we ate at for dinner which was quite good. The rooms are clean and decent sized as well. I would be sure to book a room away from the main street or at least on one of the upper floors if you are a light sleeper especially if you are staying there on a Friday or Saturday night as the traffic and music from the cars below can be disturbing if you are a light sleeper. The staff were very nice and accomodating, even allowing us to leave our luggage there all afternoon after the morning we checked out as we had a late flight out of San Juan. All in all, we felt the hotel was a great value compared to some of the other hotels in the downtown San Juan area and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “an ok option for old san juan”
Reviews.Author: dontstopthecarnival
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for 2 nights. it was the second time this year, and i've stayed there before. in the past, i/we felt the hotel was good, but this time we had some problems. unfortunately, there are not too many options in this price range if you want to stay in the heart of old san juan. the room wasn't adequately clean, the faucet in the sink had a bad leak. the staff seemed indifferent to the guests, they didn't seem eager to greet us or offer us advice on what to do. my wife and i got this feeling from all staff day and night, about 4 or 5 employees. again it is a good option for old san juan - but i wouldn't give it more than a 3 on tripadvisor's scale of 1-5.

Reviews.Title: “Make Hotel Milano your base, while visiting Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mrw947
Reviews.Content: Warm, friendly, helpful, comfortable, affordable, perfect location!! Just a few of the words to describe this hotel and its' staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tonya Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Milano the night before cruising on the Carnival Liberty. This hotel is right in the heart of San Juan and only about 5 blocks or so from the port. You have easy access to food and everything else in the city. They were also very reasonably priced compared to the other hotels in the area. It is a very basic hotel and if you are looking for fancy this is not it. Its great for one night. You also want to make sure you get a room in the front. There is a club next to the hotel and you can hear the music from it in the rooms in the back. Other than that great stay. We had the continental breakfast the next morning which was only $6.00 a piece. There is also a Mcdonalds and Burger King if you dont want that. There is a great Spanish food resteraunt called Raizes a few blocks away where the food is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Intimate. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeTraveler68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Milano the day prior to our cruise. The definite pluses were the location and the friendliness of the staff. At check out time, they would store your bags which gave us time to tour the town without worrying about what to do with our bags. Even at the end of our stay, the manager loaded our luggage onto the cab for us. The rooms were definitely small and vary amongst other rooms. We ended up with a corner room which was significantly smaller but the same price as the other larger rooms our friends had. I was able to note this to management and they gave me a reduction in the price. In addition, do ask for a room in the middle of the hotel and not an outside room. It was very noisy during the middle of the night with all the bars close by. Overall for a one night stay it was very nice because everything was within walking distance. The only area that wasn't close by were the casinos which you would need to take a short cab ride to.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and nice overall”
Reviews.Author: Veivalina
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is perfectly located in san juan, in the middle of the clubs, nice restaurants, and surrounded by the colorful colonial houses. It was not too noisy when we stayed there, although the clubs are very close, so I guess that during high season you can't avoid some noise. We were in a queen room, clean and comfortable, with a small fridge -only missing the coffee maker-. The owner has put framed poems on the walls, and I must say he keeps the hotel with good taste.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: ewpeetz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano after reading the reviews in Trip Advisor, and we were extremely pleased. We arrived after a weeks cruise on a Sunday before noon, and the staff were very gracious, checking our luggage until rooms were available. We set off from the hotel to explore Old San Juan, and found it was pefectly located to see the old city. After exploring the streets, doing some shopping, eating lunch and touring the Fort, we returned to the hotel to check in and take a nap. Our room was located on the 4th floor, and the elevator was more that adequate to take us and all our luggage upstairs. Our room had no regular windows, just glass block windows located high up on the wall from which we couldn't look through. No matter, this hotel is clean, the bed and bathroom were comfortable and pretty, (loved the cut-linen shower curtain), the fridge was big enough to hold plenty of wine, etc. We heard no noise from the street or the rest of the hotel. The front desk staff were especially helpful, and advised us about cabs etc. for our early morning flight. It did take less than 5 minutes for the taxi to arrive in the morning, as they said it would. This hotel is very reminiscent of European hotels we have visited, (however the rooms at the Milano were larger than many European hotels) and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking an excellent value in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, GREAT Location!”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Traveller11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano in Old San Juan is a great place to stay, especially for the location. The hotel is located right in the heart of Old San Juan and is in walking distance to all the sights and all the restaurants and bars in the area. The hotel itself is nice (if not a little dated). The people at the front desk were friendly and are more than happy to hold luggage or call you a cab. Surprisingly, the hotel is quiet at night. We had no problem with noise inside or outside of the hotel while we were sleeping. The rooms are clean (the carpet is a little old) and they come with a cable tv and refrigerator. The price was pretty good when we went also. If you are looking for a nice little hotel where you don't have to worry about transportation, this would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and charming... right in old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: happy_in_the_islands
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Milano twice now The second time was just as great as the first I would encourage anyone to overlook some other visitors short sighted remarks and stay at the Milano You will be glad you did.... It is beautifully situated in old town It is "old and Charming" hotel Everything works and it is safe and comfortable If you want Holiday Inn Express, Stay in the United States.... If you want to experience Puerto Rico Stay with the other guests at the Hotel Milano

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano works for me”
Reviews.Author: GEB577
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Hotel Milano for 5-6 years, and they always deliver. Late arrival, no problem. Insanely early departure, no problem. Always clean, clean, clean, and for Old San Juan, the best value. Just stayed there recently and Hiram and the folks took care of me. Only bummer is that they no longer serve dinner at the rooftop restaurant, but go up for breakfast, the view of San Juan bay is fab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: pkul85
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor.com. We paid about 100.00 USD for it all together ( 2 of us).. let me say, i was really expecting something low class.. but it was really pretty. We experienced the local feel that we wanted to as my friend and i did not want to come to puerto rico and just stay at a hilton or mariott. I believe this place had 4 floors.. and was supposed to have a rooftop bar/restraunt.. but it was closed when we stayed there. We just gof off the royal carribean cruise, and stopped by our hotel to see if the room was ready @ 9am.. little did we know that check in was at 3. Completely fatigued out, we decided that we would just walk around old san juan for a few hours as the hotel is litereally center city (which is an amazing thing btw). We went out for some coffee and came back to rest in about 1/2 an hour.. the owner was so accomodating, he asked for a houskeeper to clear and clean a room.. he then changed our room number and let us settle in early! There is a computer linked with internet in the lobby, which we had to wait a few minutes to use. Overall the hotel is very cute, the room comes with a book of wise sayings. i believe its written by a local poet... its kinda nice. Hotel milano did not seem like a hotel at all.. room and bathroom were spacious, seemed like home. I will recommend it every time !

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay”
Reviews.Author: LindsayD29
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call Hotel Milano "upscale", but it is definitely a good deal for the location. It is so convenient. We were able to walk to our cruise boat after one night's stay. The room was clean, but small and lacking much of a view. It gets pretty noisy at night until about 5am. Were able to sleep through it, though. I recommend getting a room in the back of the hotel. The restaurant on top is basically never open, it seems. There are so many great restaurants nearby, though. I would certainly recommend it for a short stay in Old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine02120
Reviews.Content: This isn't a luxury hotel and doesn't have a ton of amenities, but it is very nice. We felt that it was our "home away from home." It's within walking distance of everything- museums, forts, shops, eateries etc. You even have a trolley stop a block from the hotel, which is convenient for those who don't want to walk to the forts. Also convenient, if you like to shop or want to rest a bit throughout the day- after shopping, we would stop in to rest and drop off bags and after 15 mins or so we'd take off again. I don't know about other posts on here, but our room was clean when we arrived. We got clean towels every day and our room was clean when we got back in the afternoon. If you are used to the Ritz or HIlton, or expect a room like theirs, then this may not be the place for you. Quick check-in/out process. There was a small refrigerator in our room, which was great. A small microwave would've been convenient to heat our leftovers for a "late snack", asbit seems that there weren't any eateries that would deliver. (According to one staff member.) Sometimes we'd want to eat something around 11pm and most places were closing or closed. I do have to say that the elevator is a bit scary; we got scared every time it stopped. We didn't go to the restaurant (Panorama), therefore I cannot comment on that. The only thing I know is that it is $5.00 pp, plus tax. (Obviously) The staff was friendly (except for one person who seemed a bit "into self") but besides that, excellent service from the rest! We were always greeted by these individuals who called our taxi & even called a few tour companies to try to get us on one. (Thanks!) We had great "chats" with these individuals and they always managed to say "hello" and smile. I would stay here again. I am a simple gal who likes the simple things in life.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: micriollo
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Puerto Rico on my 25th wedding anniversary. I found the hotel staff very friendly and attentive. They even left a bottle of wine in my room upon my arrival and a congratulatory note. My wife loved the clean room. It is simple and to the point. We wanted a safe, clean place to sleep and be able to conveniently roam about the city. I certainly recommend it. This was the first of three stays throughout Puerto Rico dusring our week. If you are looking for fancy setting, stay elsewhere. But if you want a clean, comfortable room, quiet and secure, then this is the place for the money. I did a lot of research on the area and was not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: anfral
Reviews.Content: I spent two out of six nights here and I must admit that they have been absolutely the worst! Really really rude staff, small rooms, no windows and bad service should be enough to mark this hotel with a big black cross and never come back again!!! In my opinion the best hotel is The Gallery Inn, straight on the ocean, excellent service, big rooms and an artistic touch which makes it just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Charming & simple in the PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: quasan
Reviews.Content: With the help of TripAdvisor, I found out about this great hotel in San Juan. The staff was friendly, the rooms made me feel like I was right at home, and the location was more than perfect. It's on a cute, cobblestone street with lots of great restaurants and entertainment just steps away. The hotel is not loaded with amenities, but definitely has all the basics you would need to feel more than comfortable. If you plan on exploring the city and just being at the hotel to take a siesta and sleep at night, then Hotel Milano is a great choice. I experienced absolutely no noise pollution as some of the other reviews mentioned. My only complaints were that the shower stall was not totally clean and some of the cereal boxes offered for breakfast were expired. Overall, I recommend Hotel Milano and would stay there again during my next visit to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: telliott76
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location, decent rooms and a nice rooftop breakfast but that's about all the positive things I can say. The staff was quite rude to us. Every time we went to the lobby they seemed annoyed that we were interrupting their games of solitaire to ask a question. When we'd walk through the lobby, there would be no greeting. It was not a language barrier becuase we are both fluent in Spanish. We were just completely ignored and treated as if the staff was too busy to pay any attention to us. This was our last stop on a 10 day P.R. trip and was hands down the worst customer service of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh...”
Reviews.Author: bonjonsc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not an upscale hotel, despite the description they write up on their webpage and on the front of the tripadvisor page here. There is nothing upscale about this place-- as someone just posted, it does feel like a flashback to the motor hotels so popular more than a while ago. However, the room was pretty clean, but worse for the wear. We didn't pay for breakfast at the hotel, so we can't tell you what that was like. We did have problems with noise, even though we were in room 404 at the rear of the property-- as we had been advised to request. When we went to bed around midnight both nights of our stay, things were relatively quiet. However, both nights we were awakened around 3 a.m. to blaring music from somewhere outside. I am not sure if you should ask for the rear or the front of this property either...When we left at 4:30 a.m. for our flight, we could still hear the thumping in our room. But, when we stepped out into the street to get into the taxi, it was quiet. Bizarre. The staff was largely aloof and wasn't effusively friendly. We also didn't care for the fact that two book-sized religious tracts had been placed in the room prominently by the owner of the hotel. A Bible put into a drawer is okay, but we felt that these books-- which you could buy if you wanted!-- overstepped that line. But of course, those are easily ignored. What is good about the hotel is the location in Old San Juan and there is a free public computer with Internet access and printer.

Reviews.Title: “Flash Back to the 50s”
Reviews.Author: Abuella-Linda
Reviews.Content: Like others, we wanted a convenient place to spend 2 nights before and 2 nights after a cruise. The Milano really did remind us of a 50s hotel, or one in a third world country - we do a lot of international travel. The carpet and bedding were very old, but clean enough. The plastic flower arrangements and old kitchen table and chairs were very outdated. The television had only a few channels, but we didn't watch much television. We were irritated that the free breakfast was no longer offered and no one bothered to tell us before we booked. It was extremely irritating that the Panorama Restaurant so highly praised is "closed until further notice" and for sale. The double door/glass hallway security was a nice feature. No problems with noise. On return from the cruise we opted for da House around the corner which was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: keypeds
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thru traveladvisor . It is a two star hotel due to the services not offered . However they are the best two star hotel . Meaning the room was very clean and was cleaned every day as was the entire hotel everything was very clean and neat . The air conditioner was as cold as you desired . At night there was no noise ,we were on the third floor. The front desk staff was very friendly and prompt. The location is excellent for walking thru old san juan or to the cruise terminal.You are in an ideal location.They even have an empty mini refrigerator .There is all you need ,no luxury or bellhop.The owner is a type of philosopher poet and there are samples of his thoughts in the room to view .Great Karma at this place . You can tell they are always looking to make sure all is well.Sort of like living in a condo with a good front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Milano twice in the past few years. It has an ideal location in historic Old San Juan. You can walk to the incredible old forts, shore side walking paths, and fantastic restaurants. You can also walk to the Bacardi Distillery if you want to. It is in a very nice, safe neighborhood where residents and families are out in the street at night chatting, relaxing, and buying pina coladas outdoors from the corner vendors. There are flowing vines and wrought iron balconies lining the streets, and festivals and parties with traffic routes closed off at night. The hotel itself is not fancy, but clean, with a helpful, friendly staff. The price is right, too, starting at $85 to be in the center of town. It is not very near the big resort/beach areas, but I prefer to go to one of the outlying islands for beach activities, where they aren't overrun with tourists and crowds. Old San Juan is interesting and beautiful for its history and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Sofia513
Reviews.Content: After reading some recent reviews of hotel Milano I was a bit nervous to book my stay there. After I got to the hotel, I was sooo glad that I booked it because it is in the perfect location. The noise is not as bad as I thought it would be. It is noisy (after all it is on Fortaleza Ave). There are a few bars around the corner that stay open till late. TIP: Don't book your hotel at Da House hotel if you think you'll be better off. Its located right above NuYo Rican Cafe (Bar/lounge). Hote Milano was fine, I stayed in room 208 which is facing the street on the second floor. Don't bring those ear plugs, they are really not needed. The Bathroom was unbelievably clean and always had clean towels when we got back from exploring the town. The staff was extremely helpful with any questions and the internet access is free! Do try to walk a few minutes to get to a restaurant called "El Jibarito". This was typical Puerto Rican food. Only $10/per. to get a fool meal. El Morro is about 5mins. and the trolly I think is free or $5 at the most. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask. I definitely will be staying at hotel Milano very soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: 2doodles
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Hotel Milano and will definately stay there again when we return. The ambience reflected Old San Juan perfectly. I can't say enough of the staff, they were exceptional. My only suggestion would be to open the rooftop in the afternoon for patrons that would like to sit in the sun to read or just relax or in the evenings just to relax and view the city (the rooftop is open for breakfast). I've read a regative review and I'm really sorry they didn't have a good experience. They really missed something wonderful. We travel a great deal and always try to stay in an area where we can experience the local people. We adjust our expectations accordingly. Also, when I make my reservations well in advance, common sense tells me to reverify my reservations before my arrival date.

Reviews.Title: “The cockroach on the wall was the least of our problems...”
Reviews.Author: spandrelina
Reviews.Content: I grew up on the island and have always known this hotel to be a lovely spot in the heart of Old San Juan. Something must have happened in the past few years... No one helped us with our luggage- even though the bellhop was hanging out in the lobby speaking to the desk clerk. We also arrived to find the famous "Panorama" restaurant on the top floor closed "until further notice". The Panorama, by the way, is also the location of the internet hotspot on the property. The elevator jolts so strongly when it reaches its destination that you desperately grab for something- anything- to hold on to; and it never gets any better. There is a stale carpet smell that permeates the entire place, and upon entering our room our hearts sank. This was not like any of the rooms pictured online- everything was rusty and smelly, there was barely any room to walk, every surface was sticky, the mattress must have been at least ten years old and it showed- the pillows were flat, the blankets had an odor to them, etc. We went to the lobby and requested a room change and were told that nothing could be done, but that they would refund our next two nights stay if we wished. (We had paid for the full three nights months ago). Funnily enough, the lady at the front desk did not seemed surprised at all that we were disappointed with our room- as if this were a common event for her. We decided to toughen up and stay through the night. We watched all of the six channels available on the grimy tv set and laughed at the fact that there was no phone book available (plus even local calls are thirty cents a minute) but there were tons of pamphlets on catholicism on the dresser (all marked as "please do not remove from room") The next morning we woke up and there was a cockroach on our wall, just casually traipsing by. Then we headed out to beautiful Old San Juan after waiting for the elevator with a "professional". (nope, not kidding). If you are on a super tight budget and want to stay in the heart of Old San Juan ( a definite bonus) then take this place into consideration. This place can definitely be sold as a motel, but that is about it. Consider the HoJo around the corner. They were kind enough to refund our money, however- I genuinely hope that our stay was atypical...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: photolady1000
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Milano for 2 nights in April and were very pleased with the wonderful location, the cleanliness, and the friendly helpful attitude of all staff. Breakfast on the roof deck was fine too. We did find street noise a problem, and suggest you book upper rooms that face the back or side rather than the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Great, unless you plan to spend time in your room”
Reviews.Author: sarahrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Hotel Milano last week. For the price and location, this is the place to stay in Old San Juan. Very reasonable (almost cheap!) price, fantastic location - Fortaleza street is where it's at for shopping and restaurant selection. Be ready for street noise/music into the wee hours if you have a room on the street side. The people at the desk were very friendly, professional, and helpful. The $5 breakfast was a good deal but nothing special. The thing we didn't like was that the rooms were small, old, and well, not very nice to hang out in at all. We were often tired from shopping and wanted a place to just hang out and read and relax. This is when we wished we had spend the extra money to stay someplace nicer, like the Gallery Inn. But if you plan to spend all of your time in the streets, shops, and restaurants - go for Hotel Milano!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: lmslough
Reviews.Content: The Milano Hotel is wonderful...the staff is very helpful. The room was lovely, and they have hot water in PR!! A+++ experience. Terrific location in Old San Juan. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance and Won Big”
Reviews.Author: mkesty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I normally stay at the chain/spa style hotels generally and decided to do something different this time. We stayed at the Milano 2 nights before a cruise out of PR. The staff was extremely friendly and the rooms were clean and charming. The location is perfect for those wanting to be located in the middle of some great history, shopping, restaurants and night activity. If you are going to stay in Old San Juan, do not rent a car, spend the time wandering the streets by foot or free trolly. For a boutique style hotel, we could not have picked a better place. We would highly recommend a stay at the Milano.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano was located in the heart of Ole San Juan, Puerto Rico. A short taxi ride from the airport. The location was wonderful if you did not want to rent a car. The Hotel was very clean, rooms small but user friendly. The entire staff was easy to deal with and very helpful. The roof top continental breakfast spot was lovely, the breakfast good. Enjoyed my stay. Would return again and recommend the Hotel Milano to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Milano, Old San Juan, PR, was a delight.”
Reviews.Author: Edie_and_Erno
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 8 nights at the Hotel Milano, 307 Fortaleza Street, Old San Juan, Puerto Rico, and it was everything we needed. The location was right in the heart of Old San Juan on a street with some of the best restaurants in the historic section, between the two forts, and within easy walking distance of all the sights. A generous breakfast, included in the price of the room, was served with Latin music from a jukebox on a roof from which we had a beautiful view. The room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was always kept well-stocked with toiletpaper, facial tissues, soap, and shampoo. The tv in our room had good reception, so we were able to keep up with the news. At the computer in the lobby we printed the boarding passes for the return flight. The entire staff, the housekeepers, concierge, and breakfast-hosts, were pleasant, conscientious, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “visiting relatives”
Reviews.Author: 2ameigos
Reviews.Content: We had a cruise going out of Puerto Rico and wanted to fly in early for a few days to enjoy the sights of Old San Juan and picked this lovely little jewel called the Milano Hotel right in the heart of the city. We arrived late, but like relatives waiting for you to come, the hotel had a person there waiting with a smile to greet us and get us quickly to our room that was ready for us. It was small, but we are used to cruise ship cabins so that was ok cause it was cheery and clean. The next morning there was persons to greet us in the restaurant with a nice selection of things from toast, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurts, muffins, milk,coffee, and juice to start off our day. It was a balmy morning so we choose to sit on the balcony to eat. In leaving for the day the front desk answered all our questions we needed to get on the right bus to get us where we wanted to go. It was lovely just to walk to the awesome 400 year old fort of San Christobal and walk to the many plaza's that surrounded the Hotel. Many stores available for shopping and a great restraunt called the Parrot Club for great Puerto Rican dishes. Unfortunately the Milano Hotels dinning room was closed while we were there for our stay so we ate at nearby restaurants which was no problem. Also we were walking distance to Burger King and McDonalds. Taxi stands were on the corner, but we found it enjoyable just to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Once we took the trolley from San Christobal to the other Fort called El Morro and the trolley was free. It goes from fort to fort which by the way was only $5.00 a person entrance to both forts. At the end of each day our room at the hotel was waiting for us with clean towels for a hot shower and clean made up bed. I had read in this web sight postings that the Hotel being next to the locals clubs at night could become noisy, and yes it was a couple of times, so I took ear plugs just in case, but we were so tired from the day of sight seeing we crashed and it really didn't bother us. The last bit of great news for the cruisers who read this and that is you can just walk over to the peirs and check in to your cruise ship with no problem. Also for 25 cents pp you can get on the ferry right at the same place to take you across the bay where you get a taxi for $6.00 to take you to the Barardi Rum Distillery that gives you a free tour and free rum drinks which my husband really enjoyed. In all I would say the $95.00 a night for the Milano Hotel was a great deal and I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Puerto Rico in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and bland.”
Reviews.Author: sparkles530
Reviews.Content: The hotel I usually stay at in Old San Juan was booked, so we got a room at this hotel. It was way over priced for what it was and the staff was extremely rude to us the second we walked in. The rooms are reminiscent of a really old Days Inn or Super 8. The room wasn't that clean and looked like it hadn't been renovated in over 25 years. The nightly charge was $196, compared to the amazing hotel we usually stay at ($80 - $120), it was a total ripoff. If you are looking for a great place to stay call Da' House. It is a really cute hotel and they have some guest houses too. I have stayed with them a few times and the have beautiful, clean rooms with original art and a friendly staff. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but you might want earplugs”
Reviews.Author: LasMananitas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano's location is a real plus during the day because Old San Juan's historic sites and restaurants are all within walking distance. Unfortunately street noise becomes a problem at night if you book a room facing the street. We booked over the phone and were given the choice of a front room with a window, or an inside room without windows. I picked a front room, thinking a windowless room would be claustrophobic... but now I realize it would have the advantage of being quiet! Otherwise, the staff is friendly, our room was clean and comfortable, and we appreciated the mini-fridge. I'd stay there again... I'd just pick up a pair of those foam earplugs at the drugstore first!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowRobbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milano for 2 nights last year pre-cruise having read about it on Tripadvisor. Was not disappointed then, and booked up for the same again this year. Again not disappointed. Hotel commands an ideal situation for viewing the Old Town, and designer shops. Still great value for money. Hotel is clean, staff welcoming and breakfast adequate considering what the room rate is against other hotels in San Juan. If you want pancakes for breakfast, bacon and all the trimmings, spend another $200 and go elsewhere. The Milano will do for me every time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in an ideal locationl”
Reviews.Author: MargaretGranada
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel with personalised service and excellent value for money. We spent one night in January and two nights in February at the Hotel Milano in San Juan. The hotel is situated in an ideal location, right in the centre of the old town and right next to some really good restaurants. The rooms are comfortable, nicely decorated and have efficient air-conditioning units. On our first night we stayed in one of the rooms which overlooked the street outside and we didn't find it at all noisy, contrary to some other reports we had read. The reception staff were extremely helpful and efficient, particularly Laura. Breakfast is served in the restaurant at the top of the building, where there is also an open patio area with views over the roof tops. Breakfast consists of hot rolls, croissants or apple turnovers, fruit, cereal, juice, tea and coffee. The restaurant at the moment is only open for breakfast. We had two wonderful dinners at the nearby Marmalade Restaurant (pacific rim with a touch of Iberia) and the Tantra (Indo-Latino Cuisine), where there was also an extensive list of exotic martinis. We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: NoahNYC
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of Old San Juan, easy walking to all the sites. Clean, comfortable, and quiet, with friendly staff. This is our second time there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mortypro
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel milano for one night prior to our cruise it's location is perfect in old san juan. a short walk to everything the rooms are small but super clean the staff helpful and they even have a free cont. breakfast on the rooftop resturant we would stay there again for a one or two night stay

Reviews.Title: “Bad sleep, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jim_and_Barbie
Reviews.Content: Another review warned that some rooms do not have any windows, so when I booked my room I was sure to request a room with a window. Perhaps that was a mistake. Even though we were on the 4th floor, the noise from the busy street in front of the hotel was too loud to allow a good night's sleep. We were there on a Saturday night, and the loud noise from the party crowd on the street lasted until well past 3 AM. I don't know if the hotel has rooms with windows on the back of the hotel away from the street. If so, I would ask for one of those. Otherwise, I would probably opt for a room without windows, or try a different hotel. Parking is a bit of a hassle, so if you will be staying at this hotel at the beginning of your trip, consider renting your car on the day you leave the old San Juan area. If you will be staying here at the end of your trip, turn in your rental car first, then take a cab to the hotel from the rental car place. Then just take a cab to the airport on the day you leave. That's what we ended up doing, and it worked out well. Old San Juan is small enough so you can just walk. No need for a car, particularly since the parking is expensive and 2 blocks away. The hotel's location is excellent for walking around old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “While not being exceptional it does not deserve the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: 1allsop
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned when we chose the Hotel Milano in San Juan. Although "chose" might be the wrong term as all other Hotels were booked out and we had no other choice. Admittedly, we were slightly concerned as there were many negative reviews. For this reason we were expecting an old, bad place. Not so! It is clean and the staff is mostly friendly. We were pleasantly surprised. Futhermore, the location is exceptional: literally in the middle of old San Juan. Do not expect flashy rooms with a magnficient view though: our room had very small windows with a view to brick wall (note that almost all rooms share the same dull view), but its reviews on tripadvisor are way below what it deserves. The only negative aspect is that at night, and especially during weekends, the nearby clubs are quite noisy and you can hear the music. Nothing major - especially if you have earplugs. All in all I would definitely recommend it and I think it deserves a rating of four, especially if consider its location and its extremely good price.

Reviews.Title: “Milano was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: LeVoyageurDuMonde
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on the WEB. It was clear from reviews at tripadvisor that the owner was an interesting person and that the hotel would likely be to our taste. We were not disappointed on either. We stayed two nights in November, 2007, prior to a cruise. The hotel was very accessible and centrally located in the old town, with ready access to a wide variety of restaurants. We found the old town to be a safe area for evening strolls, and of course great for sightseeing. Our room was spacious and in the front â€“ while others had complained of noise, we heard none, perhaps because it was November. Quiet all night. The bed was comfortable; the plumbing and air conditioning worked well. Altogether, this was a perfect location for anyone prior to, or just after, a cruise as the boats were just a short distance away. The owner proved to be quite personable and quite interesting to talk with. He was ready to spend time with his guests and to provide advice when requested. We would happily stay there again and we would definitely recommend this hotel to our best friends.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare”
Reviews.Author: SE53
Reviews.Content: Just spent the last two nights of a 10-day Puerto Rico vacation at Hotel Milano. Owner Juan San Emeterio was clearly the highpoint of not only our stay there, but of our entire vacation. He is gracious, attentive, generous, and utterly delightful. Our room was clean, quiet, simple; bed was very comfortable. I would definitely return, but would not stay in the same room due to its only two extremely tiny windows. (To the hotel's credit, the clerk who took the booking mentioned "small windows" in the only room he said was free; but these were unimaginably tiny - perhaps 10 inches square - high up just below the ceiling. Other guests mentioned their windows were fine.) Only other room problem we encountered was that there was no way to control the AC until we asked, but then we were given one of (only) two existing remotes from the front desk, which worked fine. We loved being able to have continental breakfast outside on the rooftop, although encroaching development is fast shrinking the view of the city. The evening restaurant grill is no longer in operation, but there are so many great restaurants worth exploring within even just a block of the hotel that we had no shortage of great dining experiences. Juan also gave us excellent recommendations, so each of our meals in Old San Juan were really great. The hotel location is superb for walking around Old San Juan. And when we wanted to go outside the city, Juan facilitated trips to the produce market, the Santurce Art Museum (beautiful!),etc., including to the airport when we departed. I can't wait to return to San Juan, to bask in the warmth of the city as well as the warmth that emanates from Juan San Emeterio and Hotel Milano.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you don't mind not sleeping...”
Reviews.Author: walterandcharlie
Reviews.Content: After researching many websites, I choose Hotel Milano based on favorable reviews. All I can say is they were WRONG. The Rooms are in desparate need of remodeling. The carpets are crunchy- as in I don't know whats on them, but wear your slippers. The bed was small (advertised as a queen- closer to a full size) and had a huge lump in the middle that left my husband clinging to the bed all night to keep from rolling out. The worst part though- the all night dance music that started at 10:00pm and finally stopped at 5:00am. Loud enough to shake the bed. On the positive side, the staff was helpful and the location can't be beat. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone wishing for a good nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: CrossTCOB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Milano as the first stop of my honeymoon. We took a cab from the airport (which is easy because there is a line-up for cab's at the airport and set prices in San Juan, $22 to Hotel Milano.) The person working the front was very nice, the hotel lobby was clean and attractive, and our room was very clean as well. I've read some review on here saying that it's too loud staying on the front-side of the hotel but I didn't notice an issue. Although if you are a VERY light sleeper and wanted to go to bed early (before midnight) you might notice the the stereo of the odd passing car. The hotel's location is the best part, not even a block away from a bunch or really good restaurants and bars. Our favourite was El Toro Salao which does mostly tapas. In general a good hotel for a little bit more reasonable price compared to other hotels in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Milano is very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Mdemontaigne
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a pleasant night's stay at the Milano. Room was clean and comfortable, and reasonably priced for San Juan. Staff was very helpful and courteous. At least on the upper floor where we were staying it was quiet. And the continental breakfast was very substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation for old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RDPWiltshire_England
Reviews.Content: A good value, clean, friendly independent hotel right in the heart of old San Juan. The hotel is nothing fancy, but does what it does very well indeed. The the public areas, the bedroom and the linen were comfortable, well-maintained and clean. Our room only had high-level windows with a view (if you are tall) of blank walls and air-conditioning units, but that didn't matter to us - we were out and about most of the time. The roof terrace breakfast area was very pleasant with views (restricted) in all directions, but was not accessible directly from the elevator (a short flight of steps). The breakfast was included and was fairly basic, but adequate. We didn't try the restaurant. We found the hotel a perfect base for exploring old San Juan on foot before joining a cruise ship. If you have mobility problems neither the hotel nor the area are ideal. The hotel is on a very narrow and congested one-way street. If you expect to park a rental car anywhere nearby... forget it! Even the taxis have to block the traffic to pick or drop off. Being in the old town the taxi ride from the airport will be slightly further than to the main beach hotels, but still only came to $20 for two people with a case each. We liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: julesbeara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano for 1 night pre-cruise on Friday, December 7th. The rooms are clean and simple. The beds are comfortable. The comments about the potential for noise are true. There was a street party due to the clubs near the hotel from 12 to 4:00 a.m. The hotel staff shared that this happens every weekend. There is an authentic Puerto Rican restaurant 1/2 a dozen doors down from the hotel. We had both dinner and breakfast while staying there. The price charged for the room is good for the accomodations provided. The hotel staff was very pleasant and provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SV_and_JM
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable and friendly hotel right in the centre of Old San Juan. We originally booked for one night, but decided to stay a second and the receptionist helpfully rearranged other bookings so that we could stay in the same room. We had a room at the back of the hotel, with a window which looked out onto a boring back yard and other buildings, but it meant we could sleep with the window open without being unduly troubled by noise. Rooms are clean and pleasant, if nothing out of the ordinary. The rooftop restaurant is a lovely spot for breakfast, with an indoor and an outdoor section. The breakfast is fairly basic. Excellent coffee, but tea is the usual weak affair that has to be specially requested (Oh well, if we British must travel abroad, what can we expect ....?) It is a pity the restaurant now seems to be permanently closed in teh evenings. But there are restaurants all around, so it doesn't really matter. And the location is so convenient for sight-seeing; you can easily pop back during the day if you want to. We paid $115 for a double room which seemed good value and I would certainly consider staying there again if we ever return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Seala
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on trip advisor, we decided to stay at the Hotel Milano during a recent trip to Puerto Rico but was slightly disappointed with the hotel. While it has a cute lobby and is in a good location (though a little noisy because it is on a busy main street) the rooms did not have much character. They were clean but very plain and basic. Some of the rooms do not have windows so make sure you ask about that. The ones that do face the street and can be a bit noisy. The breakfast was very plain and nothing special as well. The staff were friendly and fairly helpful. Overall, I found the hotel to be just ok - clean and basic- so if that's all you're looking for it could be a good choice. I think it is overpriced for what you get unless you can get a very good rate. I stay at many small botique hotels and know what to expect but found this too be a little too best western for what we were expecting when paying close to $200 a night. Unfortunately I don't know that there are any better choices in Old San Juan unless you are willing to spend much more for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano friendly, convenient, perfect location, bargain”
Reviews.Author: CrackerJoe
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean, safe, centrally located place to stay while doing a walking tour of Old San Juan over a couple of days. We did an internet search and found articles in the New York Times recommending this hotel. We booked the double beds streetside via email. The place was just great. It was not as classy as a boutique hotel (it is very nice, but not a romantic hidaway) and not the upper end like The Convent. But it was exactly what we wanted. An absolutely wonderful location. Very very friendly and accomodating. Clean. Safe. It appeared to have a nice rooftop restaurant and bar, which we looked very much forward to using, but it was closed because of staff vacation. But this hotel is within a couple of blocks (very safe walking) of some of the best restaurants on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: VAWiski
Reviews.Content: Great location. We stayed one night prior to a cruise and five nights after the cruise. Good value, great location for touring Old San Juan. Roof top restaurant is closed and will probably stay closed. I expect the competition of the many great restaurants within walking distance (everything in Old Town is within walking distance) is too much to overcome. The restaurant is open for a modest but adequate breakfast every day - which you may supplemented by a visit to any one of several good bakeries nearby (if you can afford to put on a few more pounds). Good WiFi connection on the roof too. The daytime desk clerk is helpful but the porter/breakfast manager is especially cordial and will be a great information resource. On street parking is available if you are extremely lucky. Three nearby garages charge significantly different overnight rates. Check with the hotel to see which is currently the most reasonable.
