The Bacardi rum factory tour is worth doing even if you are not into rum. Take the ferry from Pier 2 to add to the enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility and safe!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luizito_Pike
Reviews.Content: I always travel to Puerto Rico. In the last 5 years I had only stay in Milano Hotel because the Hotel is very clean, safe and the people who work there are very kindly. Is like I'm at home always. I'm so glad to post this comment and invite my friends and other people to know the Hotel and enjoy the pleasures of the city! Happy Holidays! Pikelhaizen. L

Reviews.Title: “Don't Plan on a Rooftop Party”
Reviews.Author: Persnickity
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Milano in November. One of the reasons we chose it was the rooftop dining. The rooftop dining is not currently open. Bed was soft, and I have a bad back. Don't pay more than $100 a night, or you'll be paying for more than you get. Also, there was weird Christian proselytizing material in the room which annoyed me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Moderate Price”
Reviews.Author: OspreyDC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano's strengths are its central location in Old San Juan and its co-operative, obliging staff. We had one of the less expensive rooms, $85.50 after AARP discount, and we found our view on two sides was of the hotel's outer walls. To be fair, the desk clerk had told me on the telephone that "walls" would be our view. "Continental breakfast" included a choice of cold cereals, bananas, fruit juice, grocery-store pastry. To get to the roof-top dining room, with a distant view of the harbor, one must climb a flight of stairs. The lobby computer was down for repairs and staff graciously let me meet a business need by using a back-office computer.

Reviews.Title: “Milano Hotel. San Juan's Jewel.”
Reviews.Author: jamesanthony
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks vacation in San Juan Puerto Rico. The Hotel Milano is situated in Old San Juan. It is located in Fortaleza Street where most of the Top Restaurants are located (including the Panorama Restaurant in the hotel) On arrival the reception staff were very helpful and efficient. The bedrooms are extremely comfortable and well presented. There is a very effective and quiet air conditioning system. A continental breakfast is provided. This consists of fruit juices,cereals,toast, croissants,fruit and coffee. Have stayed in hotels in many countries and The Milano Hotel is up there with best. If you are going to Puerto Rico stay in Old San Juan it has great athmosphere. All the main tourist attractions are within walking distance of the Milano Hotel. Thanks Milano for the welcoming attention you give your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For the price,”
Reviews.Author: rusty0769
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Hotel Milano. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had stayed in a full size room in the back of the hotel. It was a little smaller than i expected but turned out to be more than adequate for the amount of time we spent in the room. There was some noise from the nightclubs over the weekends but nothing loud enough that you can't sleep. What made this hotel was their great location, friendly staff, and affordabke rates. I would definitly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad back beware”
Reviews.Author: paulymk
Reviews.Content: After staying at the SJ Suites in 2006 we wanted to try the Hotel Milano for our 2007 trip, especially after all the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. What a bad choice. When we got to the hotel we asked to see the room as my partner suffers from a bad back and she needs a firm bed. When I booked the room I was told that the beds were new and the mattresses very firm. What a lie. The mattress in our room was terrible as was the service at the front desk. When we complained about the bed we were told that there was nothing they could do about it. No one at the front desk cared or was willing to assist us. Well we did something about it and went back down the street to the SJ Suites and were able to get a room there for all but the first night of our stay. It was worth the extra $50 charge to get of starying at the Milano. We did stay one night however my partner had to sleep on the floor. The room iwas OK but the bathroom was dirty with hair all over the floor. Hotel Milano NOT. By the way the advertised free breakfast not worth it. Better to go around the corner to La Bonbonera and have a real breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Milano is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Wiiiiiii
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a family reunion cruise and all 14 of us stayed the night before and the night after the cruise at the Milano and it was great. The service was excellent and the location is perfect for visiting old San Juan. The roof top restaurant was very nice with great food and we spent a lot of time up there as a group. The only advice we would offer is to expect a cozy inn type experience, with excellent service and great food. Also, if you want the largest rooms ask for the ones in the front of the building but if you want the lowest rates ask for one of the smaller inner rooms. One of our relatives did and she was perfectly comfortable and satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: DeanoDetroit_Mi_
Reviews.Content: If you like a hotel that has a personal touch, one that makes you feel welcome and comfortable, you can't do better than The Hotel Milano! The rooms are clean and cared-for, the owner Juan is a gem of a host, the entire staff is friendly and efficient, and the location is perfect to get a real feel for this lovely old city! Our recent stay there was truely a joy, and there is no doubt it's the only place we will stay the next time we go to Puerto Rico! A home away from home! Clyde Stringer & Pam Grady Detroit, Mi.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: inspire7656
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Milano in San Juan and everything was beyond my expectations for an enjoyable trip. I even had the room with no real windows, but glass that allowed sunlight in! The price was right, the air cooled, the room very clean and updated, the tv worked great, and the refrigerator was a bonus. Free breakfast in the morning, and great food for dinner if desired. You even get as much free bottled water as desired! I love the rooftop restaurant as you can be under a canopy overlooking the bay or inside the airconditioned part of the restaurant. To round out the experience, the hotel is very centrally located to catch all the sights. A lovely place and the owner is very nice too. I definitely highly recommend the Hotel Milano as a place to stay in San Juan. I know I'll return!

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: nothintolose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during our brief stay in San Juan. The hotel was fine for what we were looking for. It was not anything fancy, but it served it's purpose. The staff was very nice and helpful from check in to check out and afterwards because we left our bags there while we walked around Old San Juan till we had to leave for the airport. The Panorama Restaurant on top of the hotel had good food and nice service for dinner. The continental breakfast left alot to be desired though. We reserved a room facing the street by accident because my other half misunderstood me when (after reading here) I told him not to get a room on the street. It wasn't that bad though, I was woken up around 1:30 in the morning by a car going by playing exceptionally loud music but never heard all of the street noise everyone is mentioning. I have stayed in the French Quarter off of Bourbon Street and heard more noise than I heard at this hotel. The room was just an average room, but it served it's purpose. We were not expecting a 5 star hotel though. The a/c was HOT when we got in the room, but when we called down to the desk, they told us we needed to pick up the remote to change the temperature. Once we did that, it was fine. The room had cooled off by the time we came back from dinner. We would definitely stay there again as it is in a VERY convenient location in Old San Juan. We walked to all three forts from there and all around town. The bus goes by it as well. The manager recommended The Parrot Club to us for lunch and we were VERY happy with his recommendation. Both of the men that manned the front desk were extremely pleasant and helpful. Hope this helps. Elizabeth New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beach999
Reviews.Content: Great location and very nice clean rooms. We specifically requested a front room knowing it would be noisy. It was but not to the point that you could not sleep. If you want a central location and not a mega resort this is a great choice. Our only criticism would be the beds should be a little better and the restaurant service. We went up for appetizers one night and drinks the next. Both times our server never came back to ask if we wanted another round. On the second night we (as well as another table) had to go inside to get our own check and pay. But the hotel itself met our expectations and exceeded some of the comments we have read on this board.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano not so nice, needs to be renovated & is loud”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily5010
Reviews.Content: We read reviews and thought this sounded like a great little place. It was just OK. I think it would probably be between a 2 & 3 star hotel in europe. The streets below were very noisy all night long with cars full of people yelling and playing very loud music until 4:30 am, almost impossible to sleep (it was on a Sunday and Monday night). The rooms and showers were pretty clean, but rooms need to be renovated, yucky carpet and bed spreads. You could probably do better else where.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I'd call upscale at all”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGatorFans
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Hotel Milano based on the reviews we'd read here, and I was sorely disappointed. It was hardly "upscale" (as described on its own webpage), nor as nice as I'd been led to believe it would be from the other reviews. I actually, for a while, wondered if there were two Hotel Milanos and we'd somehow wound up at the wrong one. The staff, from what we saw of them, were pleasant enough. The room, though, was way too warm (the A/C barely brought it down to a comfortable level), the bed was too soft and the pillows too hard. The hallways and stairways looked very worn and shabby. Our biggest problem was at night. Our room faced the street, and we can tell you exactly what time the bars in San Juan close on Saturday nights: 4am. The noise was unbelievable, and kept us awake most of the night. We tried to make light of it and joke about it, but I would definitely not stay there again because of it. The hotel's restaurant atop the hotel offered a nice view of Old San Juan. The dinner we had there that night was actually quite good. The breakfast, though, was another disappointment. Very little in the way of variety, even for a Continental-style breakfast. As I said, I was very surprised to have this experience after all the glowing reviews I'd read about it. Oh well... Live and learn, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking experience”
Reviews.Author: utka
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews here via Expedia for a priest who presided over my son's wedding in San Juan. We got an incredibly rude treatment, starting with manager claiming he had no confirmation from Expedia and ending with manager telling my priest guest to "get out of my hotel". I would hate to think (given all the positive reviews here)my guest received this treatment because he did not look the type of guest the hotel manager wanted in his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: discriminating7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing like it was described.The matress was very uncomfortable and the pillows were thick. There was a lot of noise from the street well into the morning. The breakfast was not good. sugary muffins, sugary juices.,over riped fruit ,warm coffee. The employees were pleasent though.

Reviews.Title: “A European Experience”
Reviews.Author: thealicia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Milano. This is not your typical oversized American-style resort experience. And that's exactly why we adored it! If you are in love with the authentic experience of staying in centrally located hostels of Europe, you will love this little hotel. Hotel Milano gives you the perfect location. You can be in and out several time a day while touring. Stop in, grab a nap, get freshened up and hit the town. If you are concerned about the noise, stay a few floors up. We were on the 8th floor and had wonderful night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception Extraordinairre”
Reviews.Author: inspiredteacher
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Milano many times over the years because it's the best boutique hotel in Old San Juan and we enjoy Juan, the amazing owner of Milano as well as his exceptional staff. So, when we decided to marry in Old San Juan, we knew that's the place we wanted to bring our friends and family. We all had a truly wonderful experience there over several days. We were treated royally, with lovely red roses waiting for us in our room. Our friends and family all loved the gracious staff and convenient location. The staff were so joyful and so helpful in preparation for the reception that we all had fun getting ready with them. Our evening at the wonderful Panorama Restaurant was perfect. The food, a blend of local and Cuban delights, was delicious. The staff was superb. Everyone who joined us could not say enough about their experience there. We had a wonderful, wonderful time. It's the people who make the place!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off! Consumer beware!”
Reviews.Author: MadameS
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find a depressingly hot, dank, tiny, shabby UNACCEPTABLE room for the $175+taxes. Although I agreed to pay their $50 cancellation fee, my credit card was charged $196.75 for NO services rendered. Surely they rented the room twice that night (April 20) and somebody pocketed some easy money! I want a refund. Why should a consumer be so easily tricked into paying for a bad product site unseen?

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately too loud”
Reviews.Author: Gibbi72
Reviews.Content: The staff is great, the location is great, the rooms were clean, the A/C worked well. The only problem is the discoteca that is behind the property. We were there on a Saturday and Sunday night and the bass from the discoteca reverberated through our beds until 5AM both nights. I don't think that there is anything that the hotel can really do about it, but unfortunately it makes sleep pretty much impossible if you're at all a light sleeper. Everything else though was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in the old town”
Reviews.Author: sinbad27
Reviews.Content: There can't be many hotels on earth owned by such a fascinating man as this one. The rooms are all equipped not only with everything you need for a very comfortable (and affordable) stay, but also with copies of the owner's writings - thoughts, reflections and words of wisdom, a kind of cross between Khalil Gibran and Marcus Aurelius. He himself is an inspired and inspiring presence, and a stay in his wonderful, charmed hotel is capable of changing the course of a person's life. There are testimonies on the internet to this effect. It seems he will drop everything for a deep conversation with a guest. The hotel also has a wonderful rooftop bar and restaurant, which is great place to catch the evening light and eat excellent local gourmet food.

Reviews.Title: “Local hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pkryza
Reviews.Content: If you want a local hotel close to the action, this is it. It's a short walk to clubs, restaurants, the pier and shopping. The roof top restaurant offers a cool respite on hot summer nights. The food and service are excellent. The staff is friendly and English is spoken.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: 2wicky
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel Milano just needing a place to stay the night after our late flight in. We weren't looking for anything fancy, but in a convenient location to Old San Juan. Our room was in need of some cleaning. The room was drab and could use a fresh coat of paint. My mom was afraid to take off her shoes--the carpet was dirty and looked like it hasn't been cleaned in ages. Breakfast was very average: milk, coffee, bananas, small boxed cereals, toast, and prepackaged (vending machine type) muffins and donuts. The only thing that stood out was the front desk service. The man was very informative and helpful as far as finding late-night meals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you don't have a rental car”
Reviews.Author: vee777
Reviews.Content: I took a five-day trip around Puerto Rico staying in Old San Juan two nights. When I drove up to check into the hotel, I had to move the barracades from in front of the hotel to parallel park since it is a narrow one-way street. When I was going up to my room, the receptionist informed me that I had to move my car to public parking. It was an inconvenience that they did not offer a service man to do that. The last thing that anyone wants to do is drop off your luggage walk half a mile each way and then get ready to go out. The parking garages that are available are pretty expensive. The cheapest that was around was $1 for the first hour and $.65 for each additional hour. This adds up if you are staying for more than one night. The hotel itself has a nice appearance. There wasn't a window to look out of due to being in squeezed in by buisnesses on both sides. The room was clean and spacious, but the air-conditioner was a bit squeeky. It quieted down a bit after being turned on for several hours. The hotel is obviously located in a convenient location. There are many restaurants, shops and bars close by. Nice location, a bit overpriced $149+tax, to not include parking somehow. You will enjoy this hotel if you are just staying in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Flavor of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ricehome7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is embedded in the midst of the action of Old San Juan and really gives you the flavor of the city. Absolutely everything is within easy walking distance and it is so great to see the activities on Fontaleza, the primary thoroughfare of Old San Juan. Althought the elevator was being worked on our host and his staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and accessible. The owner is available, charming and down to earth. The staff is very helpful and it was great having a rooftop restaurant (Panorama) with both outdoor and indoor dining that was very good. We stayed for three nights before our cruise and will do so in the future, opportunity presenting. Thank you Juan and staff for a terrifici stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: winelover01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano for two nights prior to our cruise and we had a great time. The employees were very helpful and pleasant. The location was ideal. We would recommend this small but nice hotel if you want to stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Msrcc55
Reviews.Content: If you want access to everything Old San Juan has to offer, do not hesitate to stay at this nice, comfortable hotel right in the center of Old San Juan. We paid $164 incl. tax for a queen room on the back. It was spacious and clean with a nice size bathroom. The rate included a generous continental breakfast served at their rooftop reataurant "Panorama". The greatest advantage is the hotel's location. You are minutes from "El Morro", "San Cristobal Fort", and all the wonderful cultural sights in Old San Juan. In addition, there are tons of restaurants and nightlife within a short walk from the hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: klutzy
Reviews.Content: Two weeks on a cruise ship was an awesome trip. I didn't think about home or felt homesick in two weeks until I stayed at Hotel Milano. It was not a great feeling, when I first walk inside my room I smelled mildew. Maids did not clean the bathroom thoroughly and didn't change the sheets. Trying to have a nice peaceful rest but can't because music is blasting from the nightclub next door. Some employees were not helpful about finding an excursion of San Juan. Breakfast had limited choices, it did not accomondate guests who have a specific needs to their diets. Upside of the location is it's in Old San Juan and you can get your daily exercise walking the streets browsing through the upscale stores and there's police in every corner of the street to protect the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “We loved This Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglanderBostonMa
Reviews.Content: This small Hotel has very friendly front desk staff, clean rooms, wonderful hot shower and you step out of the hotel into the middle of lovely old San Juan. The desk staff could not have been nicer. I book by calling the hotel directly and all went very well. The bed was comfortable and clean. The roof top restaurant may have had a view of the ocean but construction on a new building on the water front now blocks the view. Well we did not spend much time at the restaurant anyway. There are great restaurants on the same street as the hotel. The continental breakfast was not good but adequate- cereal and boring toast and lousy coffee but fear not a Starbucks is nearby. We would definitely book this hotel again. We love the Hotel Milano!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: craigh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived on new years eve. We had a speedy check-in, and found our room to be a very clean, of good size but with a relatively noisy but efficient air conditioning unit (which we simply turned off and on as required). The shower was lovely, with plenty of hot water. The room overlooked the street, and so we got a bit of noise but it didn't detract from the experience. The hotel has an excellent location - right in the middle of Old San Juan. We had an enjoyable complimentary breakfast at the rooftop patio restaurant every morning. All in all - a lovely place to stay, and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Great Value in Old San Juan, Clean nice rooms, friendly staff, right in the center of everything. And it is priced right. We will return again and again..

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: ksakmorris
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for one night at Hotel Milano after being on Culebra for a week. We were a large group and had 3 rooms. We found the Milano to suit our needs well. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful at check-in. One of the rooms in our group had been booked separately, so they didn't know we were together. They made sure to put us on the same floor, which we really appreciated. We were in the front of the building and yes, there is some noise, but the a/c blocks most of it out. The beds are very soft and bouncy, so some people may not like that, others may love it. Rooms are small, but very clean. The rooftop restaurant was nice and had a good view. Breakfast, as has been said, is basic, but adequate to start the day. We only had 2 problems. The a/c in our friends' room got very cold, to the point of being too cold to sleep. The a/c is not adjustable, so it was that or open the windows and have the noise of the street. The 2nd thing is more of an issue than a problem. We wanted to print out our boarding passes for our flights home, but they didn't seem too eager to do this. After asking a couple times, we finally got to go into the office and a gentleman working there had to stop working on his computer so I could print out our passes. He was not too friendly about this, but I don't know how much I can blame him---we were disrupting his work! It would be great if they had a small business area where this could be done without disrupting any of the employees. Other than that, it was a great stay! We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gordy2
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Milano pre-cruise. Hotel is in a great location for the designer shops, Polo, Guess, Gant etc, and for touring Old San Juan. Staff at the Hotel friendly and helpful. Continental style breakfast more than adequate. We had a Queen room at the front of the hotel, which was very noisy on the Saturday night as the local youngsters are out enjoying themselves till the early hours. Suggest you pay the Milano a visit, and request a quiet room at the back of the hotel. We intend to go back to San Juan again next year and have no qualms about staying at this fine hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you want NO sleep!”
Reviews.Author: becky416
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel (in a rear-full room) for an overnight layover before heading to another island. We got in late after a day of traveling and were very tired, hoping to get some sleep. That did NOT happen!! There was some club or something right next door blasting music (this was a Sunday night, not Fri. or Sat.) until at least 3 am. I can't tell you if it went any later b/c I actually managed to fall asleep finally. The bed and the whole room were quite small - and the bed was the type that if one person moves the other is disturbed. I normally have positive things to say about everywhere I stay b/c I am not very picky...I'm not above a super 8 every now and then...but all I wanted was some good sleep and I did not get it here!!! The only good thing was the location to popular tourist sites. We were able to walk to El Morro the next morning before catching our flight. I would spend a bit more $$ and stay somewhere else if comfort is a priority. This place might be okay for partiers who would want to be in on that late night noise:)

Reviews.Title: “Priced right, great location, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: GloJoStPaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before a cruise and one night after the cruise. Picked the Milano because we wanted a reasonable priced place in the hear of Old San Juan. We were not disappointed with the accommodations, location, service and price. It's an old hotel with plenty of warm friendly atmosphere complemented by a friendly helpful staff. The roof top restaurant is a definite plus with good food and prices are lower than other comparable restaurants in the area. Yes, the rooms were small and basic but are priced right. They were clean, the water was hot and the air conditioner worked well. We had a back room which was by choice due to possible street noise in the front and we slept like babies. The continental breakfast was pretty basic but enough to get you started and on your way to enjoy the sights and shopping within walking distance. We were especially impressed with the service provided by Juan, Laura and Miguel. Thank you for an enjoyable stay and we look forward to our next visit to Puerto Rico and Hotel Milano.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: XWAIT
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano is one of the great finds we located on our trip to Puerto Rico for the month of February. It is not easy to find reasonably priced hotels very close to Old San Juan. The Hotel Milano is in the middle of Old San Juan, convenient to all of the shopping and restaruants that are in the Old San Juan area. The Hotel Milano is clean. The entire hotel staff, from the front desk to the wait staff in the restarunt and the housekeeping staff, treat customers like they value their business. I don't think you can go wrong booking in the Hotel Milano. We will be back next year. WRC from Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “little gem but has a noisy problem”
Reviews.Author: anneloo
Reviews.Content: we stayed for one night at hotel milano. Great location lovely staff but one big problem...dont stay in the front of the hotel if you want a good nights sleep! We stayed in a lovely room with gorgeous view of old san juan but the noise was so bad neither of us slept......beware the management do not tell you about the noise problem when you book a front room. It is a lovely hotel and the staff do there best to help when you mention the noise problem, it is the ideal hotel to stay at for visitng old san juan...just be aware if you stay at front of the hotel on a weekend you arent going to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Red Jaguar Driver
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Milano. This is definitely not a luxury hotel, but our three rooms were clean and comfortable. They were exactly as described in the email correspondence that I had with the owner. The location is fabulous. It is easy walking to some very nice park areas, the bay, and of course the shops and restaurants of Old San Juan. The check-in and the overall service were very friendly and efficient. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and the food was very good, if not overly memorable. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and made good suggestions to please our tastes. The front desk person took the time to give us suggestions about a walking tour that we could do. Our party included two 30 year olds, two 60 year olds, and one 90 year old. His suggestions allowed for all of us to enjoy the stroll with some opting for more virorous routes than others. It is nice to know that we have a good place to stay for our future travels to San Juan. Thanks to Juan, Miguel and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: wanderer71-7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for two nights following a cruise out of San Juan. The location was ideal for touring Old San Juan and the price was right even in high season. It is an older building as you would expect in this location, the rooms were average as well as the amenities, but the staff was absolutely fantastic, treating us like family and cheerfully taking care of every request. The rooftop restaurant was an added bonus, with good food and good service. We would gladly stay there again if we return to the area. If you plan to walk around Old San Juan, and that is definitely the best way to see it, take a good pair of walking shoes...lots of up hill and down hill walking, but you can walk to absolutely everything...shops, the old forts, restaurants, the whole works. Overall, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: heypaula717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano in Feb. 2007 - 1 night pre-cruise and 1 night post-cruise. The main advantage of the hotel, in my opinion, was its location. It was great to be within walking distance of so many of the sights in Old San Juan. Also, there is a free bus to El Morro, which we took advantage of while there. The hotel is also within a few blocks of 2 of the main cruise piers. Unfortunately, our ship departed from the third! However, it was a short taxi drive, and not a problem. We booked a room in the front of the hotel, as we had read that the rear rooms were smaller and some lacked windows that could be opened, which sounded a little claustrophobic to me. The room itself was quite adequate and clean, though a bit small, as we expected in an older hotel such as this. Our main problem was the noise from the street, which continued until 4AM both nights we stayed. Part of this was our own fault, as we left the windows open. However, the air-conditioner was just 'On or off' - with it off, the room was very hot, but with it on it was frigid - so we opted to leave it off. It may have helped with the noise to have the unit turned on, but I'm not sure we had enough blankets for that! The restaurant on the roof was very nice, although the views are not as scenic as the photos, as there is a lot of construction in the area. The food was good, and so was the service - so it was enjoyable. However, the complimentary morning breakfast was very minimal - beverages, packaged donuts, and boxed cereals. It was a start to the day, though - and we found several nice restauarants nearby for a more substantial meal. I would probably not stay here again, but I would recommend it to anyone wanting a reasonably priced comfortable room in Old San Juan. The staff is friendly and helpful, and it's a great location as a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: AAfussytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milano for 5 nights prior to a cruise and found it very suitable. The price is very reasonable and the Old Town location is fabulous. And we even walked with all our luggage to the pier! The hotel is small and quaint - very clean and staff offered wonderful, personal hospitality. Our room was small but comfortable and bathroom great! Breakfast on the roof terrace was delightful. Too bad a tall building is being constructed a couple blocks away which will destroy the nice view of the harbor. We read about the Milano in a NY Times travel review. Their web site showed they didn't have availability for the full length of our stay, but a direct call proved that it would be possible after all. It pays to call direct.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: LucyAugusta,Ga.
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed there for 3 nights, January, 2007. The location in the heart of Olde Towne was very convenient. The hotel was well kept and the rooms were of average size and comfortable. We enjoyed the rooftop restaurant and the food and service was very good. We were there during the festival of St. Sebastion. Olde Towne was very crowded and the taxis could not come and go as customary, so that was a disadvantage. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant servers were helpful and friendly. (we could not get a taxi to take us to our cruise line so 2 of their empoyees loaded our luggage on carts and escorted us 5 blocks to our ship.) I hope to visit San Juan in the future and I will definitely stay at Hotel Milano again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rlkubi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 days post cruise and had a wonderful time! The location was fantastic in Old San Juan! It was within walking distance of everything! We could have walked from the cruise except uphill with all the luggage. The staff was courteous, the rooms were nice, and they had a small restaurant on the roof which was great! We stayed with 2 other couples and we will stay there again when we return to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Brocks
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Old San Juan prior to taking a cruise. Hotels are few and expensive in this area. Our room was large and clean but very basic. I checked it out on TripAdvisor before making a reservation and made sure I booked a room on the front-more expensive but at least it had 2 big windows. Some of the rooms have tiny windows high up in the wall. Breakfast of cereal, toast, fruit, juice and coffee was included. If money was spent on upgrading it could be very nice. Of course it would then be more expensive! The location is great. Old San Juan is fascinating to explore with very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: merrytraveler5
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Hotel Milano. The price is the most reasonable we could find anywhere in the old city, and it really is in the heart of old San Juan within easy walking distance of everything. Our room was terrific, the staff was accommodating, the dining room was good, and we would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected. Location location and location and 2 1/2 star accomi”
Reviews.Author: Blye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milano January 4th and 5th 2007 pre cruise. We choose the Milano because of it's location to the piers and reviews here on Trip Advisor. We had a double Queen front room for $ 165.00 per night and found the room to be completely satisfactory. Clean, comfy beds and hot water showers. The room was a tad noisy being on the street and next time I'll ask for a rear room. The hotel is only blocks to everything in Old San Juan. Walk four blocks west and you have a grocery store and lots of shops. The Old Brick House just a few blocks east and south serves up basic chow and beer at great (for Old San Juan) prices. A hint about the air conditioner, they use a remote control to adjust the settings and you need to ask the desk for it. We'll stay here again pre cruise next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinCruiser
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after seeing it in March, 2006 when some friends stayed there. We booked a room with two beds in order to have more room. It is in a great location. The hotel is small, which is what we liked. Nice clean rooms and quiet. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. There is a nice restaurant on the roof, with some tables outside. Good food and service. Breakfast was included in the price. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: swhudson3
Reviews.Content: If you're going to be spending the night in Old San Juan, and you want an affordable, comfortable hotel in the middle of the action, this hotel is for you! Perfectly situated in the heart of Old San Juan, Hotel Milano and Panorama Bar & Latin Grill offer a comfortable, friendly environment at a very reasonable rate. I read a lot of reviews that complained about the room and so forth. I found nothing to complain about on my stay. Honestly, if you're sitting around in your room worried about appointments instead of out on the street, then you're in Old San Juan for all of the wrong reasons. While the hotel is more bare bones than say the Sheraton, it meets all basic needs: clean, running cold and hot water, air conditioning, and a reasonably comfortable bed. In addition, the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable, there is a complimentary continental breakfast in the rooftop restaurant, and a loading zone out front. Although parking is a block and a half away in a $12/day garage, it's no worse than in any other historic city. Lastly, I must say that if you're going to be in Old San Juan for the sights and environment of the old city, then Hotel Milano is probably right for you. However, if you require a casino and lush appointments and have money to blow, then try one of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Milano was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Joanshar
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a cruise ship and stayed another 3 nights at the Milano. Old San Juan's many places of interest were within walking distance from the hotel as were reaturants and shopping.We cannot imagine a better place for seeing the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre & Post Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kikid1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7day southern caribeen cruise.. We chose Hotel Milano from all of the great reviews it recieved on this web site.. and I was a little worried but I must say I was very pleased to say the least.. It is exactly as described ! The hotel's location is perfect ! We could walk everywhere from here. Restuarants, shopping, bars and sites of Old San Juan. The continental breakfast did the job as well.. Do bother spending money on the big chains this hotel is perfect.. Clean rooms and bathrooms, We had room 304 in the back .. And we stayed in the same room pre & post cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bovi
Reviews.Content: Great location on Old San Juan. Within walking distance of sites, stores and restaurants. Friendly front desk. Continental breakfast is served on the roof which is also a good place for a drink at night.

Reviews.Title: “DIsco in Room”
Reviews.Author: frenchgirl1
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this place is the location and price. I was traveling with a group of 3 so we needed a room with two beds. They gave us a room on the second floor with no windows; a cave like setting. I did not come for the room so I was fine with it. If you are going out in Puerto Rico and coming in late from partying, this is the place. I had an early flight and had to go to bed early though. The disco started around 11pm and progressively got louder. It was IMPOSSIBLE to sleep until after the disco closed. I complained and the guy downstairs walked over to the disco to have them turn it down. It did not help. Ask for a room away from the disco and it might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: DrRhythm
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal in the heart of Old San Juan. We wanted to spend part of our stay in Puerto Rico in Old San Juan, and didn't want to break the bank. This place was a good find, and the price is great. The rooms are pretty standard. The location, however, turned out to be the highlight. It is on Calle Fortaleza, which is now considered the SoFo district of Old San Juan. This area is in the middle of all the action, with Calle Fortaleza being filled with great restaurants and bars for night life. We would spend the day exploring and sight seeing, head to the Milano for a quick shower, and we'd then have a whole host of options for dinner. The staff were nice and it was quiet. There is a rooftop restaurant (I think it was called 'Panorama') where you could sit for drinks and look out on the rooftops of Old San Juan. It's not the greatest view, but it was nice to sit there in the open air. Overall a great value if you want to stay in the middle of the action in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guliverstravels
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is walking distance to any attraction in Old San Juan, particularly the trendy restaurants that are right down the street. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: scoopg
Reviews.Content: i had read some negative things about this hotel after i had made the reservation, and also read some positive reviews. Well i decided to keep the reservation, and am very glad i did. My wife and i went on a carnival cruise out of san juan for our 30th wedding anniversary , and after the cruise we stayed 3 days at the Milano hotel, juan and the entire staff could not have been more friendly. From the time we walked in the door, until 3 days later when they called a taxi for us to the airport. The hotel is in the middle of old san juan, and is within walking distance to everything,. and if you dont want to walk, there is a free trolley stop in front of the hotel. The continental breakfast was great, and served at the top floor restaurant, which is another great place. My wife and i ate dinner there 2 out of the 3 nights we were there. If you are looking for a great hotel at a value, this is the place to stay. james garrison, tennessee.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, lovely”
Reviews.Author: godessathena
Reviews.Content: Quaint little hotel in the heart of Old San Juan. Nothing special about the room, but it was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The location is wonderful though. We only had 24 hours in Old San Juan before flying to Culebra. This was the place to stay! It is within walking distance of every place we wanted to go. Sunday evening we ate at the restaurant at the top of the hotel. Bring a sweater or cover up. It was chilly but really nice. The food was good, too. Scenery is the best though. Have breakfast at Bonbonera (spelling?) I'm not much of a coffee drinker but it was the best coffee I've ever had. I could have sat all day and drank the stuff! The breakfast sandwich was delicious. It is a great little place to stay. Don't pass it up if you have the chance to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Cheap Lodging in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: zjtravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is a steal. Located directly in Old San Juan, this property offers clean rooms, friendly staff, and a great location. When staying here, you are within 1-10 min walking distance of amazing restaurants, great shopping, and the cruise departure ports. We saved a lot of mony because we didn't have to take cabs or taxis to and from dinner. Yes the room provided the bare minimum but they are extremely clean. One aspect we were slightly unhappy with were the bed sizes. We got a queen sized bed--which was more like a full size bed. It was ok for a hotel bed--but I have definitly had a more comfortable sleep. But considering it's $50-150 less than the average Old San Juan hotel, I can handle it for one night. So if you are needing a room before or after your cruise or just want to stay in San Juan for one night this hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sanyan
Reviews.Content: After finishing our Caribbean cruise, we wanted a place to relax before heading home. We wanted a place that was centrally located in old San Juan. This hotel fits the bill perfectly. There are many shops and restaurants for blocks in any direction. Our room was spacious and clean. It was my husband's birthday, and the owner sent a bottle of wine to our room. They have a rooftop restaurant which offers a nice view, good food and drinks, and a wi fi connection. There is also a free trolley that takes you all around the town. You can get off wherever you want and then continue when ready. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the thick of things in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: dreamingtraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at Hotel Milano. The price was great for the location. The Hotel is practically in the middle of Old San Juan. Doesn't take any time to walk anywhere. We felt pretty safe walking around all times of the day. Walked to both forts only went to San Cristobal Fort, worth the 3 or 5 dollars per person. Bring a camera. The rooms where a little small but clean. Had a room in the back away from the street since I had heard it gets loud at night. I did hear a lot of music around three o' clock am but they like to have fiestas' so what can you expect. Overall definitely recommend this hotel. Make sure to stop by at the roof top restaurant for at least a drink or two to take in the view; before the 12 story parking deck steals the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cajanangel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value and location in Old San Juan being within walking distance to all the attractions and restaurants, free continential breakfast is included in the price. It is clean and safe with friendly staff. The rooms are small but adequate. This is a great hotel for the budget minded traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Enjoyed the Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: msbelle51
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day pre-cruise stay in San Juan. After going back and forth in trying to find a hotel I finally selected the Hotel Milano. I'm glad I ignored the not so pleasant reviews. The staff were EXCELLENT. Being a solo traveller, (friends arrived day of the cruise) they made my stay memorable. They went out of their way to assist me w/directions, suggestions of things to see and answered my numerous questions about OSJ. One of the things I liked best was the fact that they seemed to remember my name EVERY time I came in and out. I also liked that on each floor you need a key to enter the corridor doors before getting to your room. Major plus for single female traveler. Room was nice and clean (it looked liked the hotel had undergone some remodeling). Air conditioning worked PERFECTLY (since it was so hot I thought I was going to melt every time I went out. Continental breakfast (included in room price) was sufficient enough to start the day. Unfortunately the restaurant opened for dinner on the same day I left, so no comments on the dinner menu. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Hotel Milano to travellers to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home..”
Reviews.Author: BeautifullyHuman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano was wonderful! Me and my boyfriend stayed for 2 nights prior our cruise. If you are looking for a hotel with a cozy feel and inexpensive, Hotel Milano is your place to stay. The staff was great, as well as the food. We will be back to stay again..By the way, please don't be bothered by the negative comments but experience Hotel Milano for yourself. This hotel is in the center of all the action so there is much to do and see. Enjoy you stay. San Juan is a beautiful place. A.W. Virginia/USA

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, secure and great Puerto Rican Cooking”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Munich
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located. I loved my daily evening strolls to the harbour (about 4 mins.) to look at the gigantic cruise ships. The open plaza in front of Banco Popular is a must see on weekends. Local musicians, souvenir stands, horse carriage rides ... Within 100 yards from the Milano are many "HIP" restaurants, bistros and bars, the meeting place of the local Yuppie-Scene. All other tourist attractions of the Old City are within walking distance as well. Just remember to walk slowly and on the shaded side of the street in summer! This was my 3rd or 4th stay in the MILANO during the past 5 years. The staff was friendly as ever, the rooms clean and security good. The Panorama Restaurant on the top floor is one of my favourite dining places because of its tasty home style Puerto Rican Cooking and the good view. My favourites are the Churasco Steak and the Shrimps in spicy red souce (can't remember the exact name). If you are lucky you will meet the owner, Mr. Emeterio, an author and very interesting person to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, safe, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: marmaui
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano's charm comes from its exceptionally friendly and helpful staff as well as it's central location in Old San Juan. I just spent eight days in that fascinating old city and headquartering at Hotel Milano was ideal. Many thanks to those who wrote reviews before me because they were the deciding factor in my choosing Hotel Milano for my stay. It's certainly not fancy but I found it to be clean, safe,convenient and affordable! Aloha, Mary Maui, Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “great location but dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: sfltraveler
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is it's best selling point. It is in the heart of the restaurant and shopping area, and walking distance to the rest of old san juan. The lobby is very nice. The rooms are very dated, you must be prepared for that--worn carpets, old bedspreads--but clean. So don't go expecting more or you will be disappointed. The front room had a nice big window and was fine as far as noise since the a/c drowns it out. (ask for a/c controller at desk to adjust a/c, from room you can only turn it on and off) Staff was helpful and friendly. We were disappointed that the rooftop restaurant was closed for vacation so we didn't get to try it. If you're looking for elegance or romance, El Convento would be the place. If you're looking for a more reasonably priced place to lay your head, Milano is a good choice. ADVICE IN OFF SEASON-call before going to restaurants, many are closed, as was the Parrot Club, so you don't waste your time walking around town aimlessly!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: jorgusan
Reviews.Content: Hi: I had my wedding reception last May on this Hotel. The restaurant has a great reputation on the island and the view is great. No other hotel in Old San Juan has a restaurant on the top floor with that or any view. My guest said three things that made me feel great. "Excellent food", "great service" and what a "beatiful restaurant". I've stayed here more than once and the rooms are always extra clean and comfortable. We were on a budget because I was leaving for Europe the next day for two weeks so I didn't expect the service or any of the ammenities for what I payed. Thanks Hotel Milano!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: leelow13
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend to anyone who doesn't want to pay a ton for a great location. We recommend walking down a couple blocks and visiting the Parrot Club, which is amazing. The room was fine, nothing too extravagant, but still clean and nice. Keep your windows shut at night though, the nightlife is really loud. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. We stayed one night before traveling home and it was a perfect hotel for the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “loved my room and the staff hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lexie54
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Puerto Rico I just want to say that my stay at Hotel Milano was very satisfactory and a pleasant experience. The accomodations were very affordable in comparison to other surrounding hotels. My room was very neat and clean and the staff very courteous and friendly. I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Puerto Rico who want to be centrally located in Old San Juan. They have a magnificent roof top restaurant with local cuisine dishes on their menu. I did not have to venture far for a great meal! Grace M. New York City

Reviews.Title: “Just this side of awful...”
Reviews.Author: anne98116
Reviews.Content: The room was, in a word, depressing. Chipped and coming-apart formica furnishings. Bad smells in the elevator and the room (the room oder was masked by raspberry Renuzit, on full blast!) Stained carpet that was badly in need of a good vacuuming. Plastic plant on the table. Front desk clerk not particularly helpful and didn't even say hello when I came and went. Bathroom had new fixtures but was not too clean - someone else's hair on the floor and tile walls. Yuck. I have travelled many places in the world and this was the worst value hotel I have encountered anywhere. Period.

Reviews.Title: “oh, oh”
Reviews.Author: create100
Reviews.Content: Hello. Though so many good reputations about this hotel, I was disappointed about this. I just felt bad smell in my room,,,, and the sheets in the bed was a little bit wetty and dirty. The bathroom was not so clean as I expected and the outside noise kept me awake all through the night. The elevator was very slow and I just thought I was locked in (not actually) under the hot temperature. The view from the top roof is not so good cause now you can see the building under construction (also noisy). I could not stand this situation and changed the hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: derksen
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff went out of their way to help us! Very neat and clean! We would recommend and stay there again! We were in the heart of Old San Juan walking distance to everything in Old San Juan! Port Coquitlam BC

Reviews.Title: “A Very Refreshing and Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kortright
Reviews.Content: Since the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the warmth that their staff offered to me and my family. The room was very cozy and clean. Their restaurant, Panorama, located at the top of the hotel had friendly personell and offered a relaxing ambience with a view to the harbour. Definitely would stay there if we visit once again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: Spain's_Number_1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10-day stay at the Milano on my first visit to Puerto Rico. The definition they use is completely true: An upscale and affordable Hotel in the best area of San Juan. "Independently owned, very well run, and definetely with the extra charm and kindness of Staff you'd expect from a smaller Hotel" I would add. My stay in Puerto Rico was lovely and Hotel Milano was the perfect base for it all to take place. I had a room on the front and was not bothered at all by the noise some reviewers have written about. Besides, you really need to appreciate being in the middle of eaverything... where it all happens. If you really want to get a taste of Old San Juan, then you need to stay at the Milano. The facilities are very well maintained and rooms have everything you need. Complimentary breakfast was functional, although good enough. On the other part, Rooftop Panorama Restaurant offers the best views of the Bay of San Juan while serving excellent regional cuisine. Highly recommended. All in all, as I title this review: Hotel Milano is "The Best Choice in Old San Juan"

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Puerto Rico on the 13th of June, 2006 and stayed for one week. We researched diferent hotels trying to find one that had everyhting we needed. The most important feature we required our hotel to have was location, location, location. We wanted to stay in Old San Juan, within enough walking distance to the historic landmarks, shopping, public transporation, and enjoy all that Old san Juan had to offer. we found all that and more at the Hotel Milano. The staff was exceptionally friendly and courteous, the room was bigger than I expected, and the view from our window looked out onto the nightlife below. We were near clubs, restaurants, within walking distance to the piers and tourist center as well as parks, churches, and other major attractions. if we wanted to go to the beach, a taxi stand was around the corner, or two small blocks over, is the public bus depot to take us to any of the major beaches we deisred to go to. The hotel is secure, and an attendant is always at the desk for any assistance, including directions, maps or change for the soda machine. Although there is no pool at the hotel, we felt it was better that way. We were able to see more of San Juan than other relatives and friends who had the convenience of a pool at their hotels. Besides, why need a pool when you have the entire ocean and all of the gorgeous beaches Puerto Rico has to offer? For anyone who sees their hotel room as a place to lay their head while having an adventure in a tropical paradise, we recommend Hotel Milano. We will be patronizing their hotel again, possibly next year. Thanks for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to sleep in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Dog-man
Reviews.Content: This is an uninspiring but acceptable hotel in a great location. Old San Juan does not seem to have a lot of room offerings, so for the price, like the other reviews, Hotel Milano is a great deal. We had 2 parents and 2 kids in two beds on the top floor. Noise was not a problem, the room was clean and, once we got the A/C cranked up, comfortable. The LOCATION -- block and a half from the Parrot Club, Aqua Viva, Dragon Fly conglomerate. Very easy walking distance to all the San Juan sights. See El-Moro at night, and get lost among the colonial buildings and in the cobble-stone streets of Old San Juan. We never felt unsafe, but watch your belongings as Puerto Rico has a reputation for thievery. (Although in our two weeks throughout the island, we NEVER had anything stolen.)

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Old San Juan, a short walk to just about everything. A number of highly rated and very good restaurants within 2 blocks and close to shopping, harbor and sights in this unique historical and totally fascinating area. We live in the French Quarter in New Orleans so we really appreciated being in the middle of Old San Juan. Hotel Milano is not fancy but very charming, comfortable, clean, well maintained, etc. Owner and the staff are very friendly and helpful. A simple, self- service breakfast as well as lunch and dinner are served in the Panorama Restaurant on the top floor. We had a very good meal there sampling some nice wine and Puerto Rican specialities. We were so glad we did not stay in the high-rise beach area as we would have been totally bored. It is easy to take a cab to the beaches for the day. We plan on staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano in Old San Juan was my home away from home. I started staying there after they opened. I spent at least one weekend a month there in the center of Old San Juan. The staff there treat you like family for your stay, no matter how long you stay. I just moved here to Old San Juan from a nearby island. All of the people that will by coming over to see me will be staying at the Milano as i have so many times before.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano in Old San Juan pre and post cruise in May 2006 and found it to be great. Juan (the owner) was quick to answer all emails and set up a reservation. The hotel is close to everything in Old San Juan and the rooms are very nice- good size, and everything works - the tv, ac, modern bath and refrigerator. Juan did promise a back room for both reservations and when we arrived for the second they gave us a front room and would not change it (Juan was not there at the time). Since it is on a busy street, the noise woke us up at 2:40 am that night. So we recommend insisting on a back room if you go to bed before that time! The free continental breakfast on the rooftop open restaurant is great - a good start to the day and a good view. Definitely would recommend this hotel and go back there any time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano in Old San Juan for 2 nights in May and found it to be the perfect base for all the things we wanted to see in San Juan. The staff is very courteous and helpful, the rooms are spotless, and though they're not fancy, the rooms have nice little amenities like a small fridge with bottled water (not marked $3.50 a bottle, as in American chain hotels!). There is a very European feel to this little place that we felt at home in and loved. The included breakfast is a generous continental one -- very nice. A big bonus to staying at the Hotel Milano is that you are just 1-1/2 blocks from 2 trolley stops, which means you don't need a car in Old San Juan (I can't imagine driving those narrow streets anyway!). The trolley is free and takes you to all the major historical sights in Old San Juan. Very convenient! Another bonus to this hotel is that some of the top restaurants in all of Puerto Rico are within 2 or 3 blocks! We enjoyed AMAZING meals just steps from our rooms. Especially if you are mainly or solely interested in Old San Juan and not so much the "new" part, Hotel Milano is a wonderful choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best value as compared to others in the area.”
Reviews.Author: LAladybug
Reviews.Content: I attended a wedding in Old San Juan where guests stayed one of four places. For the price, you really can't beat Hotel Milano. As compared to the HoJo, the rooms were enormous and we had the luxury of a tub! Yes, the hotel is in the middle of the party district and we could hear the music until the wee hours of the morning, but it really wasn't that bad on the 3rd floor. There are four floors of rooms at Milano. The breakfast was just OK, but it was free; I'm not complaining. The rooftop restaurant lured other wedding guests more than once for the wonderful view. After eating at a variety of restaurants, I can honestly say that the hotel's rooftop restaurant has some of the best food in the city and, by far, the best pina coladas! Be sure to try the calamari, seafood paella, and cream soup, too. The location is wonderful as you are in walking distance from the harbor, historic fort, numerous shops... and the free trolly is just a block away on Fortaleza. The Hotel ElConvento and Intercontinental (on Isle Verde beach) were much more upscale, but three times the price. Email me with questions if you so desire. I'll post photos later on. Anita

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: amannva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Milano for 1 night before and after our cruise and enjoyed every minute of it! The staff is very friendly and helpful. I communicated with Sr. Juan in regard to the room and he was very helpful in setting up the reservation. The lobby has a lot of charm. The location was perfect and close to everything we wanted to see in Old San Juan. The view from Panorama restaurant was great too! As for our room, we had a front queen room. The room was very big and clean. The bed was comfortable too. As for the noise outside, it added to the charm of the hotel. It is close to the clubs and you can hear the beat of the music, the patrons, and the cars going by, but since we're from the city, it was like home. You can tune it out. If you are looking for silence, I say request a room in the back or stay elsewhere. If you are looking for a great hotel, with a wonderful staff, comfortable bed, clean room, and its centrally located, then this is the place! We'll definitely stay there again when we're in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Secret”
Reviews.Author: mickey3361
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days, March 25th and 26th, as a stop off before our cruise on Royal Caribbean. The hotel is right smack in the heart of Old San Juan, with wonderful restaurants and shops. We found that our room was clean and a very good value considering the alternatives. We were traveling with another couple who upgraded to a suite fronting on the road while we previously had read a TripAdvisor review and requested and got a room toward the rear of the hotel. Although our view was crappy, there was no noise of revelers on the street at night. Sheets were clean and the hotel staff takes pride in keeping their hotel spiffy. The hotel has a fabulous bar (hey guys, get some port wine next time, will ya!) on the roof top which gave one a view of the Old Town area and the sea in the disdance (harbor area). The front desk clerk was a bit of a sour puss, so management might want to entertain getting someone with a little personality. The porter was great...very helpful with luggage. I would defintely stay here again. The hotel has a restaurant as well, but we didn't try it. Although they serve a continental breakfast, it is a little on the cheapo side in terms of offerings, but at least it was something to get you going in the morning....

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mayla
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel in a very busy section of Old San Juan. Don't stay here if you want to sleep. The bar goers in the neighborhood party until 4 a.m., so be ready to be a night owl or stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: CDLG
Reviews.Content: Although its not an upscale hotel (as stated on this website), it is a very clean and friendly place in the heart of Old San Juan. The staff is very friendly and I would definately recommend this place for someone who is looking for an affordable place to stay that is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the accomodations and meals”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this lovely hotel. We were certainly very satisfied with the accomodations and meals on our first stay as we were this time around.Although this hotel is small in comparison to some of the other hotels, it is perfect for those who do not plan a vacation in Puerto Rico around staying in and around a hotel.Those who visit Puerto Rico should most certainly explore the island and all of its magnificent beauty as my husband and I try to do each time we visit. Thank you Mr. Juan San Emeterio for making our second visit to your establishment just as nice as the first. Mr.Mrs.M. Rivera Staten Island, NY

Reviews.Title: “Not what it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ROOMS The rooms are small, but functional. Once we realised that the smallest rooms didn't actually have windows(!), we moved to a back room. But this was little better than an airless hole with a very window with a view of a wall. The front rooms may be better, but at a price - and maybe even noisier. BREAKFAST The rooftop terrace is a very nice place for breakfast. Just a shame about the level of service and quality of food at breakfast - though the bananas were very nice, and at least it was included in the room rate. But worse still - the use of styrofoam cups and plastic plates in what should be a nice hotel really spoils things. LOCATION The location is great - although they really should pedestrianise the street permanently. The traffic is horrid. And don't expect to get ANY sleep on a Saturday night until 5:30am - you're right in the heart of San Juan's party district. Overall poor value.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Calvin1
Reviews.Content: We came to San Juan 2 days before our cruise. This was the third time we have stayed in Puerto Rico, but the first time in Old San Juan. Although the location of the hotel is good, the service was less than satisfactory. I made a reservation 6 months before we left and called 3 times prior to confirm since the hotel would not send anything in writing. When we arrived, they messed up the reservation. Although we were given a so-called upgraded room, this took about 2 hours and was very stressful after a long flight. The rooms are spartan to say the least and although clean, are no great shake. The continental breakfast consisted of left-over food from 7-11 and was awful. The best that can be said for the staff, including waitstaff at the restaurant, was that they were civil. All things considered, My wife and I will go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “The heart Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: jamster55
Reviews.Content: We would like to take this opportunity to thank Senor Juan San Emeterio for our wonderful stay at the Milano in Old San Juan. The rooms and the service provided by your staff for my family far exceeded our expectations. The location in the heart of the old city was certainly a plus with everything within a short walking distance. There is nothing that can replace old world charm. Again many thanks for your warm hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Hotel Milano in Old San Juan Puerto Rico. It was wonderful. A perfect place when you are spending the day shopping and touring Old San Juan. Much less expensive than El Convento and right in the middle of Old San Juan. The room was great and the roof top bar was lots of fun. Security during daytime and night time is perfect. Our room faced the street, which was a bit party like till 4am on a Friday morning, but with the air conditioning on and the window closed, it barely proved a problem. If you wish, you could have a room at the back of the hotel with less of the outside noise. What we really loved about it was that during the middle of shopping, we were just a 5 minute walk away from our hotel. There are parking lots nearby to park your car, but as we had rented one for our trip, we left it at AVIS at the airport and took a taxi in. There is no or little street parking in Old San Juan and it is much easier to have a taxi drop you off and pick you up. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd.stay at the Hotel Milano and it was just as memorable as the 1st.Even though it's been almost a year since then it was like 'old home week'.The staff remembered us and welcomed us like family.The rooftop restaurant/bar has excellent food and the view over San Juan harbor is great! It's this hotel,the friendly staff,and the gracious gentleman that owns it that makes us want to return to Puerto Rico again and again!Viva Sr.Juan !

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews about the Milano, but only through experiencing the ambiance, the employees and other guests, will you truly enjoy the San Juan experience!! We arrived to find a very nice, CLEAN and well kept small hotel with smiling and helpful personnel. Our recommendation is the front, double/double room. You have a great view of the downtown of Old San Juan. The roof-top restaurant makes a wonderful place to start the day with breakfast or end the day with a wonderful dinner and drinks. The food was exceptional (people from other hotels were coming there to eat!). There was no rush and you were treated with warm smiles and happy voices. We throughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again during our worldly travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: articshark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is in an excellent location in old San Juan. It is just up the street from the Parrot Club and several other great restaurants and bars. The views from the rooftop dining area and terrace is spectacular. The staff is helpful and attentive. My messages via email were promptly and courteously returned by the owner of the Hotel Milano. And although my room had only a small window, I was made aware of this BEFORE I confirmed the reservation. Given the great price on the room, in Old San Juan, I took the room anyway. The rooms were clean, the bath room immaculate. I would recommend this for any person traveling to San Juan and wishing to stay in the most culturally favorful area, Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Were Looking For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Milano to be exactly what we were looking for. It is located in the middle of Old San Juan, so it was close to everything we wanted to see and do in the three short days we were there. It is (i) a block away from some of the finest restaurants in OSJ (don't miss a dinner at the Dragonfly (a block away) and don't leave the Dragonfly without having their Peking Duck Nachos (we had a fabulous dinner/evening here one night, meeting the wonderful couple seated next to us who were celebrating their 24th wedding anniversary), (ii) several blocks from the very trendy shopping on Calle Cristo (with plenty of jewelry stores in between), and (iii) the (6-hour) foot tour we mapped for ourselves turned out to be a wide circle around the hotel. The only transportation we had to hire was the bus to tour El Yunque â€“ and we were picked up at the hotel. Although we heard one complaint from a guest, we found the boutique hotel charming. We had a room in the front -- it was clean, had two large windows, the air-conditioning was at a pretty comfortable level, room service was prompt and thorough, the staff was very, very helpful and friendly â€“ and it was reasonable. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “OK for this expensive area”
Reviews.Author: InMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano for 2 nights in February 2006. We paid $135. per night for a room with a queen size bed. For the same money we have stayed in better hotels in Rome and other locations so the price seemed comparatively steep. Other alternatives in Old San Juan were almost twice as much. First the negatives; the lobby was fine but certainly not quant. The elevator had a strange odor that we later discovered was coming from the upper floor kitchen. The room smelled of disinfectant but this faded over time. The room was furnished in dated, motel style furniture. The cable TV had 9 channels, most were Spanish speaking. There was a charge for local and 800 calls. We had three small windows at chest height that did open. The view was the plain walls from different buildings. Parking is not provided and is a couple of blocks away at a cost of $12.50 per day. We had been told that the rooms in front had larger windows but these rooms were $155, too high for this grade hotel. The continental breakfast was disappointing. There were pastries wrapped in plastic, similar to what you would find in a vending machine. Wheat and white bread were provided and a toaster for making toast with cream cheese and jellies. There was cereal in their store containers that you could fill with the provided milk. Less than fresh fruit, different juices, and coffee completed the assortment. It was strange that plates, utensils and cups were all plastic considering the location in the restaurant. The outdoor deck was filled with rather shabby plants and the view was of the unsightly roofs of the surrounding buildings. There was a view of the mountains in the distance. On the plus side this is a good location, walking distance to all of Old San Juan. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were of good size, the bathroom was clean and modern. The closet was large and could hold a few bags. The air conditioner worked well and there was a small refrigerator. The halls were quiet. In summary, there are not a lot of hotels to choose from in Old San Juan. The prices are comparatively high and you donâ€™t get a lot for your money. In this context the Milano is an acceptable choice. Probably we will try another property for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Simple and Affordable Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A pleasant way to spend time in Old San Juan because of the central location. However, a bit noisy at night for sleeping. Nice interaction with staff and owner. It felt safe and was extraordinarily clean.

Reviews.Title: “El Milano - The Practical Option”
Reviews.Author: YellowstoneGal
Reviews.Content: Finding the ideal place to stay in San Juan isnâ€™t easy. If youâ€™re not into the insulating mega-hotel/resorts in the Condado (tourist area near the ocean), or the all-inclusive, all-expensive giant resorts out of town, your best choice is to stay in the wonderful, lively, funky Old San Juan (Viejo San Juan). In OSJ you donâ€™t have too many choices either, but El Milano worked for us, far be it from perfect. First and foremost, contrary to its self-description, it is in no way, shape or form upscale. I would describe it as solidly middle-scale (Compare it to El Convento to see what I mean.) In spite of obvious daily efforts to keep the place clean there is also plenty of evidence of maintenance delayed too long: nearly every acoustic tile on our roomâ€™s dropped ceiling was stained, chipped, or askew. There were also enormous bubbles of paint, signs of chronic water damage, on our exterior wall. And the mid-80â€™s dÃ©cor in the room could definitely use a little updating! It was, however, basically clean, quiet enough, and safe. And speaking of our room, it was very small and claustrophobic. As described by other reviewers, there were no real windows, just two 12x12 glass bricks (see photo) high up. The new-looking air conditioner, though lacking any kind of thermostat, was effective at cooling but not at dehumidifying. Eventually we discovered, beneath the shorty curtains to either side of the glass bricks, tiny crank-open windows. Once we got those open, propped the curtains out of the way on the cranks, and started the A/C, we were able to achieve a comfy balance of temperature and humidity. We really felt the absence of that basic of tropical amenity, a ceiling fan! Also note: washcloths are NOT provided, nor are they available upon request. Extra hand towels were unstintingly forthcoming, however, and did the job.
