Also note: in five days, housekeeping never once replaced our bathroom glasses, and nor did they ever wipe off those little dots of toothpaste that unavoidably land on the mirror. Also as pointed out by others, breakfast in the roof-top Panorama Restaurante is very basic, but adequate to get you going, and you can take it al fresco with a bit of a view of the harbor and the flight path into Isla Grandeâ€™s small airport, if you enjoy watching little planes buzz back and forth. IF YOU WANT BETTER COFFEE, request espresso, put it in a full-size cup, and add hot milk (routinely provided) to make Puerto Rican cafÃ© con leche! To the restaurantâ€™s great credit, they handled a lunch for 12 we hosted there excellently, and the guests all enjoyed their truly Puerto Rican-style food (the mofongo is particularly good.) The rest of the hotel staff seemed pleasant but I would not describe them as exceptionally warm and friendly one way or the other. Juan San Emeterio, the very present and available owner, seemed business-like. The best thing about El Milano is itâ€™s incredible location. You can easily walk to all of OSJ, including El Morro and San Cristobal historic sites. Each evening we walked around the harbor along the Paseo de la Princessa (have dinner at the outdoor La Princessa restaurant down there â€“ foodâ€™s great!) or entertained ourselves in the shops and restaurants within the old city. We had no problems getting into and out of the Dona Fela pay parking lot along Recinto Sur, about 2 blocks from El Milano. Compared to Chicago, $3/hr to park is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Simple basic but great location”
Reviews.Author: Martina12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Milano Hotel in Feb 2006. The hotel is in a very good location, central to everything that Old San Juan has to offer. On arrival at the hotel we had a lack lusture welcome(the guy would not get off the phone!). Our room we found to be very basic and I would think that the carpets would need a good cleaning. And as for view that we were promised, that was non existant , we were looking into the back of a building and the windows were so high up anyway!! But for the money it was worth it. There is wireless internet, but you have to go all the way up to the 4th floor restaurant to get any signal. The continental breakfast was a bonus and what you would expect really. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Old San Juan hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a cruise out of San Juan and had booked the Milano Hotel for 2 nights prior to boarding our ship. The hotel has great ambience-clean-large rooms-good air conditioning. Elevator to the 4th floor. It has a great restaurant on the 5th floor-we intended to just have one meal there but ended up having all our meals here. A great menu-interesting scenery-excellent food and delightful staff. Walk out the front door and there are neat shops where ever you turn. A very easy walk to the cruise dock with a little park almost under the bow of the cruise ship tied up. We found the San Juan people extremely polite-helpful-friendly never pushy. This hotel is NOT a Hilton or Sheridan but just a nice local older hotel that we would certainly return to and send clients to at any time. Our thanks to Juan for his E mails to us prior to arriving from chilly Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay if you'll just sleep there”
Reviews.Author: claudinem
Reviews.Content: We just came back from PR, we spent our first two days in Rincon, and then went to San Juan on a Saturday to meet up with friends for a day and a half (they were leaving on a cruise Sunday). We did not want to spend a lot of money for a hotel, since we knew we wouldn't be in the room at all. We had been told when we made the reservations that all they had left was one room with a full-size bed, on the smoking floor. We took it (after being assured that the room wouldn't reek of cigarettes), as we were really happy to have found this hotel for under $100 when everything else in San Juan was going for double. We figured for one night, we could deal with the full-size bed. After having stayed there, I feel one night is the most we could have dealt with. The room was clean, but it was very small, had no windows (they had not told us that), and the AC was weak. There was a hint of cigarette smell, but we didn't feel that it reeked. I am sure every room is different, though, and some probably do reek. So long story short, I have to say, for the amount of time we spent in the room, it was really nice when we checked out and only had to lay out $98. Would we go back? Only if we were facing a similar situation, and were going to use the hotel to sleep and shower. I do think it's probably better than some of the other inns and small hotels I read about.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed in the hotel for a night after our cruise. the hotel is updated, clean and the rooms are a decent size. the staff are very friendly and accomodating. the continental breakfast includes different cereals, fruit, bread, toast and juice, a lot more than i expected. the location of the hotel was perfect, right in the heart of old san juan. we just loved staying in the old city and really recommend it. everything to see in the old city is within walking distance. we must admit that the price is a bit high but after doing research we found that anything cheaper would of been disgusting and gross. any tours you would like to do can be booked at the front desk. taxi prices are fixed and its about $19.50 from the airport to the hotel (excluding bags)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: mamakpk
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat disappointed with the Milano. We loved the location and were in the heart of Viejo San Juan--walking distance to all the sights. We spent almost no time in our room which was good because the room was below average. The first room we were given HAD NO WINDOWS. None. It had 2 glass blocks near the ceiling. We had requested a city view room but this room had no view at all. After complaining we were given a street side room which at least had some fresh air but was very noisy at night. The rooms had no character at all. The continental breakfast consisted of coffee, wonder bread and pre-packaged powdered doughnuts. Skip it and head to a local bakery instead. All in all, while the location was fantastic, the Milano itself was no great shakes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but 4 Stars for value, 2 stars for comfort”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoP9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milano for two nights on a weekend in Feb. '05. This hotel is a good value if you want to be in Old San Juan. The room was adequate and clean enough and you can't beat the price in Old town. The included breakfast was subpar (they were out of juice, bread, etc.) but we didn't stay there for that reason and there's lots of weekend street noise. Two things you should know: 1. If you're not a smoker, make sure they don't put you on the smoking floor 'cause it reeks! They originally gave us a smoking room even though I specifically reserved 'non'. They did switch rooms for us but you should confirm this when you book and again just before arrival. 2. This being San Juan on a weekend, there was a LOT of drunken street noise, sounds of bottles breaking in the street, horns and car alarms blasting, etc. until sometime after whenever the bars closed. Ask for an inside room if you want to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, outstanding staff - seek out the owner!”
Reviews.Author: BosBiz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury accommodations, look elsewhere. If you want to support a boutique urban hotel that has heart and soul personified by the charming owner - Juan Emeterio, then this is the place for you in Old San Juan. Emailed the hotel giving them a heads up it was a special trip (10th wedding anniversary and wife's birthday). Juan took the initiative and arranged for a lovely dinner at the rooftop restaurant, complete with wine and a very nice chocolate cake brought in from outside. Juan also joined us â€“ both the food and the company were treats. Juan can often be seen loading luggage for guests or at the front desk helping out when the staff are busy. Very nice to see this kind of personal touch, so rare today. The rooms are comfortable, convenient to everything. It _is_ an urban hotel, so depending on your location, you may hear things from the street at night - that to me is part of the charm. I get to travel all over the world on business, and will always seek out places like Hotel Milano whenever I can. Juan is a big part of that. Ask for him and say hello if you can - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good for singles”
Reviews.Author: chilibrarian
Reviews.Content: I traveled solo to San Juan in November and stayed at the Milano. The staff was helpful and very accommodating making good suggestions for sightseeing and shopping. The location in Old San Juan is convenient to shopping and restaurants. I enjoyed the hotel's restaurant, and I didn't have to spend taxi fare to leave the area in search of other dining options. The ferry to the Bacardi Museum is in walking distance, and the bus terminal for buses to the Condado, Ocean Park area is nearby as well. The hotel is clean, comfortable and a good choice for a single lady traveler. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skuehl57
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed with the wonderful people of the Hotel Milano before and after a cruise in San Juan - it was a great base to explore viejo San Juan and so convenient to the small restaurants, music and all the wonderful rum that was around. many thanks to the staff for all their help and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Little Jewel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milano is a terrific find-it's small & quaint, with lots of character & very economical. Located so conveniently in the center of Old San Juan, the shops, restaurants and sites are all within walking distance, so you never have to deal with cars, cabs, traffic, etc. The free trolley travels along Fortaleza street right in front of the hotel and is easy to catch. The rooftop restaurant is particularly nice in the evening with a view of the bay. We loved Hotel Milano & plan to return whenever we go to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Time at Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: JSO60
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a few days at Hotel Milano and were well taken care of by Juan San Emeterio and his staff. The hotel is in a beautiful old building. The rooms are not lavish, but comfortably furnished (we came to see Old San Juan, not a hotel room). More important, to me at least, the rooms were immaculate. I've stayed at many large chain hotels that weren't kept as clean as the room here was. We had a wonderful dinner at the Panorama roof top restaurant, and we enjoyed the mornings we went up there for the continental breakfast (the only downside to the continental breakfast is that you would miss going around the corner to Mallorca for breakfast). The hotel is conveniently located to all of the sights and experiences of Old San Juan. San Cristobal is just a short walk from the hotel. El Morro is a little further away, but can be walked. If you want to shop, there are plenty of opportunities (talk to the staff at the front desk they'll tell you who to talk to in some of the stores). The hotel staff was helpful recommending dinner suggestions (there are some great restaurants nearby - though do eat at the hotel too), and in setting up additional travel arrangements to see other parts of Puerto Rico (a trip to El Yunque, transportation to Fajardo). On my return to Old San Juan (which hopefully will be soon) I will return to Hotel Milano.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano - a wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: chargers
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with Hotel Milano, a small boutique hotel in Old San Juan.([--] Rooms are simple, clean and reasonable, $95 including tax with a 10% AAA discount for a queen including generous continental breakfast. There is a nice roof top restaurant with excellent typical food, view of the harbor, and lots of atmosphere at night. The staff was extremely helpful.Its central location is a plus. You can easily walk anywhere in San Juan from there. There are many restaurant right around it. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “delightful ambience”
Reviews.Author: sandychat
Reviews.Content: We recently spent six days in Old San Juan and staying at the Milano made it particularly pleasant. If you like fine old hotels, this is your cup of tea. It is well maintained, offers continental breakfast on the rooftop restaurant from which you can see the port of Old San Juan. It is convenient to reasonable parking (and on-street parking for the diligent) and a perfect starting point for strolling around the old city, which is a delight to the eye. It is also convenient to the cruise ship facilities. Concierge staff was helpful and professional. There was some spiritually uplifting material available in the room for the guest so inclined; for us it added to the pleasing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really what makes is great. We were right in the middle of Old San Juan, just up the street from several fantastic restaurants. The rooms were basic, but clean and comfortable. The air conditioning in the room was either on or off so it got pretty chilly at night, but that didn't bother us too much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was also basic, but satisfying and we were thankful not to have to pay for breakfast somewhere else. Overall, I would definitely stay there again as it was a bargain compared to other places near there.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel milano for 1 night before our cruise---we absolutely loved the hotel and the view from the resturant at the top of the hotel was fabulous!!! Juan and all of the staff went out of their way to accomadate us for the one day we were there. i unfourtunatly had luggge lost at the airport and the staff made sure that when it did arrive i was in a safe place and they immeidately got a message to me that it was found and safe i will definatly recommend this hotel to everyone who is traveling in San Juan thank you for everything

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milano twice, for three days at the front end and a day at the back end of a Caribbean cruise, and loved it. We wanted to stay in Old San Juan for the sightseeing, colors, and history, and were glad to find a small, local, friendly hotel right in the heart of it all. Hotel Milano's location in the middle of Old San Juan was perfect--everything from historical sights to night clubs and great restaurants are within easy walking distance. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooftop restaurant is comfortable, and the food is good. We had a "front" room overlooking Forteleza Street, which was just fine, ample but not luxurious. This is not a "chain" hotel, which we try to avoid on trips, and we were glad to find a small, friendly, locally owned and operated hotel in the heart of everything. Hotel Milano fit the bill for us, twice. Old San Juan really rocks until the very wee hours on weekends, so some may find the noise from nearby clubs bothersome, but we didn't mind. In fact, one of the waiters in the restaurant was so friendly and nice to us that he asked us to join him and his girl friend for a night out at a really great night club after he got of work! You'd never find that at a big chain or resort hotel. Would I stay there again? Without a doubt and with no misgivings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Well Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peregrine15
Reviews.Content: The hotel Milano is the least expensive hotel in Old San Juan. It is quiet, has an excellent roof top restaurant and is well-maintained. Itâ€™s in a great location to enjoy the delights of Old San Juan. The rooms are small but quite adequate â€“ ours had a view of an airshaft but it was clean and comfortable. If you enjoy Old San Juan the way it should be enjoyed, you will spend very few conscious moments in your room. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the Hotel Milano before going on a cruise out of San Juan. For this purpose my selection was a great one. The location in Old San Juan was perfect for walking around this area. The staff were super nice, the hotel was very clean and the crowning touch was dinner on the roof-top at the Panorama Grill. What a fabulous (and reasonably priced) meal! My room was a small, inside one which was okay for one night, but if staying longer I would opt for a larger room. However, I couldn't beat the price--$72 (plus tax) using my AARP deduction. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small boutique hotel right in the middle of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano is a charming, beautiful hotel and very well located. It offers very pleasant rooms and the staf can not be more pleasant, helpful and friendly. They make me feel at home! Specially enjoyable is the rooftop restaurant with its great view, where I can enjoy a drink and relax after a day of work! This hotel is a true gem in San Juan! Deerfield Beach, Florida

Reviews.Title: “just what i needed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am currently looking over the balcony at san juan and the cruise ships, listening to some great music in the Panorama bar. Hotel Milano has been a wonderful week. HANDS DOWN I will stay here again if I am visiting Puerto Rico. The staff has been more than friendly (we have dropped off our laptops to the front desk every morning, and every afternoon when we walk back in they hand it to us with a smile). housekeeping has been amazing, I asked for a couple more towels and she actually went to the dryer and got me fresh hot ones instead of the ones that were folded on her cart. And even the owner Juan has been amazing. Would not expect to see him working the front desk, but there he has been. I honesly have no complaints about this place. you read here that some people comment that "the staff isnt friendly" (they are) or that its to loud (it isnt, but if it is, its becuase you are in old san juan.). and if there is a problem, talk to Juan or anyone else. If you are looking for a nice comfortable hotel in the middle of san juan, with clubs and bars withing stumbling distance, this is the place to go. if you are looking for a place in old san juan, with historical monuments within walking distance, this is the place to go. If you are looking for a place with a bunch of rude faceless employees, a manager who just takes your money at check in, that you will end up paying 200 a night for, this is not the place to go. I was worried when i saw the price, trying to figure out how it can be nice and cheap. its cuz its comfy. the bed was nice, the water was hot, and the mini fridge was great (could use a few microwaces in the halls somewhere, thats about it) and you are getting MORE than you paid for. this type of boutique would run you a mint in the states. only thing, if you want to go to the beach, make sure you walk the half-mile to the bus stop, this is Old San Juan, not Isla Verde or the other beaches. This is historical and party. I love it, and will be coming back again and staying right here. Make sure while you are here, you talk with Juan. Wonderful guy, and read some of his stories (they are in each room).

Reviews.Title: “A Sleepless Night in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: kdruschel
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't see why this hotel has gotten such great reviews. It was the right location - in the heart of Old San Juan and up the street from some fabulous restaurants (try Aguaviva!) - but the rooms are dingy and run-down, and all the rooms in the front of the hotel are directly above a pounding disco. It got started around 11pm and didn't stop until well after 4am - we know because it kept us awake the entire time. As for the rooftop restaurant, the food was merely okay, and service was quite poor. The view was mainly of a coal hill across the harbor. Next time, I'll try another location in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be greeted by the desk as though we were family. A quick trip to our room and the bellman brought our luggage. Friendly and effecent is the proper description for the staff. The rooftop resturant excelled in many ways compared to other resturants in Old San Juan. We dined several nites there and were shown respect and served well. Sr Juan San Emererio, when he found we were celebrating our 2nd anniversary, bought a round of drinks for our table. A kind and gracious host! Though the hotel is a few years old our room was clean and well kapt. the halls also kept neat and clean. Slow elevators only added to the atmosphere of the hotel. Our thanks to Migal and the rest of the staff for a Wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great treatment, accomodations at Hotel Milano”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The day we arrived for our honeymoon, planning to spend a night in Old San Juan's Hotel Milano before catching our cruise ship, I left my camera in the cab. The man at the desk very kindly took our stub (hotels are arranged for by a central dispatcher at the airport), got the name of the cab company and contacted them, assuring us he'd do his best to get it back and suggesting we enjoy our limited time in Old San Juan. We checked into our room. No view but clean, with a porter taking our bags. The porter was every bit as considerate and positive as the man at the desk, and wished us a good day. The cabbie returned the camera to the airport, we were happy to find out from the man behind the front desk later that day when we returned. We were thrilled when the man called the airport for us and asked for the camera to be dropped off at the hotel, and they agreed. We took off for dinner and a walking tour of downtown, the waterfront and the information/free rum drink(s) center, and returned to have our camera back! Not only were the room clean and the sheets soft, the air conditioning was blasting cool air out by the time we got in. So much so, we had to turn it down in the middle of the night. The Milano staff considerately suggested tours we might like and assured us it was safe to walk throughout old San Juan, which it proved to be. The next morning we enjoyed the continental breakfast in their rooftop restaurant, enjoying great views of water, a cruise ship in harbor and the rooftop life of that gorgeous, vastly restored and colorful city. I can't say enough things about the impression the employees and accomodations made on me. The closest thing to a negative I can come up with is that there's was no view from our room, just walls of nearby buildings. When we were ready to leave, the morning lobby staff volunteered to chain our bags after we checked out, to make the most of our last few hours before catching the cruise ship. We took advantage of the offer and came back to find our bags safe and sound, and headed off to our honeymoon cruise! A room with a queen size will cost us $85.50 plus $77.0 room tax. Well wortht, too!

Reviews.Title: “Undeserved Hype - this is like a budget Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't understand how this hotel has received such glowing reviews. This hotel is on par with what you would expect if you paid $39.99 for any roadside hotel in the US. Actually, maybe not even that decent. When we stayed at the Hotel Milano it was very hot outside. The lobby felt great; the A/C was on high. However, when we got to our room we realized that the only place in the building with constant A/C is the lobby. The rest of the hotel was very hot and stuffy. Each room has its own A/C unit, but ours was just moving around hot air until we called down to complain. In response to our call, the man at the front desk said he would send up a remote that would make the room cooler - well, he did just that! We had to walk to the elevator closest to our room, and when the doors opened, there lay the remote, by itself, on the floor of the empty elevator. We had to use that remote to make our A/C blow cold air, and then ship it back down to the front desk using the same empty-elevator technique. Hardly 4 star service! And at that our room was still not as cool as we would have liked. Aside from that, the alarm clock is bolted down to the bedside table as if theft is a regular occurrence, the bathroom is 100 degrees since there is no central air, and the street below is noisy - we heard people partying until 3 am outside. The breakfast the next morning is free, and the rooftop deck area is pretty. But the free breakfast, again, is basic at best. Cereal that you eat directly from the plastic container, juice, toast you can make yourself if you choose to, and oranges, apples and bananas in a bowl. Sufficient, but definitely not excellent or above average - I honestly have no clue as to how a hotel that charges almost $100/night in the middle of hurricane season gets such great reviews for such lousy services and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milano is a particularly beautiful,charming hotel. Especially enjoyable was the rooftop restaurant with its unparalleled views. And, the Hotel's location in historic Old San Juan is the perfect setting. Moreover, every one of the Hotel employees with whom I had contact could not have been more polite, more helpful, more professional. They made me feel not only that I was a valued guest, but that I was, also, among friends. The Hotel Milano is truly a jewel, truly a gem, and I look forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bono9763
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and ending of our cruise (2 nights before and 1 after) in August 2005. It was the perfect location to launch a walking tour of Viejo San Juan (the old city.) The hotel was always close and provided a welcome respite from the heat and humidity. The room was pleasant, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the complimentary continental breakfast was served on the top floor dining room, whose patio had a marvelous view of the bay. This hotel is not very far from the airport, about 15 minutes, and the price of the room was very reasonable compared to fancier ones in the area. We loved being able to walk along the city wall at night and join in the festivities with many of the local residents, who seem to come here on weekends to stroll the streets, enjoy the music and taste the local treats. It was also close to the ferry, which took us to Catano and Hato Rey for a view of the bay. We would definitely come back here for our next trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying at Milano Hotel was a very nice experience. My friends and me enjoyed the staff and the hotel. Nice, big, clean rooms. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it's best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly recommended to me by a friend. My family and I stayed on the night of August 2, 2005, the first night of our vacation from Miami, FL. The rooms were nice, spacious and the rate was excellent. The hotel is in a great location, right in the middle of Old San Juan with restaurants, shops and the Fort within walking distance. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. I also met the owner who welcomed me with a smile and had the pleasure of shaking his hand. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to San Juan was ever so special because of the wonderful experience we had at the Milano. The room was quite spacious and exceptionally clean. We loved having breakfast and an evening nitecap in the rooftop restaurant overlooking the quaint city of Old San Juan. The best of all was the hospitality we received by all the employees. It was like staying with family. We will certainally stay again on our next visit to Puerto Rico. Next time hopefully we can stay a week instead of just a few days. Cudos to all who made our visit so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Small, Lovely Place in a Lovely City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The perfect "no-frills" hotel right in the middle of Old San Juan, Hotel Milano is located on Calle Fortaleza, within walking distance to everything. You can see the entire old city in one day by foot, two days if you must go down every little winding cobblestone street, like I do. I stayed in a small room facing Fortaleza Street for $125 per night in July, which is off season. This is what I got for my money: air conditioning, a large window, cable TV, a small refrigerator, plenty of closet space, a bathroom with shower stall and a queen bed. The hotel restaurant is on the rooftop and overlooks the city and the bay. All guests are entitled to a free continental breakfast. You can get rooms with smaller beds, without windows or with windows facing the back of the building for amounts ranging from $80 to $115 off season. I found the staff to be very friendly and considerate. There is some room for improvement, however, and I have the following suggestions for the management: 1) The lighting in my room was poor. It was difficult for me to read in bed or anywhere in the room, and I love to read. The four lamps had bulbs which gave poor light, and there was no overhead light. 60 watt bulbs (frosted) should be used in all lamps. 2) The air conditioner has no temperature control. In the "on" position, the room became quite cold. I had to shut the air off and on constantly to control the temperature. 3) The lobby is freezing. I find this to be a problem in many hotels, not just this one. Although I was in San Juan in July, it did rain, and sometimes the weather was warm, not exceeding hot.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable rooms. Honest and courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night at the Hotel Milano on our way to the British Virgin Islands. The room was clean and cool (important for June in the Caribbean). We had dinner at the hotel's rooftop restaurant. The view was great, there was a nice, cool breeze and the food was good. We left a camera in our room and realized it while we were at the San Juan airport. We called the hotel and asked them if they had the camera, and they did. They said they would mail it to our home. It actually made it home before we did. We sincerely appreciate the Hotel Milano's professionalism in dealing with our camera that we left behind. The hotel is in the heart of Old San Juan. It was convenient to shopping and site seeing. It is also convenient to night life. I read that Puerto Ricans love the nightlife and I can confirm from hearing the nightlife well into the morning that this is true. Again, I appreciate the professionalism of the staff at the Hotel Milano. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just went to Puerto Rico and had the best time ever. For what I payed for this Hotel I was expecting a dump, but I was so pleasantly surprised, it was pretty and very clean and everyone was great. Check in was a breeze with no problem and our room was great. If you are like me and like to be out doing fun stuff this is the place to go. It is the middle of old San juan, which is gorgeous, it is walking distance from everything. Senor Frogs is right around the corner and so are 25cent bus rides to go anywhere. The staff at this Hotel know all the great places to go and help you get there. The tour guide(Peter at Eco Tours) we went with came right to the door to pick us up to take us to the rainforest, snorkelling, cruises, and don't miss the luminescent bay at night! If you are looking to have a good time this is the Hotel to go to. Our flight didn't leave until 12 at night and they were nice enought to hold our bags all day so we could enjoy the day. I'm definitly coming back. Thanks for the memories! Mrs. LeFave

Reviews.Title: “Smart Choice”
Reviews.Author: mvalette
Reviews.Content: What the Hotel Milano lacks in "luxury" it makes up for in location. I stayed in room 406. Our room was located in the front of the hotel. We rarely heard any noise from the street and considering there are a number of bars and clubs in the area not to mention the port, I was pleasantly surprised. Our television had HBO and a number of other english speaking channels as well as spanish. I didn't take advantage of the free continental breakfast, but the one time I went up to purchase a cafe con leche it was given to me on the house. Our room was clean, our bathroom spacious and we had a refrigerator. If you're the type of traveler who isn't hung up on bells and whistles, I would suggest the Hotel Milano. I know I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasure in the heart of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a small boutique hotel in the heart of Old San Juan, the Hotel Milano is the place for you! We only stayed a day or so before we boarded a cruise (a short taxi ride away), but really loved being able to walk around, come back for a cool rest or drink, go back out, etc. The rooms aren't overly glamorous, but they're definitely fine. We were in an inside room, which I think might be better because of city night noise (bars, etc.). With the tall ceiling and little ventilation window, it didn't seem "inside" at all. The best part is the roof-top restaurant bar. Very relaxed; we would go up there just to sit, or maybe order a drink...or have a whole meal. Whatever we wanted to do was fine with the staff. The whole hotel just has a lot of character, the owner is a fascinating person to talk to, the mini-grand lobby is a wonderful eclectic mix of classic elements, modern art and relaxed Puerto Rico. If this is the kind of place you're looking for, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “So So Room/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: caribegrl
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel was that it was quaint and small. The lobby was very pretty and clean. The only Elevator was very small and only fit 2 people with luggages so we had to take turns going up. The room was facing the front of the street and we were informed that the club that was next to this hotel was shut down because of the noise and now there is a gift shop there. The entrance to the room was a very thin corridor where you squeezed in but the rest of the room was of normal size. The bathroom was small so one person at a time went into the bathroom. I will try to include a picture of the view from my room. The continental breakfast was a very simple cereal, toast, juice, milk and danishes. The view of the bay was very nice UNTIL we looked at the wall and noticed a roach crawling down on the wall. We left and did not return for continental breakfast again. What a shame!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeBostonJoe
Reviews.Content: The staff works very hard to make sure that everything is perfect. This is a small "boutique-like" hotel where rooms are VERY clean, simple and quite comfortable. The location cannot be beat. Views are only available from a few rooms (we stayed in one) but it doesn't matter since Old San Juan is right out your door (this hotel is in the heart). Simple continental breakfast with a beautiful roof top dining area. Big bathroom and a refrigerator. Would love to see a safe in the room. Very accomodating and pleasant staff. We would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so lovely! It is small enough to make each guest feel important. Besides the perfect location, in the very heart of historic San Juan, the rooms were clean and restful.The restaurant on the top floor was my favorite place to eat in Puerto Rico! The outside section of the restaurant is covered and spacious and has a great view of the harbor. The food and service were flawless. I remember every meal as an event! The owner ,Mr. Juan San Emeterio, is an exceptionally gracious host whose intent is to create an elegant and personal experience for each guest.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milano...a special place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for visiting this charming, exciting, historic town. From the roof top restaurant ....the breeze, the morning sun, watching the cruise ship, to the friendly, helpful staff and the nice rooms, the Hotel Milano was our perfect home in Old Town. We loved getting to know the owner, Juan. We agree with the positive letters posted. We highly recommend this small, intimate hotel. Sue and Jerry Johnson, Seattle, Washington

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Beach506
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about the Hotel Milano after seeing some of the negative reviews, but we had a great experience! The room was just fine- spacious enough, small windows, strong A/C, clean. Basically, it's all about location! You really can't beat it- it's central to everything. A couple of times, we forgot things while sightseeing, and all we had to do was trot back to the hotel, and ten minutes later, we were on the go again! The rooftop restaurant is pretty subpar though- have a drink up there for the view, but don't waste your money on the entrees. really, it's kind of a rip-off. We decided to eat there because we were dead tired- but I definitely would not do so again.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan's Goodwill Ambassador ! !”
Reviews.Author: Esquires
Reviews.Content: April 25-2005 This is a follow up review to our previous pre-review ( see below ) of our stay at Hotel Milano in San Juan Puerto Rico. If there is one hotel that deserves recognition as the " Goodwill Ambassador " to San Juan, it is the management and staff of Hotel Milano in Old San Juan. ( Note to the San Juan Tourist Office; please make a well deserved notation on your files regarding Hotel Milano ) From the moment we checked in, the welcome, the rooms, and the overall impression and location of this hotel gives you the feeling of care and appreciation for their guests. We stayed for 2 nights on two different weeks and it felt like " home ". From the reception, the spacious rooms, dinner under the stars at the 5th floor restaurant/patio, it was an absolute delight. ( a feeling that was shared by all the hotel guests we met during our stay ) We highly recommend the Hotel Milano to all who visit Old San Juan, be it a short or long visit, you will not be disappointed; it is an absolute delight! Sincerely Peter Crawford Richard Gravett Toronto - Canada San Juan: Hotel Milano: "Impressed !!" April 2, 2005: A TripAdvisor Member, Toronto Canada Check prices with: I stayed at this hotel in: April, 2005 I traveled to this hotel with: spouse/partner I recommend this hotel for: business travelers, singles, gay and lesbian My visit was for: leisure We have not had the good fortune of being a guest at the Hotel Milano yet ; ( but we have reservations for 2 nights in April 2005 ) Allow us to say that, when we made our booking/reservations, the level of excellence of service we received from the reservation staff and management at the Hotel Milano is impressive, personal and professional. I believe we made a good choice by selecting the Hotel Milano; we are looking forward to our stay! Hasta Luego ! Peter Crawford Richard Gravett Canada

Reviews.Title: “The bes”
Reviews.Author: rogerrenaissance
Reviews.Content: As Old San Juan is the jewel, the crossroads of the caribbean europe and the americas, hotel milano is the jewel of old san juan. The roof, a fabulous retaurant and intimate bar, is a great place to hide when the cruise ships disgorge there thousands of souvineer hunting touritas.but don't worry they never look up! The ships sail before San Juan dinner and you can emerge from the Milano unscathed and turn left, for some of the finest restaurants and clubs are a few steps to the east Go west for fine shopping and art everwhere. When your exhausted retire to the Milano and sleep well knowing you have saved hundreds a night and few know this secret San Juan Spot
